cards.title: Opening Keynote

tags.title: Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description: Explore the latest product announcements, features, and innovations that will help you bring your creative vision to life. Adobe leaders, including Shantanu Narayen, chair and chief executive officer, and David Wadhwani, president, digital media business, preview what’s ahead.
cards.sessionTitle: Opening Keynote

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Adobe’s Vision: Control, Collaboration, and Creative Freedom
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
David Wadhwani is responsible for the success of Adobe’s global Digital Media business across Adobe Creative Cloud and Adobe Document Cloud, including all product management, product marketing, engineering, strategic partnerships, customer support and to go-to-market across geographies. This includes iconic software brands such as Photoshop, Lightroom, Illustrator, InDesign and Acrobat.

David was most recently a Venture Partner at Greylock Partners. Prior to joining Greylock, he was president and CEO of AppDynamics, leading the company as it transformed to a SaaS-first business and became one of the fastest-growing enterprise software companies at the time.

This is David’s second tour of duty at Adobe. He joined Adobe in 2005 through the company’s acquisition of Macromedia, Inc., where he had been vice president of developer products. As senior vice president and general manager of Adobe’s Digital Media business, David played an instrumental role in advancing the company’s category leadership, expanding into new markets and contributing to its successful transformation to a cloud-based subscription business.

David holds a bachelor’s degree in computer science from Brown University and serves on the Brown computer science department advisory board. He is also on the digital advisory board of The Metropolitan Museum of Art and on the board of trustees for StoryCorps and the Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Shantanu Narayen is chairman and chief executive officer of Adobe, one of the largest and most diversified software companies in the world.

Adobe’s mission is to change the world through digital experiences, serving a large customer base from students to business communicators to the world’s largest enterprises. As CEO, Shantanu has transformed the company into an industry innovator by pioneering a cloud-based subscription model for its creative suite, establishing the global standard for digital documents, and creating and leading the explosive digital experience category. Today, he’s driving the company’s strategy to unleash creativity for all, accelerate document productivity, and power digital business.

Under Shantanu’s leadership, Adobe has achieved record revenue and industry recognition for its inclusive, innovative, and exceptional workplace, including being continuously named a Great Place to Work and a Most Admired Company by Fortune.

Shantanu joined Adobe in 1998 as vice president and general manager of its engineering technology group. He became president and COO in 2005, CEO in 2007, and chairman of the board in 2017.

Shantanu is vice chairman of the US-India Strategic Partnership Forum and sits on the board of Pfizer. He previously served as a director of Dell and is a past member of the U.S. President’s Management Advisory Board. Shantanu has been recognized by several publications as one of the world’s leading executives, including Barron’s World’s Best CEOs and Fortune Businessperson of the Year lists, and named a Top CEO by Glassdoor based on employee feedback. He is a recipient of India’s civilian honor Padma Shri and the Economic Times Global Indian of the Year award.

Before joining Adobe, Shantanu held product development roles at Apple and Silicon Graphics before cofounding an early photo-sharing startup, Pictra.

Shantanu holds five patents. He has a bachelor’s degree in electronics engineering from Osmania University, a master’s degree in computer science from Bowling Green State University and a master’s degree in business administration from the University of California at Berkeley’s Haas School of Business. Shantanu once represented India in sailing at an Asian regatta.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Idea to Output: Firefly and Premiere on iPhone
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description: Paul Trani is Principal Director Evangelist at Adobe, where he is committed to empowering designers to expand creative boundaries and embrace emerging technologies. With more than 30 years of experience as an award-winning visual designer, instructor, and public speaker, Paul has established a global reputation for inspiring and educating creative communities. Beyond his professional endeavors, he is an avid enthusiast of racquet sports—including, of course, pickleball.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote
Super Session: Future-Proofing Your Design Career in the Age of AI

eventSpeakers.description: Danielle Morimoto leads the design team responsible for Adobe Firefly and Generative AI on the Machine Intelligence and New Technologies team at Adobe. She helps define the most compelling experiences and emerging technologies by uncovering untapped potential, ultimately identifying how people could be using Adobe in the future. She’s an avid road cyclist, NBA Golden State Warriors fan and lover of ice cream.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Chief Technology Officer & SVP Creative Products Group, Digital Media

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Idea to Output: Firefly and Premiere on iPhone
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Ely Greenfield is the Chief Technology Officer and SVP of Adobe’s Creative Products Group, overseeing Creative Cloud, including flagship applications like Photoshop, Premiere Pro, and Illustrator, as well as generative AI initiatives like Adobe Firefly.

As CTO of Adobe’s Digital Media business, he drives technology strategy, fostering innovation across Creative Cloud and Document Cloud. ​ Ely led the launch of Adobe Firefly, the company’s first commercially safe generative AI model, now integrated into Adobe’s workflows to empower users of all skill levels.

Ely also oversees Adobe Research, focusing on AI, creative design tools, and immersive media. ​ Before rejoining Adobe, Ely was CTO of AppDynamics, leading engineering for scalable systems. ​ Earlier, he spent 20 years at Adobe and Macromedia, contributing to product development and business incubation, including Adobe Express. ​Ely holds a computer science degree from Brown University.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Idea to Output: Firefly and Premiere on iPhone
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Lucy is a brand designer and Adobe Evangelist from Wales, UK. She launched her studio, Lugi Design Studio, in 2019 after building on her design skills while studying at the Manchester School of Architecture. Since then, she’s worked with clients around the world, blending creative expertise with strategic thinking to craft brand identities with purpose. Alongside her studio, Lucy has built a vibrant online community where she shares design insights and inspiration with fellow creatives.

Lucy joined Adobe two years ago and has since spoken at events across Europe, including taking the stage as a keynote speaker at MAX London earlier this year. Drawing on her experience in both design and community building, she’s passionate about sharing what she’s learned and inspiring the next generation of creatives to make their ideas happen.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Idea to Output: Firefly and Premiere on iPhone
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description: Kelly, a California native and Detroit transplant, is a world traveler and design innovator. As an Experience Designer at Adobe, she tackles complex challenges with fresh, technical solutions, contributing to Adobe Firefly and Generative AI for Audio and Video. Dedicated to engaging with creatives, Kelly builds connections with artists both in Detroit and globally. Outside of work, she enjoys photography, video production, and interior design.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Deepa Subramaniam is Vice President, Product Marketing for Creative Professionals at Adobe, where she is responsible for driving Adobe’s digital imaging, photography, video, design and generative AI businesses forward.

Deepa has over 18 year's experience leading product teams to collaboratively build innovative digital products as well as a proven track record in strategy and execution, while acting as a frequent advisor to founders, CEOs and CPOs on product strategy, product execution and organizational optimization.

Prior to Adobe, Deepa served as the ACLU’s first ever Chief Technology and Digital Officer where she led the Digital, Engineering, Product and Design teams, as Vice President of Product and Design at Kickstarter where she helped revamp the platform for the next decade of creative campaigning and as Director of Product at Hillary for America, where her she led product development for online fundraising, voter registration and get out the vote initiatives.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Sr. Design Evangelist for Next Gen Creative Pros

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Hello everyone, my name is Michael Fugoso. If you are familiar with my work you probably know me via my Instagram alias FUGSTRATOR . I am an illustrator/designer originally from San Diego, now functioning in Austin, TX. I've mainly done illustrative work for some of the largest aerospace companies out there, like NASA, Boeing, Blue Origin, Ariane Group and more, and I've also done plenty of official illustrative work for massive companies like Oracle, IBM, Salesforce, Volvo and many more. And I'm now thrilled to be on the Global Evangelism team at Adobe!

Most of my life I wasn't in the professional artist/designer world. Through age 29 I lived what is perceived by many a “normal life,” going through business school and eventually working as a banker. At age 30 the arts called to me and my life changed from there.

I am 40 years old now. In the ten years of creating and illustrating a ton of spaceships, rockets, jet planes, and robots, I luckily found what I love in this latter part of my life.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Principal Director, Creative Cloud Evangelist and Community Advocate

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description: Terry White, a celebrated professional with a 29-year career at Adobe, serves as a Principal Director, Photography Evangelist, and Community Advocate, expertly leading and inspiring both teams and Adobe’s vast user community. A prominent speaker at events like TEDx and Photoshop World, award-winning photographer, and the 34th inductee into the Photoshop Hall of Fame, Terry also connects with audiences via his popular YouTube Photography Masterclass. His authorship and tech exploration further underscore his comprehensive expertise and influence in the creative and tech worlds.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Sr. Quality Engineer and Animation Explorer

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote
Video Super Session: Artistry in Motion

eventSpeakers.description:
Dacia Sáenz is a multidisciplinary creative and storyteller whose career began in Austin, TX, where she worked in film and television with CNBC, PBS, and the Sundance Foundation. A skilled writer as well as a producer, she was published (under a pen name) in The Kicked Out Anthology, named one of the top books of 2011 by the LGBTQ Roundtable of the American Library Association.

In Seattle, she earned a Master’s in Digital Media from the University of Washington, premiered two short films at the Seattle International Film Festival (2012 & 2013), and won the Audience Choice Award at the Next Fifty Film Festival. Her storytelling practice expanded globally through multimedia projects in Thailand and El Salvador with the Seattle Globalist and the UW Center for Human Rights.

Now based in Texas, Dacia continues to create work rooted in community. She recently directed and edited an award-winning short documentary on the Uvalde Love Project, a NEA-supported initiative using art therapy and murals to catalyze healing after tragedy.

Dacia currently works at Adobe, where she brings her passion for user experience, motion design, and creative video tools into product development. Outside of work, she explores experimental animation and synthesizers with playful obsession.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: VP of Strategy & Business Operations & Chief of Staff to President David Wadhwani

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Adobe AI Foundry: Transforming Content Creation
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Allison is Vice President of Business & Strategic Operations and Chief of Staff to President David Wadhwani at Adobe, where she runs day-to-day operations of Digital Media, the company’s largest business. In this capacity, she leads the development and implementation of business strategy for Adobe’s market-leading Creative Cloud and Document Cloud products – including Adobe Photoshop, Acrobat, Illustrator and Express – along with Adobe Firefly, its groundbreaking family of generative AI models.

In more than seven years at Adobe, Ms. Blais has developed a reputation for delivering results and putting her intellectual curiosity, grit, judgment, analytical expertise and legal background to work solving the company’s toughest challenges. She previously served as Adobe’s Vice President and Associate General Counsel, leading its Corporate Legal Team and managing areas like M&A, SEC reporting and the company’s Board of Directors.

Prior to joining Adobe, Ms. Blais spent more than 15 years in the financial sector, serving as a Chief Risk Officer for a broker-dealer and investment advisor, as well as in-house counsel at FINRA the financial regulator.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Adobe’s Vision: Control, Collaboration, and Creative Freedom
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Kelsey Slay is a multi-passionate designer, illustrator, and content creator based in Tennessee. From glittery cat collages to bold Halloween inspired illustrations, Kelsey’s work lives at the intersection of spooky and sweet, DIY arts and crafts nostalgia, and internet humor. Her creative journey took an unexpected turn when Adobe discovered her on TikTok and invited her to join the team as a Design Evangelist.

Now, Kelsey shares her love for design both online and on stage with a goal to empower the next generation of creatives with tutorials, storytelling, and an open-door approach to creative community. When she’s not designing, you can usually find her collecting new hobbies, traveling, or posting about her cats.

sessionTrack.title: Mainstage Broadcast
sessionTrack.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.title: Opening Keynote Welcome
cards.description: Adobe Chair and CEO Shantanu Narayen opens MAX 2025 with a powerful message celebrating creativity as a universal force. He shares Adobe’s vision for empowering creators through AI and innovation, setting the stage for a keynote centered on imagination, impact, and the future of creative expression.

cards.title: Empowering Creativity with AI Tools
cards.description: David Wadhwani, President of Adobe’s Digital Media Business, shares Adobe’s vision for creativity powered by AI. He unveils Firefly Custom Models, announces a strategic partnership with Google DeepMind, introduces AI assistants in Express and Photoshop Web, and offers a sneak peek of Adobe Express coming to ChatGPT.

Ely also unveils Premiere on iPhone and announces a new partnership with Google to bring exclusive templates and effects for YouTube Shorts directly into the app—empowering creators to produce standout content on the go.
cards.sessionTitle: From Idea to Output: Firefly and Premiere on iPhone

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Chief Technology Officer & SVP Creative Products Group, Digital Media

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Idea to Output: Firefly and Premiere on iPhone

eventSpeakers.description:
Ely Greenfield is the Chief Technology Officer and SVP of Adobe’s Creative Products Group, overseeing Creative Cloud, including flagship applications like Photoshop, Premiere Pro, and Illustrator, as well as generative AI initiatives like Adobe Firefly.

As CTO of Adobe’s Digital Media business, he drives technology strategy, fostering innovation across Creative Cloud and Document Cloud. ​ Ely led the launch of Adobe Firefly, the company’s first commercially safe generative AI model, now integrated into Adobe’s workflows to empower users of all skill levels.

Ely also oversees Adobe Research, focusing on AI, creative design tools, and immersive media. ​ Before rejoining Adobe, Ely was CTO of AppDynamics, leading engineering for scalable systems. ​ Earlier, he spent 20 years at Adobe and Macromedia, contributing to product development and business incubation, including Adobe Express. ​Ely holds a computer science degree from Brown University.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Idea to Output: Firefly and Premiere on iPhone
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description: Paul Trani is Principal Director Evangelist at Adobe, where he is committed to empowering designers to expand creative boundaries and embrace emerging technologies. With more than 30 years of experience as an award-winning visual designer, instructor, and public speaker, Paul has established a global reputation for inspiring and educating creative communities. Beyond his professional endeavors, he is an avid enthusiast of racquet sports—including, of course, pickleball.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Idea to Output: Firefly and Premiere on iPhone
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Lucy is a brand designer and Adobe Evangelist from Wales, UK. She launched her studio, Lugi Design Studio, in 2019 after building on her design skills while studying at the Manchester School of Architecture. Since then, she’s worked with clients around the world, blending creative expertise with strategic thinking to craft brand identities with purpose. Alongside her studio, Lucy has built a vibrant online community where she shares design insights and inspiration with fellow creatives.

Lucy joined Adobe two years ago and has since spoken at events across Europe, including taking the stage as a keynote speaker at MAX London earlier this year. Drawing on her experience in both design and community building, she’s passionate about sharing what she’s learned and inspiring the next generation of creatives to make their ideas happen.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Idea to Output: Firefly and Premiere on iPhone
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description: Kelly, a California native and Detroit transplant, is a world traveler and design innovator. As an Experience Designer at Adobe, she tackles complex challenges with fresh, technical solutions, contributing to Adobe Firefly and Generative AI for Audio and Video. Dedicated to engaging with creatives, Kelly builds connections with artists both in Detroit and globally. Outside of work, she enjoys photography, video production, and interior design.

cards.title: Your Creativity, Enhanced
cards.description: Deepa Subramaniam, VP of Product Marketing, showcases how Adobe is putting creative professionals at the center of innovation. From ideation in Firefly Boards to precision editing in Photoshop, Illustrator, Lightroom, and Premiere, she highlights performance upgrades, seamless workflows, and AI features that enhance—never replace—creative control.
cards.sessionTitle: Your Creativity, Enhanced

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Deepa Subramaniam is Vice President, Product Marketing for Creative Professionals at Adobe, where she is responsible for driving Adobe’s digital imaging, photography, video, design and generative AI businesses forward.

Deepa has over 18 year's experience leading product teams to collaboratively build innovative digital products as well as a proven track record in strategy and execution, while acting as a frequent advisor to founders, CEOs and CPOs on product strategy, product execution and organizational optimization.

Prior to Adobe, Deepa served as the ACLU’s first ever Chief Technology and Digital Officer where she led the Digital, Engineering, Product and Design teams, as Vice President of Product and Design at Kickstarter where she helped revamp the platform for the next decade of creative campaigning and as Director of Product at Hillary for America, where her she led product development for online fundraising, voter registration and get out the vote initiatives.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Sr. Design Evangelist for Next Gen Creative Pros

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Hello everyone, my name is Michael Fugoso. If you are familiar with my work you probably know me via my Instagram alias FUGSTRATOR . I am an illustrator/designer originally from San Diego, now functioning in Austin, TX. I've mainly done illustrative work for some of the largest aerospace companies out there, like NASA, Boeing, Blue Origin, Ariane Group and more, and I've also done plenty of official illustrative work for massive companies like Oracle, IBM, Salesforce, Volvo and many more. And I'm now thrilled to be on the Global Evangelism team at Adobe!

Most of my life I wasn't in the professional artist/designer world. Through age 29 I lived what is perceived by many a “normal life,” going through business school and eventually working as a banker. At age 30 the arts called to me and my life changed from there.

I am 40 years old now. In the ten years of creating and illustrating a ton of spaceships, rockets, jet planes, and robots, I luckily found what I love in this latter part of my life.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description: Terry White, a celebrated professional with a 29-year career at Adobe, serves as a Principal Director, Photography Evangelist, and Community Advocate, expertly leading and inspiring both teams and Adobe’s vast user community. A prominent speaker at events like TEDx and Photoshop World, award-winning photographer, and the 34th inductee into the Photoshop Hall of Fame, Terry also connects with audiences via his popular YouTube Photography Masterclass. His authorship and tech exploration further underscore his comprehensive expertise and influence in the creative and tech worlds.

eventSpeakers.description:
Dacia Sáenz is a multidisciplinary creative and storyteller whose career began in Austin, TX, where she worked in film and television with CNBC, PBS, and the Sundance Foundation. A skilled writer as well as a producer, she was published (under a pen name) in The Kicked Out Anthology, named one of the top books of 2011 by the LGBTQ Roundtable of the American Library Association.

In Seattle, she earned a Master’s in Digital Media from the University of Washington, premiered two short films at the Seattle International Film Festival (2012 & 2013), and won the Audience Choice Award at the Next Fifty Film Festival. Her storytelling practice expanded globally through multimedia projects in Thailand and El Salvador with the Seattle Globalist and the UW Center for Human Rights.

Now based in Texas, Dacia continues to create work rooted in community. She recently directed and edited an award-winning short documentary on the Uvalde Love Project, a NEA-supported initiative using art therapy and murals to catalyze healing after tragedy.

Dacia currently works at Adobe, where she brings her passion for user experience, motion design, and creative video tools into product development. Outside of work, she explores experimental animation and synthesizers with playful obsession.

cards.title: Adobe AI Foundry: Transforming Content Creation
cards.description: Allison Blais, VP of Strategy and Business Operations at Adobe, unveils how Adobe GenStudio and Firefly Foundry are transforming enterprise content creation. By training generative AI on proprietary brand data, Adobe empowers global teams to deliver secure, original, and on-brand content at scale. Through real-world examples, she highlights how innovations like Firefly Custom Models and Firefly Services streamline production and unlock personalization across the entire content supply chain.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Adobe AI Foundry: Transforming Content Creation

eventSpeakers.description:
Allison is Vice President of Business & Strategic Operations and Chief of Staff to President David Wadhwani at Adobe, where she runs day-to-day operations of Digital Media, the company’s largest business. In this capacity, she leads the development and implementation of business strategy for Adobe’s market-leading Creative Cloud and Document Cloud products – including Adobe Photoshop, Acrobat, Illustrator and Express – along with Adobe Firefly, its groundbreaking family of generative AI models.

In more than seven years at Adobe, Ms. Blais has developed a reputation for delivering results and putting her intellectual curiosity, grit, judgment, analytical expertise and legal background to work solving the company’s toughest challenges. She previously served as Adobe’s Vice President and Associate General Counsel, leading its Corporate Legal Team and managing areas like M&A, SEC reporting and the company’s Board of Directors.

Prior to joining Adobe, Ms. Blais spent more than 15 years in the financial sector, serving as a Chief Risk Officer for a broker-dealer and investment advisor, as well as in-house counsel at FINRA the financial regulator.

cards.title: Adobe’s Vision: Control, Collaboration, and Creative Freedom
cards.description: David Wadhwani closes the keynote by reaffirming Adobe’s commitment to empowering creators in the age of AI. He introduces Project Moonlight and Project Graph—two breakthrough experiences that transform creative intent into dynamic workflows. With a focus on control, collaboration, and creative freedom, David highlights how Adobe is helping users shape their relationship with AI across every stage of the creative process.
cards.sessionTitle: Adobe’s Vision: Control, Collaboration, and Creative Freedom

Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
David Wadhwani is responsible for the success of Adobe’s global Digital Media business across Adobe Creative Cloud and Adobe Document Cloud, including all product management, product marketing, engineering, strategic partnerships, customer support and to go-to-market across geographies. This includes iconic software brands such as Photoshop, Lightroom, Illustrator, InDesign and Acrobat.

David was most recently a Venture Partner at Greylock Partners. Prior to joining Greylock, he was president and CEO of AppDynamics, leading the company as it transformed to a SaaS-first business and became one of the fastest-growing enterprise software companies at the time.

This is David’s second tour of duty at Adobe. He joined Adobe in 2005 through the company’s acquisition of Macromedia, Inc., where he had been vice president of developer products. As senior vice president and general manager of Adobe’s Digital Media business, David played an instrumental role in advancing the company’s category leadership, expanding into new markets and contributing to its successful transformation to a cloud-based subscription business.

David holds a bachelor’s degree in computer science from Brown University and serves on the Brown computer science department advisory board. He is also on the digital advisory board of The Metropolitan Museum of Art and on the board of trustees for StoryCorps and the Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Adobe’s Vision: Control, Collaboration, and Creative Freedom

eventSpeakers.description:
Kelsey Slay is a multi-passionate designer, illustrator, and content creator based in Tennessee. From glittery cat collages to bold Halloween inspired illustrations, Kelsey’s work lives at the intersection of spooky and sweet, DIY arts and crafts nostalgia, and internet humor. Her creative journey took an unexpected turn when Adobe discovered her on TikTok and invited her to join the team as a Design Evangelist.

Now, Kelsey shares her love for design both online and on stage with a goal to empower the next generation of creatives with tutorials, storytelling, and an open-door approach to creative community. When she’s not designing, you can usually find her collecting new hobbies, traveling, or posting about her cats.

cards.title: 3D Magic with Project Neo (beta), Illustrator and Photoshop

tags.title: Graphic Design and Illustration
tags.description: Bring your creative vision to life. Learn how you can leverage new generative AI tools to assist your content development, create in new ways, and gain more control over your workflows and outputs. Get inspired to revisit the way you approach design.

cards.description:
Unlock new creative possibilities with 3D, using intuitive tools that are a natural extension of your existing design skills. Join design evangelist Howard Pinsky and discover how to craft beautiful designs with depth and dimension using Project Neo (beta) from Adobe. This innovative new web app lets you quickly create stunning 3D graphics with precise lighting, shadows, and perspective. See how to integrate these designs into your projects — from vectors in Illustrator to compositions in Photoshop. Perfect for creating isometric illustrations or adding volume and depth to brand graphics, icons, and typography.

In this session you’ll explore how to:

  • Build 3D objects and scenes using Project Neo
  • Export your 3D artwork to Illustrator as editable vectors
  • Move your 3D designs into Photoshop to stylize, incorporate into compositions, and more

tags.title: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day 2
Photography
tags.description: Spark your passion for photography with sessions that will help you build your photography skills and more easily achieve photo editing results you’re proud of using AI-powered tools and workflows, whether you’re taking photos with a smartphone or a mirrorless camera.

cards.description:
Discover how to make your portraits truly shine with Lightroom. Photographer Ron Timehin will walk you through his go-to workflows for achieving beautiful, consistent skin tones using Point Color, and for using AI-powered features like masking and removal tools to highlight your subject, make refined adjustments, and remove distractions. Packed with practical tips, this session will help you create portraits that feel polished, natural, and full of life.

Topics to be covered include:

  • Fine-tuning skin tones with precision using Point Color
  • Guiding the viewer’s eye with powerful AI masking techniques
  • Simplifying and cleaning up your frame for maximum impact
cards.sessionTitle: Perfect Portraits with Lightroom: Color and Masking

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Perfect Portraits with Lightroom: Color and Masking

eventSpeakers.description:
Ron Timehin, is an award-winning photographer and video director based in London.

Over more than a decade, Ron has had the incredible opportunity to work with a diverse range of clients, from household names like Apple, Adidas, Adobe, and American Express to iconic brands such as Disney, Christian Louboutin, and Sony. These collaborations have been both professionally fulfilling and have allowed him to explore the intersection of art and commerce in his work. Ron's work, recognised internationally, has been featured in esteemed publications like British Vogue, GQ, and The Financial Times.

More recently, Ron’s work has focused on social justice issues. He believes that the culmination of art and storytelling can create a force for positive change. His work with Dove, in particular, has contributed significantly to changing legislation in the UK.

His journey has also led him to establish ambassadorship contracts with amazing companies like Adobe, Sony and Wex. These partnerships have been instrumental in pushing the boundaries of his craft, and he is grateful for the ongoing creative exchange they provide.

Ron is incredibly proud to have published his first solo photography book entitled "London Fog." This body of work is very dear to his heart, and he is thrilled to have it available not only in renowned bookstores like Waterstones but also online through Amazon. The fact that "London Fog" was recognised as one of The TIMES Photography Books of the Year in 2019 is truly an honour and a testament to his dedication to his work.

Ron also regularly hosts photography workshops! These have been practical and in the field or as online presentations, with his most significant to date exceeding 15,000 participants.

cards.title: Insights from Creators: What Works, What Lasts, What’s Next

tags.title: Creator
tags.description: Whether you're just starting to explore a creative passion or ready to go all-in on a creator career, in this track you'll learn how to create mobile-first content, design for success across platforms like TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube, and use AI to take your ideas further.

cards.description:
What can today’s most successful creators teach us about thriving in the fast-changing digital landscape? In this session, educational content creator Gohar Khan shares strategies, habits, and stories from creators who have carved unique paths to success. From finding your voice within a niche to building communities and sustainable businesses, you’ll gain actionable insights that highlight both the common threads and surprising differences across the creator economy. Whether you’re just starting or refining your approach, this session offers practical takeaways and fresh inspiration.

In this session you’ll learn:

  • Why owning your audience is essential
  • How to balance experimentation with consistency
  • Monetization streams that work
  • Choosing a niche and unique voice
  • The parasocial bond’s role in trust
  • Why quantity > quality early on
  • The realities of making content a career
cards.sessionTitle: Insights from Creators: What Works, What Lasts, What’s Next

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Insights from Creators: What Works, What Lasts, What’s Next

eventSpeakers.description: Gohar Khan is an educational content creator and MIT grad on a mission to help students succeed inside and outside of school. Since mid-2021, he has been posting study tips, college application advice, and life hacks on his YouTube, leveraging playful storytelling to amass an audience of 7M+ subscribers. Drawing on his experiences as a first-generation student, he also co-founded Next Admit, an admissions consulting firm helping high school seniors apply to college. Ultimately, Gohar hopes his work can help alleviate the stress of school and empower students to achieve their goals.

cards.title: Designing for Everyone: Adobe and the Future of Accessibility in Education

tags.title: Education
tags.description: Get essential creative and generative AI skills that open doors to a brighter future. Whether you’re overseeing a creative curriculum or want to use creativity to enhance your teaching, you’ll learn from leading educators and experts who cultivate these skills.

cards.description:
Join Dr. Nathan Araya is a Customer Success Manager at Adobe, specializing in higher education strategy, accessibility, and AI-digital innovation, for an inside look at how Adobe is evolving to meet new accessibility requirements in education. This session highlights recent updates to Adobe apps and tools that make it easier for students and educators to create inclusive content. Whether you're an educator, administrator, or creative professional, this session will help you understand how Adobe can help you support every learner.

Key Takeaways:

  • Discover how Adobe apps like Premiere and Adobe Express, along with Adobe Acrobat, are integrating accessibility features to support inclusive learning environments.
  • Get practical insights and resources to help your institution meet accessibility requirements and create compliant, engaging content.
cards.sessionTitle: Designing for Everyone: Adobe and the Future of Accessibility in Education

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Customer Success Manager for Higher Education

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Designing for Everyone: Adobe and the Future of Accessibility in Education

eventSpeakers.description:
Dr. Nathan Araya is a Customer Success Manager at Adobe, specializing in higher education strategy, accessibility, and AI-digital innovation. His work focuses on empowering universities to create inclusive learning experiences that prepare students and educators to thrive in a rapidly evolving, tech-driven world.

Drawing from a background as a college professor, filmmaker, and ed-tech strategist, Nathan bridges the gap between creativity and education. At Adobe, he collaborates with institutions across the country to drive adoption of tools like Adobe Express, Firefly, and Acrobat AI.

With over five years of teaching experience as an Assistant Professor of Marketing, Nathan has led courses in digital marketing, entrepreneurship, and business ethics, and holds a Doctorate in Education focused on how AI, micro-credentials, and digital tools are reshaping higher education. His insights have been shared at the Harvard Graduate School of Education, where he speaks on inclusive teaching, digital literacy, and culturally responsive storytelling.

Beyond his work in academia and technology, Nathan is an award-winning filmmaker whose projects have been featured at SXSW and recognized by the African Movie Academy Awards. He has also been honored among the Global Top 100 Most Influential People of African Descent in Media & Culture (Class of 2023) for his contributions to education, storytelling, and global development.

Whether in the classroom, on stage, or behind the camera, Nathan’s mission is clear: to make education more accessible, creative, and human through the power of technology and storytelling.

cards.title: Scrappy, Smart, and Human: The Future of Storytelling

tags.title: Creator
tags.description: Whether you're just starting to explore a creative passion or ready to go all-in on a creator career, in this track you'll learn how to create mobile-first content, design for success across platforms like TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube, and use AI to take your ideas further.

cards.description:
In an age of algorithm-chasing headlines and shrinking attention spans, Emmy-winning filmmaker and journalist Johnny Harris invites you inside the storytelling ethos that drives his work — one that prioritizes curiosity over clicks and stories over soundbites. Drawing on experience with Vox and The New York Times, Johnny shows how storytelling isn’t just about what you say but how you invite others to care. Known for his scrappy, visual-first approach, he breaks down the ingredients of compelling narratives and the tools he uses to make them resonate.

What You’ll Learn:

  • How to spark curiosity instead of chasing clicks
  • Key ingredients of memorable, compelling stories
  • A visual-first approach to storytelling that connects
  • Practical tools and techniques for creating impactful narratives
cards.sessionTitle: Scrappy, Smart, and Human: The Future of Storytelling

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Scrappy, Smart, and Human: The Future of Storytelling

eventSpeakers.description: Johnny Harris is an Emmy award-winning filmmaker and journalist on YouTube acclaimed for his top-notch storytelling and high-quality explainers. He is known for his innovative visual style that blends motion graphics with cinematic videography to create content that explains complex issues in relatable ways. Based in Washington, DC, Harris reports on interesting trends and stories domestically and around the globe, publishing to his audience of 7 million subscribers on YouTube. He is also a frequent contributor to the New York Times. Prior to becoming an independent journalist, Harris produced and hosted the twice Emmy-nominated series Borders for Vox Media.

cards.description:
Learn how to create seamless, animated loops using Photoshop and Adobe Firefly. In this session, Jesús Ramirez, founder of the Photoshop Training Channel on YouTube, will guide you through a full creative pipeline — from building a composite in Photoshop, to enhancing it in Adobe Firefly with the text-to-image tool, to generating animations in Adobe Firely using the text-to-video module. Her work on AI was featured on the front page of The Wall Street Journal, Reuters, Bloomberg Law, the Guardian, and others. Her photography (non-AI) was published by the New York Post, the Telegraph, the Times & Sunday Times, The Sun, and Metro.

Kris is Sr. Creative AI Evangelist & Community Advocate at Adobe. In her role she creates educational workshops, is a public speaker and an AI professional who evangelizes internally and externally.

eventSpeakers.description:
Nol Honig is an award-winning director, motion designer, and educator based in New York City. He began his career in broadcast and political media, serving as a lead animator for Barack Obama’s 2012 re-election campaign. In 2013, he founded The Drawing Room, a creative studio specializing in design-driven animation. Through the studio, Nol has directed work for clients such as Netflix, Coca-Cola, The History Channel, and the Philadelphia Museum of Art, and has contributed animation and design leadership to projects for The New York Times, Google, NBC, and the Sundance Film Festival.

Over the years, Nol has also collaborated as a freelance designer and art director with top-tier studios including Elastic, Golden Wolf, Pentagram, Buck, Gretel, and Block & Tackle. From 2001 to 2019, he taught motion graphics at Parsons School of Design, where he was honored with a Distinguished Teaching Award in 2017.

Most recently, Nol received a Silver Cube from the ADC Awards for directing the opening title sequence of the Netflix documentary series The Andy Warhol Diaries.

Magdiel shares his process for combining classic techniques with bold experimentation to create striking, modern visuals. This inspiring session offers a look behind the scenes at how Photoshop becomes a playground for innovation, where traditional skills meet new tools to push creative boundaries.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Combine painterly textures, structured layouts, and Adobe Firefly elements to create bold, modern compositions
  • Advance your style by experimenting with blend modes, distortions, and visual "mistakes"
  • Simplify complex visuals into repeatable steps with masks, Smart Objects, and adjustment layers
  • Blend classic tools like masks and gradients with newer features like Content-Aware Fill
  • Remix past projects by layering textures and finding fresh directions

Known for blending strategic storytelling with bold visual execution, she has redefined Too Faced’s creative identity while driving global relevance and cultural resonance.

Warissara is also recognized for her ability to build and inspire high-performing creative teams. She has held key roles across both in-house and agency settings, working on brands such as MAC Cosmetics, Elizabeth Arden, Jo Malone, Tom Ford, Ole Henriksen, Lip Lab, and more. Whether guiding a major product launch or mentoring emerging designers, she leads with empathy, purpose, and a sharp eye for design that moves people.

With a distinctive East meets West perspective shaped by her Thai American heritage and global upbringing, Warissara brings rich cultural fluency to the world of beauty and fashion, deeply informing her creative vision.

eventSpeakers.description: Brandon Lerry, the founder of Lunchbox 3D, a Long Beach-based 3D animation studio that specializes in cinematic visuals using Unreal Engine for real-time rendering. Within just over a year of posting his work online, Brandon’s content has garnered over 48 million views on TikTok and Instagram, achieving viral success through a seamless blend of filmmaking aesthetics and photorealistic animation. He has led high-impact collaborations with major brands including BMW, Shaq, Blink-182, Hello Kitty, MVMT, Apple (AirPods Max campaign), Ford (Lightning), Rolls-Royce (Spectre), and the Golden State Warriors. Notably, he directed a behind-the-scenes 3D commercial for BMW that highlighted technical innovation and emotional storytelling through precise camera choreography and real-time rendering techniques. As @lunchbqx on TikTok, Brandon commands a thriving audience—around 175K followers and 6 million likes—where he shares his creative process with engaging visuals. His diverse portfolio spans commercial work, spec ads and experimental 3D concepts, including “Cyberpunk City,” “Apple Desk,” and more, showcasing his versatility, narrative drive, and mastery of visual technology.

cards.title: What’s New, What’s Next: How Creatives Can Shape the Future with Fonts

tags.title: Graphic Design and Illustration
tags.description: Bring your creative vision to life. Learn how you can leverage new generative AI tools to assist your content development, create in new ways, and gain more control over your workflows and outputs. Get inspired to revisit the way you approach design.

cards.description:
The future of creativity won’t be built on hype alone—it will be written, shaped, and shared in type. Join Monotype’s Executive Creative Directors Charles Nix and Sara Soskolne for a fast-paced, conversational session that blends wit with insight. Together, they’ll explore how typography is already influencing tomorrow: from fonts that move like music, to AI’s unsettling hand in authorship, to generational shifts in how we see and use type.

Expect new ways of seeing fonts as identity, as change agents, and as connective tissue across cultures and generations. You’ll walk away with ideas you can put to work now—and inspiration to shape what comes next.
cards.sessionTitle: What’s New, What’s Next: How Creatives Can Shape the Future with Fonts

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: What’s New, What’s Next: How Creatives Can Shape the Future with Fonts

eventSpeakers.description: Charles Nix is a typographer, designer, educator, and creative provocateur. As Senior Executive Creative Director at Monotype, he helps some of the world’s most recognizable brands express themselves through type. His work spans custom typefaces for M&M’s and Progressive Insurance to global library releases like Helvetica Now, Walbaum, Ambiguity, and Hope Sans. Raised in a print shop and trained at The Cooper Union, Charles began his education with every intention of becoming an artist but was quickly drawn into the world of type. He started teaching straight out of college—eventually chairing the Communication Design department at Parsons School of Design. A former President and now Chairman Emeritus of the Type Directors Club, he has long championed typographic clarity and craft. Equal parts historian and futurist, Charles sees typography as a belief system—a way to interpret culture, influence emotion, and spark change. Whether mentoring emerging designers or advising global brands, he brings an infectious blend of rigor, warmth, and wit to every conversation about type.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: What’s New, What’s Next: How Creatives Can Shape the Future with Fonts

eventSpeakers.description: Sara Soskolne is an Executive Creative Director at Monotype and one of the most respected voices in contemporary type design. Previously Senior Designer at Hoefler&Co, she has contributed to some of the most influential revivals and original typefaces of the past two decades with a unique balance of rigor, craft, and cultural insight. At Monotype, she helps global brands navigate the complexity of typography, ensuring that type remains both a discipline of precision and a living art that shapes how we communicate.

Kladi is an award-winning designer, visual strategist, instructor, author and Sr. Design Evangelist and Community Advocate at Adobe. Kladi has a long title with an even bigger mission: to empower, inspire, and support the creative community while sharing design and career tips. But most importantly a job that allows Kladi to focus on what she loves: People, Design, and Innovation. Reach out @iamkladi, her DM is always open for a chat.

Kladi runs an Instagram live show “Creative Connection Live” where the creative community comes together every week.

As a self-published author, Kladi's illustrated book, Plant Therapy, won the world-renowned Fedrigoni TOP Designer Award for her unique use of cotton papers and ink. Kladi has also been the winner of Infohackit and Adobe's Creative Jam during San Francisco Design Week.

In addition to her design work, Kladi often leads graphic design masterclasses for Adobe Live, Adobe events in UK and Design tutorials with over 5M views worldwide.

Kladi has also led social media asset creation workshops for House Representatives in Washington, D.C. for over 4 years. Kladi took part in Adobe MAX every year since 2019,in USA and also in UK as a featured speaker in the Design industry.

She was also a speaker at the exciting Illustrator Summit 2021, Creative PRO WEEK conference, Design & Marketing Summit, Design CUTS, and shared workflow tips in Illustrator in Spanish during Talent Land in Guadalajara, Mexico, and again during the Talented at Home. D many more design conferences around the world.

Kladi is a LinkedIn Learning and Creative Live author and producer; she was also named one of the world's top Illustrator instructors by Adobe Education.

Kladi recently authored, designed, and produced the Adobe Illustrator Bootcamp available on Adobe Education Exchange, Adobe Illustrator Conquests (animation & storyline-based onboarding for Ai beginners); Illustrator and Photoshop Cross-App onboarding hybrid tutorials, Creative essentials training course, Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator Templates with follow-along tutorials, hands-on tutorials available inside Illustrator's Discover Panel and the interconnected hybrid animated Photoshop and Illustrator videos that lead to the hands-on tutorials.

cards.description:
Brands are not artifacts or representations. They live in our hearts and minds as consistent emotional responses shared across people. In this talk, renowned industrial designer Robert Brunner, Founder and Creative Director of Ammunition, explains how emotions are the high-level currency of brands, and how the best products establish relationships with people and shrink the gap between companies and their constituents. Ultimately, the design of the things you make can build a charismatic brand.

On this brand journey, you'll discover:

  • How to communicate what your brand is about through design
  • Using design to create a relationship with your customer that matters
  • Why some brands become iconic and linked to moments in our lives
cards.sessionTitle: How the Things You Make Shape Brand Connection With Your Audience

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: How the Things You Make Shape Brand Connection With Your Audience

eventSpeakers.description: The former Industrial Design Director at Apple and current Lead Designer for Beats by Dre, Robert is a globally acclaimed product designer with over 40 years of experience. Robert built the pioneering internal corporate design organization at Apple and was a partner at the prestigious design consultancy, Pentagram. Under his leadership, his current studio, Ammunition, has developed iconic products for Beats, Lyft, Square, Polaroid, and numerous start-up enterprises. Robert’s work is part of the permanent collections of the Museum of Modern Art in New York and San Francisco, and he has been named one of Fast Company’s “Most Creative People in Business”. He is also the co-author of the book “Do You Matter? How Great Design Will Make People Love Your Company.”

tags.title: Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description:
Learn how to stay relevant and thrive as the design world evolves. Explore what makes us valuable as designers when AI tools change how we work. Drawing on insights from Samantha Warren, Senior Director of Design, Adobe Firefly, and designer, performer, and educator Meg Lewis, we'll examine the shift from purely technical skills to the uniquely human qualities that AI cannot replicate, providing practical strategies for cultivating your most valuable asset as a designer — your humanity. The session will wrap with an inspiring demo by Adobe designers Brooke Hopper and Danielle Morimoto that reveals how Firefly enhances the flow of ideas and supports the creative process.

You will:

  • Discover techniques to strengthen your storytelling abilities and create unexpected design solutions beyond what AI can produce
  • Learn approaches to deepen your empathy and connection-building skills to solve more complex design challenges
  • Gain insights on evolving your role beyond pixel creation toward design leadership, integrating human context and vision
  • Identify ways to capitalize on your unique non-design experiences and passions as competitive advantages in an AI-augmented industry

She’s passionate about arts, crafts, and all sorts of creative endeavors, and loves spending time outdoors with her husband, son, and their dog.

They provide inspiring education on career strategy and nonconformity, believing every person can do, make, or create something for the world that no one else can. Meg's interactive performances blend humor with valuable insights, inspiring audiences to tackle life's biggest questions with joy, curiosity, humanity, and play!

She bring years of experience building 0 to 1 products and leading innovation in ambiguous spaces — turning uncertainty into opportunity and translating bold ideas into tools that empower creative expression. cards.description:
For most of history, creativity was tactile. From the first cave paintings to modern studios, artists relied on touch to stay immersed in their work. Then came digital. While it unlocked speed and scale, it also distanced us from that natural connection. Physical feedback disappeared, distractions multiplied, and focus faded.

In this session, discover how MX Innovations help creatives:

  • Work more intuitively and stay immersed
  • Regain control while reducing distractions
  • Streamline and speed up complex workflows

Whether you’re designing, editing, or shaping strategy, see how MX is redefining creativity — enabling freedom, flow, and precision in the digital world.

cards.description:
Each platform speaks its own visual language; what resonates on TikTok may not land on Instagram or YouTube. In this 20-minute session, multidisciplinary creator Sara Sun shares how she adapts her design voice across social channels while staying true to her creative voice. Drawing on her background in graphic design, mixed media, and branding, Sara reveals strategies for platform-native storytelling, playful experimentation with tools like Adobe Firefly, and audience-first design choices that drive engagement. Whether you’re building a presence or refining your multi-channel approach, you’ll gain insights into creating content that feels authentic, cohesive, and platform-specific.

You’ll learn:

  • How to adapt design styles to fit platform culture
  • Ways to use Firefly for fast, flexible content creation
  • Tactics for staying authentic while maintaining brand consistency across channels

eventSpeakers.description: Sara Sun is a San Diego-based multidisciplinary designer and content creator known for her experimental approach to art and design. Blending mixed media, digital illustration, and playful storytelling, her work celebrates imperfection, play, and exploration across different mediums. Sara shares her creative journey online, inspiring a community of over 300K like-minded artists, thinkers, and makers to embrace experimentation and find joy in imperfection. When she’s not designing, Sara enjoys making pottery and spending time with her four cats—Frankie, Teddy, Winston, and Pepper.

tags.title: Graphic Design and Illustration
tags.description: Bring your creative vision to life. Learn how you can leverage new generative AI tools to assist your content development, create in new ways, and gain more control over your workflows and outputs. Get inspired to revisit the way you approach design.

cards.description:
Join legendary character designer Tom Bancroft for a thrilling live demo as he brings to life the (imaginary) fourth member of the K-Pop Demon Hunters! Watch the creative process unfold in real time as Tom sketches a brand-new character, blending pop culture flair with storytelling depth.

In this session, you'll discover:

  • How to design a character that fits seamlessly into a story world
  • Techniques for expressing personality through visual design
  • The role of performance and narrative in character creation

Whether you're a seasoned artist or just starting out, this session will inspire you to think deeper about the characters you create—and how they connect with audiences.
cards.sessionTitle: Creating Characters with Personality

eventSpeakers.description:
Tom Bancroft has over thirty-five years of experience in the animation industry, first with Walt Disney Feature animation animating on such Disney classics as Beauty and the Beast, The Lion King, Aladdin, Pocahontas, Tarzan and Brother Bear. He is also the creator of Mushu the dragon in Disney’s Mulan. He then worked with Big Idea Productions as a Supervising Director/Co-creator for the VeggieTales DVD series, The New Adventures of Larryboy! As an independent filmmaker, he helped create the relaunch of the “Superbook” series as co-director and character designer. He is author of the popular character design instruction books “Creating Characters with Personality” and “Character Mentor” and creator of “MerMay”, a worldwide drawing event created in 2016.

Bancroft is CEO of the first-ever crowd invested animation company, Pencilish Animation Studios and half of the popular “The Bancroft Brothers Animation Podcast” with his twin brother Tony. In 2023, the documentary he produced, Pencils Vs. Pixels released on Amazon Prime. He is currently co-director of the 2D animated feature film, “The Light of the World” that will release worldwide in September of 2025 and is in development for his own 2D animation feature film.

He lives with his family in Nashville, Tennessee.

tags.title: Education
tags.description: Get essential creative and generative AI skills that open doors to a brighter future. Whether you’re overseeing a creative curriculum or want to use creativity to enhance your teaching, you’ll learn from leading educators and experts who cultivate these skills.

cards.description:
The power of podcasting isn’t in expensive gear or complex software. It’s in a creative voice and story behind a microphone. Adobe Podcast makes it easy for educators and students to produce professional-quality audio from almost any device, anywhere. Join AJ Barse, Instructional Designer at Western Washington University and experienced podcaster from Analog Explorer and Bellingham Podcast, to explore how Adobe Podcast simplifies podcasting for K–20 classrooms. With browser-based remote recording, AI-powered Audio Enhance, and transcript-style editing, learn how to remove the intimidation of traditional audio workflows and make podcasting as easy as editing a document. Explore how studio-quality podcasting is possible, on any budget, to fuel creativity in every classroom.

Takeaways include:

  • A set-up guide for recording in person or remotely
  • Using AI to enhance field recordings
  • Simplifying editing with transcription
  • Project ideas for cross-curricular storytelling

eventSpeakers.description: AJ is an Instructional Designer at Western Washington University in the heart of the Pacific Northwest, Bellingham, Washington. Outside of higher education, AJ uses his talents as freelance creative throughout the region and is an award-winning photographer. He provides a unique view in higher education as he bridges his skills as an academic technologist, an educator, and a content creator. He is best known for the Analog Explorer project and podcast, the 9-year show, the Bellingham Podcast (and broadcast on KMRE 88.3fm), and his award-winning travel and Pacific Northwest photography. In higher education, he has published in and presented on a diverse array of topics within educational technology. Through his work in these various roles, he strives to promote lifelong learning and inspire others to explore the world around them. Whether it's creating engaging multimedia or helping faculty gain the creative skills to make their own, AJ's diverse skills and experiences are driven by his passion for creativity, exploration, and education.

Elliot partners closely with Product Management, Research and Engineering teams to drive the development and adoption of Generative AI features across Adobe offerings. Elliot holds an MBA from the MIT Sloan School of Management, an MS in Engineering Management from The George Washington University, and a BS in Computer Engineering from the University of Maryland. He is also a co-founder of the Akumaning-Brewu Foundation, an educational non-profit dedicated to supporting students in Ghana.

cards.title: Next Level InDesign
cards.description:
You’ve been using Adobe InDesign long enough to realize there is so much more to learn. Now is your chance to learn vital tips and tricks to take your InDesign work to the next level. David Blatner, President of CreativePro Network and one of the world’s leading independent authorities on InDesign, will take you on a deep dive of some of InDesign’s most important yet least-understood features. Note: This session is specifically for intermediate to advanced users who want to supercharge their InDesign powers.

Techniques will include:

  • Automating your production with five scripts you already have and three you should get immediately!
  • New AI tools to boost InDesign productivity (but watch out for these “gotchas”)
  • Secrets of InDesign power users, such as style linking and reflowing images
cards.sessionTitle: Next Level InDesign

eventSpeakers.description: David Blatner is the co-founder and publisher of InDesign Magazine, InDesignSecrets, and CreativePro. He has recorded over 30 video courses for LinkedIn Learning (Lynda.com), written 15 books on everything from InDesign to Photoshop to the number pi, and is arguably the best-known InDesign expert in the world. As host of CreativePro Events, he brings together thousands of creative professionals each year to talk about InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat, PowerPoint, and more.

Josh Olufemii, content creator and educator at Olufemii, breaks down the top 10 game-changing tips that make After Effects not just approachable — but fun. These tips are handpicked to help editors add dynamic motion to their workflow without getting lost in the UI.

In this fun, fast-track session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Navigate After Effects confidently as a Premiere user
  • Use simple expressions to create dynamic animations
  • Understand pre-comps, keyframes, and masks like a pro
  • Use After Effects to fix shots Premiere can’t
  • Integrate After Effects and Premiere for a seamless editing pipeline

tags.title: Creativity and Marketing in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. They’ll cover everything from brand reinvention and strategy to supercharging creative workflows to new tools for scaling campaign assets.

cards.description:
If you want another session talking about the possibilities of GenAI, this may not be for you. If you want a session showing you GenAI in action, pull up a seat. Join Jenny Kelly, head of content at Deloitte Digital, as she shares real-world lessons and honest insights from hands-on experience. 

Here’s what we’ll cover: 
- What we learned about developing images for client-facing marketing (hint: getting AI from the concept to externally approved work is a long walk, but there are shortcuts) 
- The surprises along the way—including some failures you don’t want to repeat 
- Specific recommendations on where to scale with AI, and where you need creative humans to stay in the loop 
- New strategies on how to plan for content creation at scale 
- How we employed Adobe’s latest Image Model 4 in Firefly to help resolve model issues
cards.sessionTitle: Generative AI Unfiltered: Real Wins, Real Challenges

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Generative AI Unfiltered: Real Wins, Real Challenges

eventSpeakers.description: As the Head of Content + AI for Deloitte Digital, Jenny leads the firm in agentic transformation in the marketing space, bringing a passion for creating compelling content that connects audiences with brands. With over 15 years of experience, Jenny has a proven track record of delivering high-quality, impactful content that resonates with audiences and drives business objectives. She works with major brands on everything from marketing strategy to content creation, production at a global scale, and how to transform content lifecycles using AI.

tags.title: Generative AI
tags.description: While AI is reshaping the creative landscape, human imagination has never been more essential or more powerful. Discover how generative AI features in your favorite Adobe tools will help you speed workflows, expand your skillset, and gain greater creative control.

cards.description:
Brands today face the challenge of delivering personalized, seamless, and scalable experiences in an increasingly dynamic digital landscape. Make AI Real for Brands explores how to leverage AI — spanning generative, conversational, and agentic capabilities — to transform marketing and customer engagement. The approach combines strategy, storytelling, and systems with creative engineering to unlock measurable business value across the customer lifecycle. The session outlines:

  • Why AI matters now: From accelerating content creation to enabling hyper-personalized campaigns and immersive commerce
  • What we offer: Domain-led ideation, AI-powered content supply chains, and smart marketing services
  • How we deliver: A structured engagement model to scale AI responsibly and compliantly across enterprises

Through real-world use cases, including generative AI-driven campaign orchestration, we will demonstrate how brands can achieve agility, efficiency, and superior ROI while maintaining trust and compliance.

eventSpeakers.description: Natarajan (Basky) Baskaran is the global head of TCS Interactive’s DX Business. For more than 25 years, Natarajan Baskaran has empowered clients across verticals to adapt to evolving technology paradigms. His support in charting out their digital transformation journeys have helped businesses deliver thoughtful and consistent user experiences, drive massive brand enhancements, and gain unprecedented revenue growth. With years of enriching customer experiences behind him, he has emerged as a far-seeing subject matter expert in the fields of CX design, CX strategy roadmap, digital experience, digital marketing, and digital commerce. As a visionary leader, he innovates future-ready AI powered solutions to spearhead brand equity, exponential growth, and co-innovation—all while prioritizing inclusive and accessible experiences.

Aruna Vaidyanathan is Global Head, Growth Marketing for TCS. She leads marketing technologies, digital marketing, market research, content and creative. She drives marketing programs that are focused on building the brand and generating revenue for TCS. Having worked across India, the UK, and Germany, Aruna has played many roles in marketing and communications, including content marketing, field marketing, and strategic communications. She started her career as a business journalist, reporting and writing on companies and technology for some of India’s leading publications. She is currently based out of Bengaluru, India.

cards.title: Bring Personality, Depth, and Texture to Your Illustrations
cards.description:
Combine the power of Illustrator and Photoshop to add depth, perspective, and attention-grabbing personality to your illustrations. Join Tyler Pate, art director, illustrator, and all-around creative, as he leads you through his step-by-step process for building bold, dimensional artwork that stands out. This session is perfect for creatives looking to refine their style or explore new visual techniques. Discover how these two powerhouse programs work together to deliver a polished, professional finish — and unlock the tools you need to elevate your creative edge.

In this session, you’ll explore:

  • Create custom perspectives and dimensions for your work
  • Learn how to apply lighting and color
  • Understanding axonometric projections and how to illustrate in isometric perspective
  • Explore core tools in Illustrator, such as the Free Transformation and Shape Builder tools
  • Bring Illustrator builds into Photoshop to add texture, lighting, and detailed effects
cards.sessionTitle: Bring Personality, Depth, and Texture to Your Illustrations

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Bring Personality, Depth, and Texture to Your Illustrations

eventSpeakers.description:
Tyler Pate is a Los Angeles–based Art Director, Illustrator, and creative problem solver with over a decade of experience shaping iconic brands and franchises. He's helped lead and develop Nickelodeon's global campaigns and consumer product guides, contributing to beloved properties such as SpongeBob SquarePants, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, and Avatar: The Last Airbender.

His diverse body of work includes collaborations with Adobe, Wacom, POSCA, StickerApp, Krispy Kreme, DreamWorks, The Black Keys, and even Paul McCartney—blending pop culture with imaginative storytelling and design.

Beyond client work, Tyler leads The Creative Pain—a brand built to inspire artists, foster creative growth, and partner with companies to craft fun, unexpected, and visually original experiences.

cards.title: Building Seamless Composites in Photoshop
cards.description:
Join Julieanne Kost, principal evangelist at Adobe, and discover how to elevate your compositing workflow using both new and time-tested features in Photoshop. Learn how to quickly merge disparate visual elements into unified, surreal scenes — while keeping your process flexible and efficient from concept to completion. Julieanne will guide you through essential techniques to help you design faster, smarter, and with more creative control.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Spark ideas and speed up your workflow using the latest Photoshop tools powered by Adobe Firefly
  • Select and integrate elements that work together visually and conceptually
  • Use non-destructive, adaptable techniques to refine your composites with confidence
  • Incorporate both new and classic features into a seamless, professional workflow
cards.sessionTitle: Building Seamless Composites in Photoshop

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Quick Fix, Bold Impact: Mastering Editing & Masking Tools in Lightroom

eventSpeakers.description: Named one of Fast Company’s “100 Most Creative People in Business,” Julieanne Kost is the Digital Imaging Evangelist Director at Adobe, responsible for fostering relationships with customers through meaningful and inspirational Photoshop and Lightroom instruction. As a highly sought-after speaker for the industry-standard Digital Imaging franchise, she devises and presents motivating and educational training sessions, sharing original techniques and tutorials worldwide — via live events and online. She is also the author of “Passenger Seat—Creating a Photographic Project from Conception Through Execution” and “Window Seat — The Art of Digital Photography and Creative Thinking”, an accomplished photographer and fine artist, and creator and host of the popular Photoshop Essential Training course for LinkedIn Learning.

cards.title: From Sketch to Storefront: 3D Innovation at Kate Spade
cards.description:
Discover how 3D digital twins are transforming iconic brands like Coach, Kate Spade, and Stuart Weitzman. Join Carmen Ortiz, Manager of Digital Product Creation at Tapestry and Lissette Siesholtz, Senior Director of Leathergoods Technical Design at Kate Spade New York, as they share their creative journey from 2D sketches to photorealistic 3D assets using Adobe Substance 3D, crafting versatile digital twins that drive innovation from product development to marketing content creation.

In this session, you'll learn how to:

  • Create high-fidelity digital twins using a streamlined 2D-to-3D workflow
  • Accelerate product development with virtual prototyping techniques
  • Transform digital twins into compelling marketing content without physical samples
  • Enhance cross-functional collaboration through shared 3D assets. Implement a "create once, use many" approach that reduces costs and supports sustainability initiatives
cards.sessionTitle: From Sketch to Storefront: 3D Innovation at Kate Spade

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Sketch to Storefront: 3D Innovation at Kate Spade

eventSpeakers.description:
Carmen began her career in fashion accessories design and has always been drawn to the intersection of creativity and technology. After working in a variety of roles across the fashion industry, she joined Coach’s Design Technology team, where she began exploring innovative digital workflows. That curiosity led her to upskill into 3D, shaping a unique 2D to 3D journey and sparking a passion for future-forward design.

With over a decade of experience, Carmen now leads the creation of digital assets for merchandising and customer experience across Tapestry’s house of brands. She oversees visualization for all product categories at Coach, Kate Spade, and Stuart Weitzman. As Tapestry’s Adobe subject matter expert, Carmen supports both Creative Cloud and Substance tools, helping teams implement processes that boost efficiency and unlock creativity across the organization.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Sketch to Storefront: 3D Innovation at Kate Spade

eventSpeakers.description: Lissette has been a vital part of the Kate Spade Leathergoods team for nearly 12 years and has accumulated 17 years of professional experience as a Fashion Designer. She began her journey in Leathergoods Technical Design at Coach in 2011. Since then, she has leveraged her design expertise to create extensive libraries of brand standards & design tools, playing a key role in facilitating seamless brand transformations at both Coach and Kate Spade. Lissette has also been instrumental in fueling cross-functional process innovation, resulting in the creation of seamless Design workflows. Lissette currently leads the Leathergoods Technical Design team at Kate Spade, where she is passionately embracing Substance 3D to elevate the visual impact of their Design work.

cards.title: The Heart and Mind of Editing Award-Winning Music Videos

tags.title: Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description:
Editing isn’t just technical — it’s emotional, psychological, and deeply human. In this session, editor Vinnie Hobbs, of VH Post and Union Editorial, shares the mindset that’s helped him cut award-winning music videos and commercials, not just with skill, but with soul. You’ll explore what it means to edit with intention, how to stay inspired when burnout hits, and why stepping out from behind the screen is just as vital as mastering it.

This talk isn’t a software tutorial — it’s about purpose, passion, and the long game. Join Vinnie as he shares thoughts and inspiration on:

  • How to reignite your creative spark when the work feels draining
  • Understanding how personal growth fuels editorial growth
  • Why networking and confidence matter as much as technique
  • Redefining “success” as an editor beyond the timeline
  • How to build a career, not just a reel
cards.sessionTitle: The Heart and Mind of Editing Award-Winning Music Videos

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: The Heart and Mind of Editing Award-Winning Music Videos

eventSpeakers.description: Vinnie Hobbs is an American film editor with a strong footprint in the music video industry. Born in Okinawa, Japan, Vinnie cultivated his editing skills early on, experimenting with video production in his teenage years. His distinct style blends rhythmic cutting, bold visual timing, and a strong sense of narrative, making him a sought-after collaborator for some of the biggest names in music, including Kendrick Lamar, Beyoncé, Victoria Monét, Future, and Nicki Minaj. With a career marked by numerous successes, Vinnie has been nominated for multiple MTV Video Music Awards for Best Editing. He is a passionate advocate for creativity and efficiency in the editing process, frequently relying on Adobe Premiere Pro to bring his visions to life. Beyond music videos, Vinnie has lent his expertise to feature films and commercial projects for major brands, continuously expanding his craft and surprising audiences with fresh and unexpected visuals.
