cards.title: What They Never Taught You: Real Talk about Your Creative Career

tags.title: Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description:
After 20+ years as a professional illustrator — and escaping a soul-crushing corporate job — I've learned what it really takes to build a lasting creative career. These are hard-earned lessons you only learn by doing work and making lots of mistakes along the way. I’m Yuko Shimizu and my session cuts through industry myths and delivers the honest, useful, and sometimes tough truths no one tells you.

In this candid, no-nonsense talk, you'll learn:

  • How to craft a portfolio that sticks in the minds of potential clients
  • Why imposter syndrome is normal, and how to channel self-doubt into creative momentum
  • Real-world strategies on how to handle difficult, tricky situations and build lasting, professional relationships
  • And while I’ll share examples from my own work, this talk is ultimately about you — your path, your choices, and your creative future
cards.sessionTitle: What They Never Taught You: Real Talk about Your Creative Career

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: What They Never Taught You: Real Talk about Your Creative Career

eventSpeakers.description: Yuko Shimizu is a multi-award-winning Japanese illustrator based in New York City. Yuko is an instructor at The School of Visual Arts and has more than 20 years of experience illustrating. Her work includes multiple disciplines; from pages of The New York Times, TIME, Newsweek, The New Yorker to WIRED, covers for DC Comic, Penguin, and Scholastic, advertising for BBC, Apple, Google, Microsoft, Intel, Netflix, Universal Pictures, SONY, Paramount, Nike and Hasbro, to name a few. Additionally, she has collaborated with the United Nations, the Smithsonian Museum, Philadelphia Museum of Art, and Library of Congress. Two of her books have been awarded Caldecott Honor, one of the most prestigious children's book awards.

eventSpeakers.description:
MAX veteran Tony Harmer (a.k.a The Design Ninja) is a creative-utility-knife and learning-content author with over four decades of experience. Currently serving as the Chief Edutainment Officer of DN:TV, Tony has a diverse background that includes working as a press operator, concept artist in IP development, and designer/illustrator.

A former Specialist Solutions Consultant at Adobe, Tony has conducted graphic production and animation training worldwide; as an author, he has created several popular video titles for LinkedIn Learning, attracting over two million learners.

Tony's captivating speaking style and offbeat sessions have earned him popularity as a speaker and presenter—he is often seen as a guest and host on Adobe Live in the UK and USA. He often represents Adobe at many events and his sessions are filled with a wealth of tips, techniques, insights, and inspirations, delivered with a contagious sense of humor and enthusiasm.

eventSpeakers.description:
Kladi is an award-winning designer, visual strategist, instructor, author and Sr. Design Evangelist and Community Advocate at Adobe. Kladi has a long title with an even bigger mission: to empower, inspire, and support the creative community while sharing design and career tips. But most importantly a job that allows Kladi to focus on what she loves: People, Design, and Innovation. Reach out @iamkladi, her DM is always open for a chat.

Kladi runs an Instagram live show “Creative Connection Live” where the creative community comes together every week.

As a self-published author, Kladi's illustrated book, Plant Therapy, won the world-renowned Fedrigoni TOP Designer Award for her unique use of cotton papers and ink. Kladi has also been the winner of Infohackit and Adobe's Creative Jam during San Francisco Design Week.

In addition to her design work, Kladi often leads graphic design masterclasses for Adobe Live, Adobe events in UK and Design tutorials with over 5M views worldwide.

Kladi has also led social media asset creation workshops for House Representatives in Washington, D.C. for over 4 years. Kladi took part in Adobe MAX every year since 2019,in USA and also in UK as a featured speaker in the Design industry.

She was also a speaker at the exciting Illustrator Summit 2021, Creative PRO WEEK conference, Design & Marketing Summit, Design CUTS, and shared workflow tips in Illustrator in Spanish during Talent Land in Guadalajara, Mexico, and again during the Talented at Home. D many more design conferences around the world.

Kladi is a LinkedIn Learning and Creative Live author and producer; she was also named one of the world's top Illustrator instructors by Adobe Education.

Kladi recently authored, designed, and produced the Adobe Illustrator Bootcamp available on Adobe Education Exchange, Adobe Illustrator Conquests (animation & storyline-based onboarding for Ai beginners); Illustrator and Photoshop Cross-App onboarding hybrid tutorials, Creative essentials training course, Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator Templates with follow-along tutorials, hands-on tutorials available inside Illustrator's Discover Panel and the interconnected hybrid animated Photoshop and Illustrator videos that lead to the hands-on tutorials.

cards.description:
Being multi-hyphenate isn’t a flaw, it’s a framework. In this session, creator and entrepreneur Puno shares how to thrive as a “slashie” by turning what looks like chaos into a system. Learn how content can build visibility, community can create belonging, and creative income can make it all sustainable. Drawing on her own journey across business-building, community leadership, and brand partnerships, Puno offers practical tools and inspiring stories to help you embrace your slashie identity as a powerful career path.

You’ll learn:

  • How to reframe “multi-hyphenate” as a system, not a setback
  • Ways to use content as the foundation of visibility
  • The role of community in building trust and belonging
  • Approaches to diversifying creative income streams
  • A repeatable playbook for growing as a slashie creator

A powerful image isn’t just captured — it’s crafted. Join photographer Travis Keyes for a fast-paced online session exploring cinematic editing techniques that elevate your photography from good to unforgettable. Using Lightroom and Photoshop, Travis reveals how to shape mood, guide the viewer’s eye, and refine your visual voice through intentional post-production.

Whether you're editing a single portrait or a full campaign, you’ll learn how to transform raw captures into compelling visual narratives.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Refine images for bold, intentional impact
  • Use cinematic editing to evoke mood and meaning
  • Guide the viewer’s eye with masks and focal layering
  • Apply subtle Photoshop enhancements that elevate without overdoing
  • Reframe like a director — sharpen your story through crop and composition

Perfect for photographers and visual storytellers ready to push their editing further.

eventSpeakers.description: From film sets to dance floors, Travis W Keyes has always chased light, energy, and the unexpected. Based in NYC, he specializes in cinematic portraiture, bold branding work, and dynamic portraits for influencers, artists, and top-tier talent. With an eye for storytelling and a heart tuned to genuine connection, Travis captures moments that feel both stylized and soulfully real. He currently serves as National President of American Photographic Artists (APA) and served on Adobe’s Lightroom Advisory Board, a current member NAB Creator Council, a Sony Alpha Camera Advocate and Harlowe Lights “Ambassador of Light.” His career bridges fine art and commercial worlds, blending technical precision with an instinct for emotion and play. Whether leading photo walks, speaking on stages, or mentoring creatives, Travis brings his signature mix of passion, humor, and honesty. At Adobe MAX, he’ll guide attendees through capturing more than just images—he’ll help you freeze feeling, shape story, and add a little magic to every frame.

tags.title: Photography
tags.description: Spark your passion for photography with sessions that will help you build your photography skills and more easily achieve photo editing results you’re proud of using AI-powered tools and workflows, whether you’re taking photos with a smartphone or a mirrorless camera.

cards.description:
Join award-winning portrait photographer Meg Loeks as she shares her favorite Lightroom techniques for creating cinematic color and tone. Get an in-depth look at the simple yet powerful tools she turns to when crafting moody, colorful edits. Whether you're aiming for nostalgic warmth or bold storytelling hues, this session will help you level up your color grading workflow.

Topics include:

  • Color grading to shape overall mood
  • Selective color adjustments for a bold, targeted impact
  • Using gradients to build atmosphere and depth
cards.sessionTitle: Cinematic Color for Emotional Impact

eventSpeakers.description: Meg Loeks is a portrait photographer based in Michigan’s Upper Peninsula, where she lives on a hobby farm with her family. Her work is rooted in classic Americana and home life, but not the polished ideal. She leans into the mess, the beauty, the humor, and the contradictions of domesticity, using color and nostalgia not just as aesthetic choices, but as tools to challenge the status quo. Though Meg's love for photography began in childhood, hand-developing film in a darkroom, she initially pursued a degree in advertising and public relations. She returned to photography in a deeper, more personal way after becoming a mother, and it became her way of reclaiming time, space, and story. Today, Meg teaches workshops throughout the U.S. and internationally, encouraging artists to find voice in the everyday. She is honored to serve as a Imagen, Sigma and Profoto Ambassador, as well as a 2022 Lightroom Ambassador. Meg is also a volunteer with The Gold Hope Project, offering portrait sessions to families facing pediatric cancer.

tags.description: Whether you're just starting to explore a creative passion or ready to go all-in on a creator career, in this track you'll learn how to create mobile-first content, design for success across platforms like TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube, and use AI to take your ideas further.

cards.description:
What does it really take to build a lasting career as a creator today? In this edition of Creator Support, Colin & Samir answer your questions about the realities of being a creator today. From navigating creative burnout to growing an audience, landing brand deals, and building a business around your passion, no question is off-limits. Expect real creator questions, honest conversation, and tactical advice that help you build a roadmap as a creative entrepreneur.

You'll learn:

  • How to build a sustainable career as a creator
  • Frameworks to balance creative output with consistency and business strategy
  • 2026 creator economy trends
  • Actionable advice from top creators, and a chance to meet other creators with the same problems

Named to the 2025 TIME100 Creators list, they’re redefining how digital creators build businesses. As co-founders of The Publish Company, they produce creator-focused media, education, and events across YouTube (1.6M+ subscribers), The Publish Press newsletter (160K+ readers), and The Colin & Samir Show podcast. Through collaborations with creators like MrBeast and Emma Chamberlain and brands like Adobe, YouTube and Shopify, they spotlight how creators have become entrepreneurs shaping the future of media. Their work equips creative entrepreneurs with tools to build sustainable, impactful careers.

cards.title: Learning to Speak Data
cards.description:
Embark on a journey to give data a voice through design and storytelling. Designer, creative director, and author Valentina D’Efilippo, of Apostrophe One Limited, will share her personal journey — how she learned to speak data and give a voice to numbers through visual storytelling. By lifting the lid on her creative process to transform complexity into meaningful narratives, she will demonstrate how to think about data storytelling, design visual systems that transcend standard charts, and harness personal passion and curiosity to create work that informs and sparks action.

Key takeaways:

  • Demystify the design process for transforming raw data into compelling visual stories
  • Master storytelling techniques that bring numbers to life
  • Break the mold of traditional charts and develop unique visual frameworks in Illustrator
  • Be inspired to express your values and create meaningful dialogue by designing with data
cards.sessionTitle: Learning to Speak Data

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Designer, Creative Director, Author, Adobe Community Expert
eventSpeakers.description:
Valentina D'Efilippo, an award-winning designer, creative director, and author, is renowned for her ability to inspire, move, and connect people through data-driven experiences. Her work includes the critically acclaimed "The Infographic History of the World," available in eleven languages, and the innovative "Britannica’s Encyclopedia Infographica," a children's encyclopedia filled with facts and infographics about the universe, wildlife, and human anatomy.

Valentina's creativity and insight have led to collaborations with diverse organizations, from startups to global brands, in various fields and formats, including theatre performances, exhibitions, and digital platforms. Beyond her projects, Valentina is passionate about education and knowledge sharing, offering coaching to corporate teams, lecturing at institutions like Columbia Business School, and running popular Masterclasses. Her contributions to the field have been internationally exhibited and are part of the permanent collection at the Weltmuseum in Vienna. In recognition of her influence and innovation, she was named one of Campaign’s 30 Future Creative Female Leaders in 2018.

tags.title: Video, Audio, and Motion
tags.description: Learn how to edit your first video, transform static graphics into motion, create an animated explainer video, and apply visual effects to a marketing video. Leverage generative AI in your video workflow and collaborate with Frame.io.

cards.description:
Tired of animations that clunk like a bag of rocks tumbling down a creaky staircase? Want your keyframes to glide with jaw-dropping elegance, stealing the spotlight in award-worthy motion design? The secret lies in the value graph — the unsung hero of Graph Editor in After Effects. Join acclaimed motion design superstar, Nol Honig, as he unveils the irresistible power of this hidden gem, transforming your animations into smooth, smart, and stunningly polished masterpieces.

In this session, Nol will show you how to:

  • Master the value graph and ditch the speed graph for good
  • Smooth out clunky keyframes like a seasoned pro
  • Unlock more control, clarity, and satisfaction with animations that dazzle and delight

eventSpeakers.description:
Nol Honig is an award-winning director, motion designer, and educator based in New York City. He began his career in broadcast and political media, serving as a lead animator for Barack Obama’s 2012 re-election campaign. In 2013, he founded The Drawing Room, a creative studio specializing in design-driven animation. Through the studio, Nol has directed work for clients such as Netflix, Coca-Cola, The History Channel, and the Philadelphia Museum of Art, and has contributed animation and design leadership to projects for The New York Times, Google, NBC, and the Sundance Film Festival.

Over the years, Nol has also collaborated as a freelance designer and art director with top-tier studios including Elastic, Golden Wolf, Pentagram, Buck, Gretel, and Block & Tackle. From 2001 to 2019, he taught motion graphics at Parsons School of Design, where he was honored with a Distinguished Teaching Award in 2017.

Most recently, Nol received a Silver Cube from the ADC Awards for directing the opening title sequence of the Netflix documentary series The Andy Warhol Diaries.

cards.description:
Whether you’re a designer who uses images in your daily work or a casual photographer capturing vacation photos of your family, powerful AI editing tools in Adobe Lightroom can make your workflow faster, easier, and more efficient. In this session, longtime photo educator Forest Chaput de Saintonge will walk you through the main AI-powered features available in Lightroom for desktop in an easy-to-understand, beginner-friendly way. It’s perfect for people who work with images every day and want to leverage every tool they can to get better images faster.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Clean up distracting elements with a couple of clicks
  • Apply automatic edits tailored to your specific images
  • Improve overall image quality
  • Edit specific areas of an image to draw attention to key elements
  • Make smartphone images look more like they were captured with a professional camera

eventSpeakers.description:
Forest Chaput de Saintonge is a Montana-based photography educator and workflow specialist who helps creatives build reliable, scalable storage systems in Lightroom, Lightroom Classic and Photoshop. He runs Everlight Education and creates in-depth tutorials for a YouTube audience of 120K+ subscribers. Forest also helps produce in-app learning content for Adobe Photoshop, writing step-by-step workflows and recording concise, how-to videos that help creatives maximize the capabilities of the application.

Previously the Director of Rocky Mountain School of Photography, Forest brings a systems mindset and focuses his teaching on catalog design, NAS workflows, and efficient editing practices that keep photographers organized and fast. Forest’s non-work passion is for astrophotography, shaped by his astrophysics degree and work with the MINERVA Exoplanet Observatory Team. He also speaks at events such as Night Photo Summit and Nightscaper.

cards.description:
Today’s most resonant brands aren’t built — they’re lived. As branding shifts from static assets to adaptive ecosystems, designers must think beyond logos and guidelines. Join award-winning visual strategist Kladi Vergine to explore the future of dynamic branding — flexible systems rooted in strong foundations and thoughtful methodology. Learn how to balance structure and freedom, align internal vision with customer experience, and express identity through motion, interaction, and emotion — beyond what’s merely seen.

Kladi will show you how to:

  • Rethink brand identity as a dynamic ecosystem — not a fixed toolkit
  • Align corporate vision with real-world brand perception and culture
  • Create systems that adapt across media while staying grounded in strategy
  • Design brands that feel consistent not through rules, but relationships

eventSpeakers.description:
Kladi is an award-winning designer, visual strategist, instructor, author and Sr. Design Evangelist and Community Advocate at Adobe. Kladi has a long title with an even bigger mission: to empower, inspire, and support the creative community while sharing design and career tips. But most importantly a job that allows Kladi to focus on what she loves: People, Design, and Innovation. Reach out @iamkladi, her DM is always open for a chat.

Kladi runs an Instagram live show “Creative Connection Live” where the creative community comes together every week.

As a self-published author, Kladi's illustrated book, Plant Therapy, won the world-renowned Fedrigoni TOP Designer Award for her unique use of cotton papers and ink. Kladi has also been the winner of Infohackit and Adobe's Creative Jam during San Francisco Design Week.

In addition to her design work, Kladi often leads graphic design masterclasses for Adobe Live, Adobe events in UK and Design tutorials with over 5M views worldwide.

Kladi has also led social media asset creation workshops for House Representatives in Washington, D.C. for over 4 years. Kladi took part in Adobe MAX every year since 2019,in USA and also in UK as a featured speaker in the Design industry.

She was also a speaker at the exciting Illustrator Summit 2021, Creative PRO WEEK conference, Design & Marketing Summit, Design CUTS, and shared workflow tips in Illustrator in Spanish during Talent Land in Guadalajara, Mexico, and again during the Talented at Home. D many more design conferences around the world.

Kladi is a LinkedIn Learning and Creative Live author and producer; she was also named one of the world's top Illustrator instructors by Adobe Education.

Kladi recently authored, designed, and produced the Adobe Illustrator Bootcamp available on Adobe Education Exchange, Adobe Illustrator Conquests (animation & storyline-based onboarding for Ai beginners); Illustrator and Photoshop Cross-App onboarding hybrid tutorials, Creative essentials training course, Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator Templates with follow-along tutorials, hands-on tutorials available inside Illustrator's Discover Panel and the interconnected hybrid animated Photoshop and Illustrator videos that lead to the hands-on tutorials.

tags.title: Creativity and Marketing in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. They’ll cover everything from brand reinvention and strategy to supercharging creative workflows to new tools for scaling campaign assets.

cards.description:
As stewards of beloved brands like Sharpie, Paper Mate, Elmer’s Glue, and Yankee Candle, Sam Tuttle, Marketing Director at Newell Brands, and Julie Sheeran, Creative Content Technologist, understand the pressure of creating enough content to fuel hundreds of campaigns each year. That's why they led a team of creatives and marketers in an overhaul of their legacy systems - and rebuilt them as a future-ready content ecosystem that keeps creatives and marketers working at peak creativity and performance. By harnessing AI-powered workflows across packaging, photography, banners, and 3D, they have achieved creative scale like never before – and they’re just getting started.


Join this session to see how they did it—and walk away with a blueprint to build your own content engine of the future. Join Sam and Julie for a masterclass on creative-led AI transformation and learn about:

  • Building a connected, scalable content ecosystem
  • AI workflows that unlock creative capacity and future-proof workflows
  • Change management strategies that empower teams and fuel growth

Known for blending creativity with structure, she excels at uniting cross-functional teams, streamlining workflows, and delivering impactful, scalable solutions. Passionate about collaboration and innovation, Julie brings energy, empathy, and vision to every project she leads.

Her strategic leadership has supported key business initiatives, from designing new operating models to executing executive-level events with major partners like Amazon. Samantha is known for her ability to partner across all levels of an organization—from creative teams to the C-suite—ensuring high-impact delivery and sustainable growth.

tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description:
Step inside the colorful world of Tad Carpenter, designer, illustrator, and co-founder of brand design studio Carpenter Collective. In this honest walk through the studio’s creative process, Tad shares how his childhood wandering Hallmark's hallways sparked a lifelong love affair with playful, purposeful design. You'll get an intimate look at how he and his wife and creative partner, Jessica, transform their childlike wonder into award-winning brand systems that capture hearts and turn heads.

Part behind-the-scenes studio tour, part inspiration rally, this session delivers honest insights wrapped in Tad's signature warmth and wit. You'll learn:

  • Why protecting your sense of play might be your most powerful professional asset
  • How deep research and strategic thinking transform good design into unforgettable brand experiences
  • The secrets to building comprehensive brand systems that work across every touchpoint
  • Ways to cultivate gratitude as your creative superpower, even when facing design storms
cards.sessionTitle: Sunshine and Storms: Weathering a Creative Life

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Sunshine and Storms: Weathering a Creative Life

eventSpeakers.description: Tad Carpenter is a designer, illustrator, author and educator based in Kansas City, Missouri. Carpenter co-runs the design and branding studio, Carpenter Collective with his wife, Jessica Carpenter where they focus on bringing powerful messages to life through branding, packaging, illustration and design. They have worked with clients ranging from Target, Coca-Cola, Starbucks, Macy’s, Old Navy, Conan O'Brien, Adobe and MTV among many others. Carpenter has worked with numerous bands on posters and tour campaigns for over 10 years, including John Mayer, Bob Dylan, Radiohead, Paul McCartney and Dave Matthews Band to name a few. Carpenter has written and illustrated over twenty children's books in our marketplace today intended for adults and children of all ages.

cards.title: Building Tomorrow: Digital Art as a Cultural Force

tags.title: Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description:
What happens when digital worlds stop being fantasy and start shaping the future? Multidisciplinary artist Serwah Attafuah has built entire universes that influence how we see ourselves, our culture, and what’s possible. From collaborations with Nike and Adobe to exhibitions at Sotheby’s, her Afrofuturist 3D art proves that digital creation is the new frontier of cultural impact.

Through immersive visuals and behind-the-scenes insights, Serwah reveals how her acclaimed work The Darkness Between the Stars transcends pixels to create physical experiences and drive social change.

You'll discover:

  • Purposeful worldbuilding that resonates beyond entertainment and into cultural influence
  • Character design as identity exploration — developing digital personas that challenge perception
  • From virtual to viral impact — translating digital art into commercial and cultural success
cards.sessionTitle: Building Tomorrow: Digital Art as a Cultural Force

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Building Tomorrow: Digital Art as a Cultural Force

eventSpeakers.description: Serwah Attafuah is a multidisciplinary artist and musician based on Dharug land/West Sydney, Australia. She creates surreal cyber dreamscapes and heavenly wastelands, populated by afro-futuristic abstractions of self with strong ancestral and contemporary themes. Serwah has collaborated and been commissioned by clients including Mercedes Benz, Nike, GQ, Adobe, Paris Hilton and Charli XCX. Recent notable achievements include her participation in Sotheby's 'Natively Digital': A Curated NFT auction and 'Apotheosis': a live motion capture experience with Soft Centre at The Sydney Opera House.

tags.title: Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description: Explore the latest product announcements, features, and innovations that will help you bring your creative vision to life. Adobe leaders, including Shantanu Narayen, chair and chief executive officer, and David Wadhwani, president, digital media business, preview what’s ahead.
cards.sessionTitle: Asia Pacific Opening Keynote

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Adobe’s Vision: Control, Collaboration, and Creative Freedom
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
David Wadhwani is responsible for the success of Adobe’s global Digital Media business across Adobe Creative Cloud and Adobe Document Cloud, including all product management, product marketing, engineering, strategic partnerships, customer support and to go-to-market across geographies. This includes iconic software brands such as Photoshop, Lightroom, Illustrator, InDesign and Acrobat.

David was most recently a Venture Partner at Greylock Partners. Prior to joining Greylock, he was president and CEO of AppDynamics, leading the company as it transformed to a SaaS-first business and became one of the fastest-growing enterprise software companies at the time.

This is David’s second tour of duty at Adobe. He joined Adobe in 2005 through the company’s acquisition of Macromedia, Inc., where he had been vice president of developer products. As senior vice president and general manager of Adobe’s Digital Media business, David played an instrumental role in advancing the company’s category leadership, expanding into new markets and contributing to its successful transformation to a cloud-based subscription business.

David holds a bachelor’s degree in computer science from Brown University and serves on the Brown computer science department advisory board. He is also on the digital advisory board of The Metropolitan Museum of Art and on the board of trustees for StoryCorps and the Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Shantanu Narayen is chairman and chief executive officer of Adobe, one of the largest and most diversified software companies in the world.

Adobe’s mission is to change the world through digital experiences, serving a large customer base from students to business communicators to the world’s largest enterprises. As CEO, Shantanu has transformed the company into an industry innovator by pioneering a cloud-based subscription model for its creative suite, establishing the global standard for digital documents, and creating and leading the explosive digital experience category. Today, he’s driving the company’s strategy to unleash creativity for all, accelerate document productivity, and power digital business.

Under Shantanu’s leadership, Adobe has achieved record revenue and industry recognition for its inclusive, innovative, and exceptional workplace, including being continuously named a Great Place to Work and a Most Admired Company by Fortune.

Shantanu joined Adobe in 1998 as vice president and general manager of its engineering technology group. He became president and COO in 2005, CEO in 2007, and chairman of the board in 2017.

Shantanu is vice chairman of the US-India Strategic Partnership Forum and sits on the board of Pfizer. He previously served as a director of Dell and is a past member of the U.S. President’s Management Advisory Board. Shantanu has been recognized by several publications as one of the world’s leading executives, including Barron’s World’s Best CEOs and Fortune Businessperson of the Year lists, and named a Top CEO by Glassdoor based on employee feedback. He is a recipient of India’s civilian honor Padma Shri and the Economic Times Global Indian of the Year award.

Before joining Adobe, Shantanu held product development roles at Apple and Silicon Graphics before cofounding an early photo-sharing startup, Pictra.

Shantanu holds five patents. He has a bachelor’s degree in electronics engineering from Osmania University, a master’s degree in computer science from Bowling Green State University and a master’s degree in business administration from the University of California at Berkeley’s Haas School of Business. Shantanu once represented India in sailing at an Asian regatta.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Idea to Output: Firefly and Premiere on iPhone
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description: Paul Trani is Principal Director Evangelist at Adobe, where he is committed to empowering designers to expand creative boundaries and embrace emerging technologies. With more than 30 years of experience as an award-winning visual designer, instructor, and public speaker, Paul has established a global reputation for inspiring and educating creative communities. Beyond his professional endeavors, he is an avid enthusiast of racquet sports—including, of course, pickleball.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote
Super Session: Future-Proofing Your Design Career in the Age of AI

eventSpeakers.description: Danielle Morimoto leads the design team responsible for Adobe Firefly and Generative AI on the Machine Intelligence and New Technologies team at Adobe. She helps define the most compelling experiences and emerging technologies by uncovering untapped potential, ultimately identifying how people could be using Adobe in the future. She’s an avid road cyclist, NBA Golden State Warriors fan and lover of ice cream.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Chief Technology Officer & SVP Creative Products Group, Digital Media

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Idea to Output: Firefly and Premiere on iPhone
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Ely Greenfield is the Chief Technology Officer and SVP of Adobe’s Creative Products Group, overseeing Creative Cloud, including flagship applications like Photoshop, Premiere Pro, and Illustrator, as well as generative AI initiatives like Adobe Firefly.

As CTO of Adobe’s Digital Media business, he drives technology strategy, fostering innovation across Creative Cloud and Document Cloud. ​ Ely led the launch of Adobe Firefly, the company’s first commercially safe generative AI model, now integrated into Adobe’s workflows to empower users of all skill levels.

Ely also oversees Adobe Research, focusing on AI, creative design tools, and immersive media. ​ Before rejoining Adobe, Ely was CTO of AppDynamics, leading engineering for scalable systems. ​ Earlier, he spent 20 years at Adobe and Macromedia, contributing to product development and business incubation, including Adobe Express. ​Ely holds a computer science degree from Brown University.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Idea to Output: Firefly and Premiere on iPhone
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Lucy is a brand designer and Adobe Evangelist from Wales, UK. She launched her studio, Lugi Design Studio, in 2019 after building on her design skills while studying at the Manchester School of Architecture. Since then, she’s worked with clients around the world, blending creative expertise with strategic thinking to craft brand identities with purpose. Alongside her studio, Lucy has built a vibrant online community where she shares design insights and inspiration with fellow creatives.

Lucy joined Adobe two years ago and has since spoken at events across Europe, including taking the stage as a keynote speaker at MAX London earlier this year. Drawing on her experience in both design and community building, she’s passionate about sharing what she’s learned and inspiring the next generation of creatives to make their ideas happen.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Idea to Output: Firefly and Premiere on iPhone
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description: Kelly, a California native and Detroit transplant, is a world traveler and design innovator. As an Experience Designer at Adobe, she tackles complex challenges with fresh, technical solutions, contributing to Adobe Firefly and Generative AI for Audio and Video. Dedicated to engaging with creatives, Kelly builds connections with artists both in Detroit and globally. Outside of work, she enjoys photography, video production, and interior design.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Deepa Subramaniam is Vice President, Product Marketing for Creative Professionals at Adobe, where she is responsible for driving Adobe’s digital imaging, photography, video, design and generative AI businesses forward.

Deepa has over 18 year's experience leading product teams to collaboratively build innovative digital products as well as a proven track record in strategy and execution, while acting as a frequent advisor to founders, CEOs and CPOs on product strategy, product execution and organizational optimization.

Prior to Adobe, Deepa served as the ACLU’s first ever Chief Technology and Digital Officer where she led the Digital, Engineering, Product and Design teams, as Vice President of Product and Design at Kickstarter where she helped revamp the platform for the next decade of creative campaigning and as Director of Product at Hillary for America, where her she led product development for online fundraising, voter registration and get out the vote initiatives.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Sr. Design Evangelist for Next Gen Creative Pros

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Hello everyone, my name is Michael Fugoso. If you are familiar with my work you probably know me via my Instagram alias FUGSTRATOR . I am an illustrator/designer originally from San Diego, now functioning in Austin, TX. I've mainly done illustrative work for some of the largest aerospace companies out there, like NASA, Boeing, Blue Origin, Ariane Group and more, and I've also done plenty of official illustrative work for massive companies like Oracle, IBM, Salesforce, Volvo and many more. And I'm now thrilled to be on the Global Evangelism team at Adobe!

Most of my life I wasn't in the professional artist/designer world. Through age 29 I lived what is perceived by many a “normal life,” going through business school and eventually working as a banker. At age 30 the arts called to me and my life changed from there.

I am 40 years old now. In the ten years of creating and illustrating a ton of spaceships, rockets, jet planes, and robots, I luckily found what I love in this latter part of my life.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Principal Director, Creative Cloud Evangelist and Community Advocate

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description: Terry White, a celebrated professional with a 29-year career at Adobe, serves as a Principal Director, Photography Evangelist, and Community Advocate, expertly leading and inspiring both teams and Adobe’s vast user community. A prominent speaker at events like TEDx and Photoshop World, award-winning photographer, and the 34th inductee into the Photoshop Hall of Fame, Terry also connects with audiences via his popular YouTube Photography Masterclass. His authorship and tech exploration further underscore his comprehensive expertise and influence in the creative and tech worlds.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Sr. Quality Engineer and Animation Explorer

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote
Video Super Session: Artistry in Motion

eventSpeakers.description:
Dacia Sáenz is a multidisciplinary creative and storyteller whose career began in Austin, TX, where she worked in film and television with CNBC, PBS, and the Sundance Foundation. A skilled writer as well as a producer, she was published (under a pen name) in The Kicked Out Anthology, named one of the top books of 2011 by the LGBTQ Roundtable of the American Library Association.

In Seattle, she earned a Master’s in Digital Media from the University of Washington, premiered two short films at the Seattle International Film Festival (2012 & 2013), and won the Audience Choice Award at the Next Fifty Film Festival. Her storytelling practice expanded globally through multimedia projects in Thailand and El Salvador with the Seattle Globalist and the UW Center for Human Rights.

Now based in Texas, Dacia continues to create work rooted in community. She recently directed and edited an award-winning short documentary on the Uvalde Love Project, a NEA-supported initiative using art therapy and murals to catalyze healing after tragedy.

Dacia currently works at Adobe, where she brings her passion for user experience, motion design, and creative video tools into product development. Outside of work, she explores experimental animation and synthesizers with playful obsession.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: VP of Strategy & Business Operations & Chief of Staff to President David Wadhwani

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Adobe AI Foundry: Transforming Content Creation
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Allison is Vice President of Business & Strategic Operations and Chief of Staff to President David Wadhwani at Adobe, where she runs day-to-day operations of Digital Media, the company’s largest business. In this capacity, she leads the development and implementation of business strategy for Adobe’s market-leading Creative Cloud and Document Cloud products – including Adobe Photoshop, Acrobat, Illustrator and Express – along with Adobe Firefly, its groundbreaking family of generative AI models.

In more than seven years at Adobe, Ms. Blais has developed a reputation for delivering results and putting her intellectual curiosity, grit, judgment, analytical expertise and legal background to work solving the company’s toughest challenges. She previously served as Adobe’s Vice President and Associate General Counsel, leading its Corporate Legal Team and managing areas like M&A, SEC reporting and the company’s Board of Directors.

Prior to joining Adobe, Ms. Blais spent more than 15 years in the financial sector, serving as a Chief Risk Officer for a broker-dealer and investment advisor, as well as in-house counsel at FINRA the financial regulator.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Adobe’s Vision: Control, Collaboration, and Creative Freedom
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Kelsey Slay is a multi-passionate designer, illustrator, and content creator based in Tennessee. From glittery cat collages to bold Halloween inspired illustrations, Kelsey’s work lives at the intersection of spooky and sweet, DIY arts and crafts nostalgia, and internet humor. Her creative journey took an unexpected turn when Adobe discovered her on TikTok and invited her to join the team as a Design Evangelist.

Now, Kelsey shares her love for design both online and on stage with a goal to empower the next generation of creatives with tutorials, storytelling, and an open-door approach to creative community. When she’s not designing, you can usually find her collecting new hobbies, traveling, or posting about her cats.

cards.description: Sabrina – TV host, entrepreneur, and founder of the social media agency save our socials (short: SOS). I've been behind & in front of the camera for over 12 years while helping brands shape their digital communication. On Instagram and TikTok, I share my everyday life between content, camera, and viral videos. My focus: content that moves people, entertains – and performs. I love powerful storytelling, bold brands, and clear messages paired with viral reach.

He is a sought-after speaker on many industry events around the globe and enjoys sharing his passion for directing, making movies, VFX, and motion graphics. When he is not entangled between keyframes, you can find him most likely either playing or watching Basketball.

cards.title: Omnicom Predicts: Generative AI, Creative, and a Bright Brand Future
cards.description:
Creative is on the brink of its biggest evolution yet. What happens in the coming days and years will redefine the industry more than the last two decades combined. Join Omnicom, a global leader in marketing innovation, as we set the stage for how brands can go beyond basic personalization to create truly transformative experiences. Discover actionable strategies to harness generative AI, fuse it with human insight, and use rapid prototyping to build a future-ready creative foundation that drives long-term brand impact, not just quick wins.

Learning objectives:

  • Perspectives: learn from the successes, tests, and failures in the world of design, brand, and advertising
  • Predictions: see the future trajectory of creative/brand and geneative AI’s role in expanding brand experiences that drive the business
  • Playbook: discover techniques and models for elevating beyond the tactical and into a strategic iterative process that leverages data to drive brand growth
cards.sessionTitle: Omnicom Predicts: Generative AI, Creative, and a Bright Brand Future

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Omnicom Predicts: Generative AI, Creative, and a Bright Brand Future

eventSpeakers.description: Jen is passionate about empowering organizations to clearly define success and achieve it through aligned work. She is an accomplished leader with experience leading people-centered digital transformation, including go-to-market and work management transformations for many Fortune 500 brands. She combines deep industry knowledge with practical experience leading large-scale technical implementations and a change management background to ultimately help align business’ work around shared outcomes and create pathways to execution that deliver measurable results.​

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Omnicom Predicts: Generative AI, Creative, and a Bright Brand Future

eventSpeakers.description: Val is the Global Chief Creative Officer at Critical Mass and leads creative for Omnicom’s partnership with the Adobe Enterprise team. She’s known throughout the industry as an avid storyteller, with over 25 years of creative experience across design, product, AR/VR, film, brand strategy, marketing, retail innovation, gaming, AI, 3D content, and applications for some of the world’s biggest brands such as FOX Entertainment, James Cameron's Avatar, Diageo, Peloton, JPMorgan Chase, Coke, Microsoft, AT&T, BMW, Mars, Kraft, and Lululemon. With her deep background in creative technology & design craft, Val works with clients to deliver experiences driven by human insights infused by data. Under Val’s leadership, Critical Mass has gained a reputation for combining big creative thinking with powerful digital innovation—all while delivering real results for modern brands. In the past year alone, CM has brought home three Cannes Lions and multiple Effie awards, we were named a finalist for Campaign U.S.’s Agency of the Year (digital innovation category) for the third straight year. Megan Cacioppo

cards.title: Turning Play into Powerful Design
cards.description:
Growing up doesn’t mean growing out of wonder. In this inspirational session, illustrator, animator, and toy designer Hippy Potter shares how he crafted an entire universe, in the world of Adobe Illustrator, to transform childhood passions into tangible art — from collectible toys to vibrant brand experiences — all rooted in the joy of “kidulting”.

In this session Hippy will explore:

  • How Illustrator helps bring imagined worlds to life
  • Practical illustration and cartoon styling techniques you can use in your own art
  • Infusing identity, whimsy, and joy into the foundation of every design
cards.sessionTitle: Turning Play into Powerful Design

eventSpeakers.description:
Thaddeus Coates, aka Hippy Potter, is a New York-based illustrator, animator, and toy designer known for bringing bold color and joyful storytelling to life. He began his professional career as an illustrator interning at Nickelodeon, where he learned about the craft of art and animation. He studied advertising design at Fashion Institute of Technology and immersed himself in the creative energy of the city. He launched his career blending digital and traditional techniques to craft work that feels both nostalgic and fresh.

Today, Thaddeus works in both the 2D and animation art space—and while his work ranges across media from packaging to toy design, to products, to long and short form animation—he's instantly recognizable for his bold color palettes, expressive characters, and nostalgic charm. His art blends joy, emotion, and cultural storytelling—celebrating Blackness, queerness, and the magic of being seen.

Thaddeus’ dynamic and imaginative work has been featured in Ad Age’s 2022 Creators to Know and showcased in-house with Hulu via Abbott Elementary. His vibrant visual storytelling has driven campaigns with brands like Adobe, Cartoon Network, Disney, DC Comics, Kellogg’s, Kleenex, Lunchables, Urban Decay, and Garnier—infusing every project with heart, humor, and unforgettable style.

cards.title: Empowering Creatives: Education & Industry in the Age of AI

tags.title: Generative AI
tags.description: While AI is reshaping the creative landscape, human imagination has never been more essential or more powerful. Discover how generative AI features in your favorite Adobe tools will help you speed workflows, expand your skillset, and gain greater creative control.

cards.description:
Discover how the Parsons School of Design and Adobe are shaping the next generation of creative leaders.​ Join Jeongki Lim, Dean, Parsons School of Design, and Hannah Elsakr, Vice President, Business & New Venture Incubation at Adobe, for an inspiring discussion of the skills, tools, and mindsets needed to thrive in an AI-driven world. ​Explore real-world examples, ethical considerations, and groundbreaking innovations that are transforming the way students, creators, and professionals approach design.

With perspectives from both academia and industry, this session will:

  • Challenge you to think bigger, adapt faster, and embrace the limitless possibilities of AI in creativity
  • Gain insights into balancing ethical responsibility with innovation when applying AI in design
  • Explore how to future-proof your skills and mindset to stay adaptable in a rapidly evolving creative landscape
cards.sessionTitle: Empowering Creatives: Education & Industry in the Age of AI

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Empowering Creatives: Education & Industry in the Age of AI

eventSpeakers.description: Jeongki Lim is the Dean of the School of Design Strategies at Parsons School of Design, The New School, and Associate Professor of Strategic Design and Management. His work bridges design, science, and strategy, with a focus on how emerging technologies—particularly artificial intelligence (AI)—can expand creative practice and education. Through both research and practice, Jeongki leads initiatives that span the private and public sectors, advancing innovation at the intersection of design and technology. His recent projects explore AI not just as a set of tools, but as instrumental and relational artifacts that can shape the future of creative learning. He leads a multi-year academic research collaboration with technology partners, developing AI-enabled methods and systems to enhance art and design pedagogy. Jeongki’s scholarship has been published in leading peer-reviewed venues, and his teaching emphasizes accessibility, criticality, and interdisciplinarity. In the classroom, he engages with emerging topics of strategic importance—including complexity science, the metaverse, design futures, computational thinking, and multispectral design—to help the next generation of designers address pressing global challenges. Jeongki holds a B.A. and an M.S. from New York University, as well as a Doctor of Arts in New Media from Aalto University, Finland.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Empowering Creatives: Education & Industry in the Age of AI
The Art of the Possible with AI in Film and Entertainment

eventSpeakers.description:
Hannah C. Elsakr is Vice President of GenAI New Business Ventures. She recently launched Adobe Firefly Foundry, a GenAI deep-tuning managed service and Adobe Firefly for Enterprise, Firefly Services & Firefly Custom Models.

Hannah is passionate about looking around the corner for new technology opportunities that delight customers & ecosystem partners. She previously led Corporate Development and was Chief of Staff to Adobe’s CEO, Shantanu Narayen, and led the office of the CEO.

Hannah is also Board President for the Adobe Foundation, which creates positive change through support for creative and digital literacy, social equity and opportunity, and active engagement in the communities where we live and work.

Hannah has experience leading global businesses in ecommerce & marketplaces, consumer products, SaaS and advisory services. Prior to joining Adobe, she was the Vice President at eBay with P&L responsibility for eBay’s Canada, Latin America and U.S. Exports businesses as well as business operations. Hannah previously held leadership roles at eBay, Del Monte Foods, Avon Products, McKinsey & Co., and J.P. Morgan.

Hannah holds a Bachelor of Science degree in applied mathematics with computer science from MIT and an MBA from Harvard Business School. In 2023, Hannah was recognized as one of Silicon Valley Business Journal’s “Women of Influence.

cards.title: Insight to Impact: How Creativity with AI Transforms Learning
cards.description:
Discover how creativity and generative AI are shaping student success, and how educators can apply these insights in their own classrooms. In this session, researchers and content designers from the Adobe for Education team share new global findings on the academic, career, and skill-building benefits of creativity and AI in K–12 and Higher Education. Then, see how guided activities and content in Adobe Express for education are co-designed with educators to ensure pedagogical effectiveness and tested with research partners in classrooms.

In this session, you'll learn:

  • Key research takeaways on creativity, AI, and student outcomes
  • Strategies to integrate AI while fostering originality and critical thinking
  • Practical ways to use Adobe Express for education to build digital and AI fluency and creative confidence
cards.sessionTitle: Insight to Impact: How Creativity with AI Transforms Learning

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Head of Education Content, K12 and Higher Education

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Insight to Impact: How Creativity with AI Transforms Learning

eventSpeakers.description: How does a design consultant in Italy end up teaching in Missouri, co-authoring two books on learning spaces and joining Adobe’s Education Team? After a decade in Italy as a design consultant and creative director, Rebecca found that the young designers she hired struggled with problem-solving and critical thinking. She returned to the U.S. to study education and built on her BFA in Industrial Design from The European Design Institute in Milan, Italy with a M.A.T. in Art from Fontbonne University, St. Louis. Her Master's thesis focused on Design Thinking and evaluating and enhancing creativity through the study of design and art. That led her to working as a learning space designer, which resulted in the books she co-authored: The Space: A Guide for Educators and The Space: A Guide for Leaders. Rebecca has taught art and innovation, science, Design Thinking, graphic design, engineering and architecture. She has worked with a number of schools to collaboratively design learning spaces and experiences that enhance student learning, agency and making thinking visible. Now, Rebecca leads Adobe’s Education Content Team for K12 and Higher Education.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Global Head of Education Learning and Advocacy

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Insight to Impact: How Creativity with AI Transforms Learning

eventSpeakers.description: Brian Johnsrud is the Global Head of Education Thought Leadership and Student Success at Adobe. As a former K-12 teacher, college lecturer, researcher and thought leader in education technology, he’s passionate about helping the next generation unlock their creativity and acquire essential digital literacy and AI skills needed for success in school, careers, and beyond. Brian is a former K12 teacher and college lecturer, with a PhD in education, digital media, and humanities, and master’s degrees in literature, media studies, and cultural anthropology. Brian also founded and directed a digital humanities and education research lab at Stanford University, designing and studying the efficacy of digital tools for learning. He also formerly led the curriculum and content team at Khan Academy, and he serves on boards and committees for a number of nonprofits and NGOs including World Economic Forum and the Rhodes Scholarship.

cards.title: Delivering Real Value with AI: Where to Start

tags.title: Creativity and Marketing in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. They’ll cover everything from brand reinvention and strategy to supercharging creative workflows to new tools for scaling campaign assets.

cards.description:
AI offers real opportunities to help creative and marketing teams meet the exploding demand for content. But many organizations are stuck in pilot mode, unsure of where to commit to drive impact, and how to prepare their teams for new ways of working. In this session, Adobe and Accenture will share insights on the highest-value use cases to focus on by industry and be joined by creative leaders from Coach and Coca Cola to bring these opportunities to life through real-world examples and best practices.

In this session, you will:

  • Learn about the highest areas of value in AI-driven content creation and production by industry
  • Hear from organizations who are already delivering value —and what they’ve learned along the way
  • Connect with fellow creative and marketing leaders navigating both challenges and opportunities in today’s AI-powered content landscape
cards.sessionTitle: Delivering Real Value with AI: Where to Start

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Director of Product Marketing, Firefly Enterprise

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Delivering Real Value with AI: Where to Start

eventSpeakers.description:
Tammy leads Portfolio Strategy and Marketing for Adobe’s Digital Media business, focusing on Enterprise customers. In this role, she works with Adobe's product, go-to-market, marketing, and business transformation leadership teams to innovate our suite of Creative and Document cloud solutions for large organizations to deliver business value. Prior to this role, Tammy led the creation of the Content Supply Chain initiative at Adobe, and was also a Director at Adobe’s Digital Strategy Group, where she worked with Adobe’s top MEC customers to help drive digital experience transformation and business value.

Throughout her career, Tammy has led numerous teams and organizations through digital transformations and developed strategies around change management to enable teams and empower individuals. Prior to joining Adobe, Tammy spent over six years at Univision Communications, developing a digital vision, audience engagement, product, and sales strategy for the company’s 120+ local radio and TV stations. Prior to that, she led the planning, launch and tracking of strategic initiatives at Warner Music Group, and was a management consultant at Bain & Company, where she advised clients in the Media, CPG, Financial Services and Healthcare industries.

Tammy holds an MBA from the Wharton School, and an Electrical Engineering ScB degree from Brown University. She lives in NYC and enjoys travel, culture, and burgers.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Delivering Real Value with AI: Where to Start

eventSpeakers.description: Pete is a Managing Director at Accenture Song, responsible for Song’s partnership with Adobe in the Americas. Prior to this role he held a wide range of leadership roles at Accenture including product strategy, innovation & design, growth strategy, and large-scale transformation, including the development of internal joint ventures and running Accenture’s New York Innovation Hub. His focus is enabling companies to activate their business strategies through the intersection of technology delivery, organizational change, and enterprise value, powered by Adobe.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Global Head of Design Intelligence and Human AI Experiences

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Delivering Real Value with AI: Where to Start

eventSpeakers.description:
With over two decades of pioneering experience, Dominik (Dom) Heinrich is a curious innovator, patented (AI) inventor, and global leader of design deeply embedded in AI. His expertise lies in bridging the gap between creativity and technology, having worked for and with the Top Fortune 100 to accelerate their growth and design impactful solutions. He is known for his appearance in the Wired documentary "Being Human in an AI World" and as a global thought leader and speaker in the AI space.

Currently, Dom leads AI Design globally at The Coca-Cola Company, where he drives the integration of artificial intelligence into design to foster groundbreaking products and experiences across the brand portfolio. Additionally, he also serves as the Co-Founder at Creative AI Academy and as Adjunct Professor for Infinite (AI) Design at Pratt Institute. Dom is deeply committed to educating the next wave of designers and innovators, strongly believing in a harmonious Human-Machine Relationship.

His career is marked by significant achievements, including leading organizational change at MRM McCann, recognized several times by Fast Company as the Best Workplace for Innovators. Dom has been honored with numerous international awards for creativity, design, and innovation, notably Cannes Lions in Innovation, Best World Changing Idea, and D&AD Impact Pencil.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Delivering Real Value with AI: Where to Start

eventSpeakers.description:
J.J. is the Senior Director of Digital Product Creation for Tapestry Inc. supporting our global house of brands including Coach, Kate Spade & Stuart Weitzman. She leads a team of creatives that design compelling 3D & 2D Digital Twins and 3D Print Prototypes that enable a sustainable, global, co-create process. They intersect digital with physical working across all brands, product categories & use cases. As Digital Influencers, the DPC team advocates the use of digital technologies across Tapestry, partnering internally and externally to deliver new ways of working that power our brands to move at future-speed.

J.J. works at Tapestry's New York City Headquarters and resides in NJ. When she's not discussing all things digital, J.J. is making tacos and watching "Bad Batch" with her sons Jack & Mason, pug Mimi and cat Princess Leia.

cards.title: Turning Likes into Leads: Navigating Social Media as a Designer

tags.title: Branding
tags.description: Stand out in a competitive landscape and leave a lasting impression by creating a powerhouse brand strategy. From crafting a brand vision to implementing it across all marketing and social channels, you’ll gain the tools to elevate your brand to new heights.

cards.description:
In the space of one year, logo designer James Barnard went from almost losing his freelance business to a six-figure operation, all thanks to embracing social media and working harder on his personal brand. Today, James has amassed more than a million followers across his social platforms. He uses this audience to generate interest in his logo design business, turning those viral views into paying customers.

In this session, James will share:

  • Where he finds inspiration (and the time) for his video content
  • How to navigate platforms like Instagram and TikTok
  • How to turn views into leads
  • Tips for striking a balance for your overall happiness and sanity

eventSpeakers.description:
James is an award-winning logo and visual identity designer, educator, international speaker and owner of logo design studio Barnard Co.

As a former designer for the magazine and newspaper industry in the UK, James has more than 15 years of experience. These days he runs his operation from the Gold Coast, Australia.

James splits his time between client work and design education. His content, which he shares with his 1M+ followers, focuses on how to be a better designer, navigating your software, plus the common pitfalls of the logo design industry.

cards.title: Work Happy, Not Harder with AI-Driven Workflows in Photoshop
cards.description:
Mark Heaps' popular "Work Happy, Not Harder" session returns, this time focusing on the impact of AI tools on your workflows. In this session, professional creative and design technologist Mark Heaps will explore how to harness the power of AI to reduce stress, save time, and amplify creative decision-making. Learn how to revisit familiar end-to-end workflows in Photoshop, leveraging new AI-powered features to achieve great results.

In this session, you will:

  • Discover how to integrate AI tools into your workflow to streamline tasks
  • Learn to utilize classic features like actions and batch processing with AI support
  • Understand the importance of human-in-the-loop decision-making, and how to use AI to augment your creative process
  • Explore how to offload common tasks to AI tools, allowing you to focus on high-level creative decisions and push your work to the next level
cards.sessionTitle: Work Happy, Not Harder with AI-Driven Workflows in Photoshop

eventSpeakers.description: Mark Heaps, Professional Creative, seeded his path by skateboarding and playing in bands. Today he is Head of Brand & Creative at Groq Inc. Mark is known for promoting "production advocacy" and "working happy not harder." He has honed his chops working on projects for companies like Apple, Google, Facebook, E&J Gallo, Capital One, and that family friend demanding a free logo. He’s an author and noted speaker at various industry events. He resides in Austin, Texas, with his wife, two rad kids, a Goldendoodle, and another dog that lied about not being part chihuahua.

cards.description:
Watch raw sketches transform into scroll-stopping sensations. FOREAL co-founders Benjamin Simon and Dirk Schuster have mastered the art of creating CGI that makes people stop, smile, and share. Their bold, graphic animations have captivated audiences for major brands like Microsoft and Spotify — proving that playful doesn't mean unprofessional. In this behind-the-scenes journey, they'll reveal their process for transforming rough ideas into viral gold that clients love and audiences can't ignore.

You'll discover:

  • From doodle to digital magic — how simple sketches become bold, attention-grabbing CGI
  • From our playbook — how to use humor and delight to drive shares and saves
  • Client-winning creativity — how to balance playful innovation with professional results across diverse projects

You’ll get an honest look at what’s worked, what hasn’t, and ideas to help your work stand out.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Chief Marketing Officer & EVP, Global Marketing

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day Two Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Executive Vice President, Global Marketing. She is responsible for Adobe's global marketing and communications, delivering profitable business growth and building Adobe's renowned brand in an era of AI.

Prior to joining Adobe, she served as Chief Marketing Officer and General Manager, Strategic Partner Group of Intuit, Inc., the leading AI-driven global financial technology platform. She was responsible for marketing and communications across Intuit's brands and building the company's reputation. Lara also served as general manager of Intuit's ProTax group.

Lara has a proven track record of building world-class businesses and brands at companies such as Amazon, Visa and Nike where she held marketing leadership positions before joining Intuit. At Amazon, she led Worldwide Prime and Amazon North America Consumer Marketing, driving growth of the Prime membership program globally as well as the North America consumer business. Before Amazon, she held a variety of executive roles at Visa including Senior Vice President, Visa North America Marketing where she was responsible for all aspects of marketing for Visa's largest revenue-driving region. At Visa, she helped lead the company into the era of digital payments, launching ecommerce and mobile-first payments including Visa Checkout and Apple Pay.

She has been recognized on Forbes' World's Most Influential CMOs list as well as Forbes' Entrepreneurial CMO 50 and received AdWeek's CMO Vanguard Award.

Lara holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Pre-Law from the University of Washington and a Master of Business Administration from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Brandon Baum: Reimagining Storytelling with Firefly and Community Creativity
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day Two Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
BrandonB is a content creator known for his creative flair and engaging videos. Based in the UK, he specialises in VFX content that blends fantasy visuals, humour, and educational content, drawing in a diverse audience. With a combined following exceeding 22 million followers, his videos have garnered over 15 billion views across various social media platforms.

Frequently collaborating with prominent figures like Tom Holland, Tyson Fury, and Jake Gyllenhaal, Brandon has also attracted partnerships with leading brands, including Disney, Netflix, and Google.

Brandon also leads StudioB, an award-winning digital production company catering to global brands. Known for their deep understanding of social media and unique approach to content creation, StudioB excels at crafting content that resonates with audiences, helping brands achieve millions of impressions

eventSpeakers.companyName: American Inventor, Engineer, Educator, and YouTuber

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Mark Rober on Science, Storytelling, and Viral Impact
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day Two Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Mark Rober has amassed over 8 billion views by creating incredible science-focused builds and pranks on his YouTube channel, with 70 million subscribers and counting. In the summer of 2022, Rober announced his secret project, called CrunchLabs, a massive Willy Wonka-style factory of creativity in the San Francisco Bay Area, where the team creates each original, buildable engineering toys and the super fun (and science-packed) videos from scratch with an express focus on getting as many brains as possible excited about science and engineering.

Since its founding, CrunchLabs has offered a monthly subscription for kids that delivers original STEM toys and exclusive videos that entertain and teach STEM principles. Kids can’t get enough - the first run of Build Box sold out in under a week. Build Box's success paved the way for Hack Pack, the second product from CrunchLabs that demystifies coding and robotics for teens and adults with robot-in-a-box builds. Today, there are hundreds of thousands of subscribers and millions of boxes shipped. Plus, there are a few lucky subscribers each month who win an expenses-paid trip to hang out with Mark at his secret lab and more.

Rober is also known for his YouTube videos, including glitter bombing porch pirates and phone scammers, making mazes for squirrels in his backyard, the world's largest and smallest Nerf gun, and more. In 2020, he hosted a Livestream with Jimmy Kimmel called Color the Spectrum, which raised over $3M to support Autistic Adults in their communities. In 2019 Rober co-founded #TeamTrees alongside fellow YouTube creator MrBeast, which raised $20 million to plant 20 million trees. In late 2021, they followed up with #TeamSeas, which raised $30 million to clean up 30 million pounds of trash and plastic from rivers, beaches, and oceans

eventSpeakers.companyName: Award-winning Filmmaker and Co-Chair and CEO of DC Studios

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Jason Levine & James Gunn: Creativity, Ambition, and Authentic Storytelling
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day Two Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
James Gunn is the acclaimed filmmaker behind some of today’s most influential pop culture content and currently serves as Co-Chairman and CEO of DC Studios, alongside Peter Safran.

Gunn most recently wrote and directed the feature film “Superman”, released on July 11, 2025. One of the most highly anticipated films of the summer, Superman has earned over $614 million globally and received critical acclaim for its heartfelt story centered on humanity and kindness in a modern world that often overlooks those values.

Next, Gunn will debut the second season of the Emmy-nominated HBO Max series “Peacemaker” on August 21, 2025, for which he wrote and directed several episodes. His recent credits also include the animated HBO Max hit “Creature Commandos”, which premiered on December 5, 2024.

In 2021, Gunn brought his signature style to the Warner Bros. film “The Suicide Squad”, which he wrote and directed. The movie featured returning DC characters played by Margot Robbie, Viola Davis, Jai Courtney, and Joel Kinnaman, and introduced a new ensemble including Idris Elba, John Cena, Peter Capaldi, and others.

From that film, Gunn developed the HBO Max series “Peacemaker”, centered around Cena’s character. Premiering on January 13, 2022, the series was met with rave reviews and earned an Emmy nomination. Gunn’s work on the soundtrack—especially the viral dance sequence in the opening credits—received widespread praise.

In the Marvel Cinematic Universe, Gunn is best known for creating and directing the entire “Guardians of the Galaxy” trilogy. The franchise has earned over $2.4 billion worldwide. The original film was the second highest-grossing movie of 2014 and made Marvel history by spending five weekends at No. 1. The final installment, “Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3,” opened to $289.3 million and surpassed $835 million globally prior to its digital release. The trilogy won the Critics’ Choice Award for Best Action Movie and earned nominations from the Oscars, Grammys, BAFTAs, MTV Movie Awards, and People’s Choice Awards. Gunn received a WGA nomination for Best Adapted Screenplay in 2014.

Music plays a central role in Gunn’s storytelling. He personally curated the soundtracks for the Guardians films, with “Awesome Mix Vol. 1” becoming the first soundtrack made entirely of previously released songs to hit No. 1 on the Billboard charts. It was later certified Platinum. Vol. 2 ended 2017 as the eighth highest-selling album in the U.S., with 600,000 copies sold, and earned Gold certification.

Gunn’s earlier work includes the cult classics “Slither” and “Super”, as well as his breakthrough at Troma Entertainment, where he wrote the screenplay for “Tromeo & Juliet” (1997), which became a cult hit with extended midnight runs in Los Angeles.

Born and raised in St. Louis, Missouri, Gunn began making films at age twelve with his brother Sean Gunn, using an 8mm camera. While attending Columbia University, he landed a part-time job at Troma, which jumpstarted his screenwriting career.

From indie horror to blockbuster franchises, James Gunn has become one of the most distinctive and influential voices in modern filmmaking.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Jason Levine & James Gunn: Creativity, Ambition, and Authentic Storytelling
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day Two Keynote

eventSpeakers.description: Jason Levine has traveled the globe inspiring and educating users on Adobe Creative Cloud with a focus on video, audio and mobile workflows. Levine has conducted training sessions for top broadcast corporations around the world including BBC, RTL and SVT. Prior to Adobe, Jason worked in the music industry, engineering hundreds of recordings which prompted the formation of BoodahJooMusic Publishing. Combining years of public performance and songwriting, he began laying down the foundation for a children’s music project entitled Just Play Music™. Over the past 25 years, Jason has presented to more than one million people around the world. He’s a multi-year “Adobe MAX Master” recipient and has become a staple on the AdobeMAX keynote stage. Beginning in 2023, Jason began a role ‘behind the stage’ as producer of the MAX Keynote.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Celebrating Creators and Community at Adobe MAX
Stacy Martinet on Digital Access and Creativity Awards
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day Two Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Stacy Martinet has spent her career at the intersection of marketing, media, and technology.

As Adobe’s Vice President of Marketing Strategy and Communications, she leads a global team responsible for internal and external communications, including corporate communications, public affairs, product and customer communications, events, corporate social responsibility, industry analyst relations, as well as worldwide social media and influencer marketing. She first joined Adobe as Sr. Director of Marketing Strategy and Chief of Staff to the Company’s EVP and Chief Marketing Officer.

Before joining Adobe, Stacy was Chief Marketing Officer of Mashable. She was part of the company’s executive team — taking Mashable from a tech blog to a global consumer internet site. As CMO, she guided the company through explosive growth in users and advertisers, three rounds of funding, and a restructuring while architecting the company's marketing and communications strategy and building an integrated marketing organization across brand and demand generation channels.

Prior to Mashable, she spent nearly a decade in corporate communications and digital marketing at The New York Times during the company’s transition to digital which included a transformation of its journalism approach and the introduction of a digital subscription model. She was part of the team that pioneered the company’s first social media strategy and was recognized with the Chairman’s Award for innovation.

She was named by Folio’s Top Women in Media as a Corporate Visionary, as well as named to PR Week’s 40 Under 40 list. Stacy continues to speak and write about digital trends; her work has appeared in Mashable, The New York Times, Ad Week, and Cosmopolitan Magazine.

Stacy holds a patent for viral media content and is a member of several boards, including the Adobe Foundation board, the Ad Council board, and her past service to the New York Women in Communications board. Stacy is a graduate of Towson University.
