eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Chief Marketing Officer & EVP, Global Marketing

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day Two Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Executive Vice President, Global Marketing. She is responsible for Adobe's global marketing and communications, delivering profitable business growth and building Adobe's renowned brand in an era of AI.

Prior to joining Adobe, she served as Chief Marketing Officer and General Manager, Strategic Partner Group of Intuit, Inc., the leading AI-driven global financial technology platform. She was responsible for marketing and communications across Intuit's brands and building the company's reputation. Lara also served as general manager of Intuit's ProTax group.

Lara has a proven track record of building world-class businesses and brands at companies such as Amazon, Visa and Nike where she held marketing leadership positions before joining Intuit. At Amazon, she led Worldwide Prime and Amazon North America Consumer Marketing, driving growth of the Prime membership program globally as well as the North America consumer business. Before Amazon, she held a variety of executive roles at Visa including Senior Vice President, Visa North America Marketing where she was responsible for all aspects of marketing for Visa's largest revenue-driving region. At Visa, she helped lead the company into the era of digital payments, launching ecommerce and mobile-first payments including Visa Checkout and Apple Pay.

She has been recognized on Forbes' World's Most Influential CMOs list as well as Forbes' Entrepreneurial CMO 50 and received AdWeek's CMO Vanguard Award.

Lara holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Pre-Law from the University of Washington and a Master of Business Administration from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Brandon Baum: Reimagining Storytelling with Firefly and Community Creativity
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day Two Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
BrandonB is a content creator known for his creative flair and engaging videos. Based in the UK, he specialises in VFX content that blends fantasy visuals, humour, and educational content, drawing in a diverse audience. With a combined following exceeding 22 million followers, his videos have garnered over 15 billion views across various social media platforms.

Frequently collaborating with prominent figures like Tom Holland, Tyson Fury, and Jake Gyllenhaal, Brandon has also attracted partnerships with leading brands, including Disney, Netflix, and Google.

Brandon also leads StudioB, an award-winning digital production company catering to global brands. Known for their deep understanding of social media and unique approach to content creation, StudioB excels at crafting content that resonates with audiences, helping brands achieve millions of impressions

eventSpeakers.companyName: American Inventor, Engineer, Educator, and YouTuber

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Mark Rober on Science, Storytelling, and Viral Impact
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day Two Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Mark Rober has amassed over 8 billion views by creating incredible science-focused builds and pranks on his YouTube channel, with 70 million subscribers and counting. In the summer of 2022, Rober announced his secret project, called CrunchLabs, a massive Willy Wonka-style factory of creativity in the San Francisco Bay Area, where the team creates each original, buildable engineering toys and the super fun (and science-packed) videos from scratch with an express focus on getting as many brains as possible excited about science and engineering.

Since its founding, CrunchLabs has offered a monthly subscription for kids that delivers original STEM toys and exclusive videos that entertain and teach STEM principles. Kids can’t get enough - the first run of Build Box sold out in under a week. Build Box's success paved the way for Hack Pack, the second product from CrunchLabs that demystifies coding and robotics for teens and adults with robot-in-a-box builds. Today, there are hundreds of thousands of subscribers and millions of boxes shipped. Plus, there are a few lucky subscribers each month who win an expenses-paid trip to hang out with Mark at his secret lab and more.

Rober is also known for his YouTube videos, including glitter bombing porch pirates and phone scammers, making mazes for squirrels in his backyard, the world's largest and smallest Nerf gun, and more. In 2020, he hosted a Livestream with Jimmy Kimmel called Color the Spectrum, which raised over $3M to support Autistic Adults in their communities. In 2019 Rober co-founded #TeamTrees alongside fellow YouTube creator MrBeast, which raised $20 million to plant 20 million trees. In late 2021, they followed up with #TeamSeas, which raised $30 million to clean up 30 million pounds of trash and plastic from rivers, beaches, and oceans

cards.title: New Rules of Creation: Experiment, Evolve, Wow

tags.title: Creativity and Marketing in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. They’ll cover everything from brand reinvention and strategy to supercharging creative workflows to new tools for scaling campaign assets.

tags.title: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day 2

cards.description:
In today’s generative AI era, the creative process is no longer linear. Content leaders fearlessly experiment to push new creative boundaries and unlock scale that works. Join Bosch Marketing & Design AI Accelerator Sebastian “BAS” Schwartze, for a behind-the-scenes look at how his team has reimagined their content production.

BAS shares how bold experimentation, ongoing evaluation, and continuous learning have helped evolve workflows, uncover new paths to creation that truly work for the brand, and keep human creativity at the center of it all.

Key Takeaways:

  • How to evolve your production model and creation culture for high quality generative AI outcomes
  • Real-world experiments and unexpected success stories that delivered wow-worthy results
  • Practical strategies to scale digital production through creative experimentation with Firefly image, video, and custom models

eventSpeakers.description:
seBAStian Schwartze's career is a continuous exploration of the intersection between engineering, design and human experience. His journey spans from concept development and leading design teams to navigating the transformation of marketing and design in the age of AI.

At 14, BAS began exploring 3D visualization and VR, laying the foundation for his future. This early passion for digital technologies continues to drive him.

As Head of Exterior Design Engineering at Audi, he bridged the gap between design and engineering, ensuring both aesthetic vision and technical feasibility. This role solidified his belief in collaborative processes. He encouraged his team to explore future-oriented concepts like autonomous driving, resulting in show cars like the Audi Urban Concept and Long Distance Lounge, which focused on the evolving customer journey.

BAS also spearheaded the Audi Denkwerkstatt in Berlin, connecting the company with the startup community to foster new technologies and business models. Its recognition as "Best Innovation Lab Germany" highlights his ability to create environments that nurture innovation.

Transitioning to BSH Home Appliances, he led a design team without a formal design background, leveraging his generalist approach. He championed a consumer-centric design philosophy, focusing on user needs to enhance everyday life. This resulted in award-winning designs, including the Balay wine cooler and Constructa dishwasher, showcasing his skill in balancing aesthetics, functionality, and user experience.

His current move from design into marketing presents new challenges, particularly with AI implementation. With a willingness to experiment, creativity and a strong belief in teamwork, he is playing a key role in BSH's global transition to an AI-enabled corporation in marketing and design. His outward-looking perspective and connections with other industries and AI leaders are essential to this transformation.

eventSpeakers.description:
Claudio Zavala Jr. is a creative powerhouse, digital storytelling advocate, seasoned educator, and Adobe Education Evangelist. With over 25 years in K–12 education as a teacher, mentor, and edtech trainer, Claudio’s mission is simple: to empower educators and students to share their stories with impact and purpose—using the power of creativity and digital tools.

Claudio is passionate about inspiring others to bring ideas to life through photography, videography, and content creation. On his YouTube channel, he shares hands-on Adobe Express tutorials, digital storytelling tips, and behind-the-scenes of his creative journey.

He’s also a dynamic keynote speaker who has inspired audiences at ISTE, SXSW EDU, FETC, CUE, TCEA, and more—energizing educators with a message of creativity, innovation, and purpose-driven learning.

Claudio regularly leads Adobe Express for Education sessions on Adobe Live, where he showcases classroom-ready tips, creative lesson ideas, and practical ways to amplify student voice through media. Whether it's leading workshops or speaking at major conferences, Claudio is committed to helping educators infuse creativity into their practice.

He partners with school districts nationwide to lead professional development, inspire innovation, and build a culture of visual storytelling across classrooms. Claudio holds a Master’s in Instructional Design with a focus on Educational Technology and a Bachelor’s in Spanish—both from San Diego State University.

Based in the Dallas–Fort Worth area, Claudio’s creativity lives at the intersection of education, design, and storytelling. Connect with him online at claudiozavalajr.com or on social media @ClaudioZavalaJr—he’s always up for a good creative convo.

cards.title: Artistic Expression: Elevating Photographic Art Through Photoshop

tags.title: Graphic Design and Illustration
tags.description: Bring your creative vision to life. Learn how you can leverage new generative AI tools to assist your content development, create in new ways, and gain more control over your workflows and outputs. Get inspired to revisit the way you approach design.

cards.description:
Step into the world of surreal storytelling with fine art photographer Claire Luxton as she shares her layered approach to creating emotive composites in Photoshop. Drawing from her sculptural and artistic background, Claire demonstrates how to use traditional, hands-on techniques to build detailed, immersive, symbolic visuals and explore a more intuitive, personal creative process to develop cohesive, painterly composite images.

In this session, you’ll see how to:

  • Apply complex layers and blend using masks, brushes, and adjustments
  • Compose and composite with the sensibility of a painter using color channels, curves, and refined selections
  • Paint with light and shadow to create atmosphere through texture, tone, and detail
  • Retouch gently using frequency separation to preserve natural beauty and form
cards.sessionTitle: Artistic Expression: Elevating Photographic Art Through Photoshop

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Artistic Expression: Elevating Photographic Art Through Photoshop

eventSpeakers.description: Claire Luxton is a British contemporary multi-disciplinary artist working with photography, poetry and immersive public art installations. She has created large-scale immersive works in iconic locations such as Leicester Square, Regent Street, Marble Arch, Battersea Power Station and Wembley Park. Working with companies and brands such as IHG, Wedgewood, Hendricks and The CrownEstate. At the centre of her practice lies her vulnerability as she explores the female experience within society through her body and truth. Luxton’s work examines visual bias, including prejudices built around the opposition of beauty, intellect and mental health. Her work delves into various historical narratives that still hold much weight today. Her projects start with extensive research periods where she looks at literary, artistic, musical and factual references. Luxton creates muses and narratives through her portraits and poetry, assuming diﬀerent characters, she deftly engages with multifaceted notions of female identity, earning her recognition as a contemporary artist, who much like Cindy Sherman, skilfully navigates diverse and important perspectives. Inspired by Italian and Northern Renaissance portraits of women, all the components of her images play with classical symbolism. A way to interpret her portraits is through her carefully crafted titles and accompanying poems.

cards.description:
When using InDesign, we often rely on basic geometric image frames such as squares, circles, and rectangles to add visual interest. But what if your designs could break free from those boundaries? Imagine using parametric patterns, expressive word art, paper cutouts, or organic shapes that break through the frame and flow onto the page. In this session, Sam Luo from LYH Studio shows you how to elevate your editorial layouts — like books, magazines, newspapers, and lookbooks — by pairing the creative flexibility of Illustrator with the layout power of InDesign. Ditch the cookie-cutter look and start designing layouts that truly stand out.

You’ll learn:

  • A proven workflow to design complex vector graphics in Illustrator and bring them seamlessly into InDesign
  • Best practices for linking, scaling, and managing Illustrator assets inside InDesign
  • When and how to use this workflow to enhance visual storytelling

cards.description:
Behind every mural, installation, and world DABSMYLA create is a shared vision built on trust, collaboration, and play. In this session, the artist duo opens up about the creative chemistry that’s fueled their partnership, both in art and in life. They’ll share how they navigate creative differences, merge distinct styles into one cohesive voice, and keep their work feeling joyful and alive after years of collaboration. Whether you’re working with a creative partner, a team, or a client, you’ll walk away inspired by how two artists have built not just a career, but a colorful world, together.

You’ll learn:

  • How to balance individuality and shared vision
  • Practices for creative communication and trust
  • Ways to sustain long-term collaboration and inspiration
  • Insights on building a brand rooted in authentic partnership

eventSpeakers.description: Emmelene and Darren Mate, known collectively as DABSMYLA, are Australian-born, Los Angeles based artists whose collaborative practice merges fine art, large-scale murals, and immersive installations. Drawing inspiration from mid-century design, animation, and the natural world, their work radiates color, optimism, and intricate craftsmanship. Working as one unified voice, they create joyful, highly detailed worlds that celebrate connection and imagination. Since relocating to LA in 2009, DABSMYLA have exhibited internationally and collaborated with leading brands and institutions, always infusing their signature blend of playfulness, precision, and energy into every project.

cards.title: Why We Feel Fonts: Designing with Type
cards.description:
Comic Sans. Arial. Futura. Did you feel something just now reading those? Fonts aren’t just design tools — they’re emotional triggers, cultural touchstones, and sometimes the villains of our visual lives. Graphic designer and content creator Ram Reyes, aka Oversettext, takes you on a lighthearted and eye-opening journey on all the things that affect why we love, and maybe hate, certain fonts beyond simple aesthetics. You’ll never look at type the same.

In this session, Ram will:

  • Decode why certain fonts spark instant love — or lifelong hatred — in designers and non-designers alike
  • Explore the hidden history, culture, and bias baked into the typefaces we use every day
  • Share his insights on how to choose fonts, maybe breaking some typographic rules along the way
cards.sessionTitle: Why We Feel Fonts: Designing with Type

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Why We Feel Fonts: Designing with Type

eventSpeakers.description: Ram Reyes, better known as Oversettext, is a graphic design content creator from Fresno, California. He's best known for his infamous 365 Project where he designed a poster everyday for a year and for pointing out fonts anywhere he goes. He has worked with clients such as Patreon, Spotify, and the band, Kings of Leon. He also loves the font Futura a lot. Maybe too much.

cards.title: Smart(er) Text Styling: Unlocking the Power of GREP in InDesign
cards.description:
GREP is one of InDesign’s most powerful tools — but for many designers, it’s often misunderstood, underused, or downright intimidating. In this session, trainer, writer, and content creator Erica Gamet, aka, The GREP Whisperer, will take the mystery out of GREP and show you how it can automate repetitive formatting and styling tasks. You’ll learn to define text patterns, then explore practical GREP examples that will help you style text more efficiently, consistently, and creatively. Whether you’re cleaning up imported content or applying character styles to your text, GREP can save you hours and elevate your InDesign workflow.

Note: This session is beginner-level GREP for intermediate InDesign users.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Apply character styling automatically as you type or import text
  • Superscript date ordinals like “1st” and “2nd” without manual formatting
  • Replace multiple spaces or line breaks with a single instant of each
  • Reorder text elements, turn quoted text to italic, and fix text runts
  • Format information, such as phone numbers or email addresses

She is a regular presenter at CreativePro Week, and has spoken at Canada’s ebookcraft, Adobe MAX, and Making Design in Oslo, Norway. Find Erica online at the CreativePro YouTube channel, CreativeLive.com, and through her own YouTube channel. You’ll gain a better understanding of:

  • The potential of each of Adobe’s illustration programs to achieve distinct stylistic effects

eventSpeakers.description: Meagan Keane is Director of Product Marketing for Adobe Professional Film & Video. She joined the Adobe Premiere Pro Management team in 2012 and has led business strategy across the Adobe video portfolio since 2019. While Meagan’s leadership has guided Adobe video strategies for over a decade, her beginnings were in documentary film. She was a producer across numerous documentary features including High School 911 (2016), Defining Beauty (2011), We Live in Public (Sundance Grand Jury Winner, 2009) and Join Us (2007). Meagan is a thought leader in the film and video industry, recently speaking on behalf of Adobe with Variety at the 2025 Sundance Film Festival and has been recently quoted in Forbes and Variety regarding the growing impact of AI in Hollywood. She loves remaining connected to the film industry, while influencing future innovation in her field. Meagan has an MFA in film production from USC’s School of Cinematic Arts and sits on the Board of Governors for the Advanced Imaging Society.

eventSpeakers.description:
Guillermo Flores Pacheco is a Mexican designer and illustrator specialized in advertising illustration, retouching, post production and digital collage. He has collaborated with companies around the world serving as a creative and art director in multiple projects, developing illustration, brand identity, strategy, planning and execution.

He has created unique images for advertising campaigns and collaborated in the publishing world, developing illustrations for magazine covers, editorial articles, and books. His work has been commissioned by brands such as Adobe, Apple, Burning Man, Cirque du Soleil, Citi Private Bank, JW Marriott, Marc Jacobs, Nike, Patron Tequila, Sephora, Televisa Univision, Universal Music, Wired Magazine, and Xfinity, among others. His work has been exhibited in London, Japan, Australia, US, Argentina, Colombia, and Mexico. He has also been recognized and published in awards and publications such as SPD, 3x3 Magazine, CQ Journal, CASE Circle of Excellence Awards, LAD Awards, Muse Creative Awards, American Illustration, and Lürzer’s Archive, among others. He was commissioned by Adobe to create the artwork illustration for the Photoshop 2025 splash screen.

eventSpeakers.description:
Dacia Sáenz is a multidisciplinary creative and storyteller whose career began in Austin, TX, where she worked in film and television with CNBC, PBS, and the Sundance Foundation. A skilled writer as well as a producer, she was published (under a pen name) in The Kicked Out Anthology, named one of the top books of 2011 by the LGBTQ Roundtable of the American Library Association.

In Seattle, she earned a Master’s in Digital Media from the University of Washington, premiered two short films at the Seattle International Film Festival (2012 & 2013), and won the Audience Choice Award at the Next Fifty Film Festival. Her storytelling practice expanded globally through multimedia projects in Thailand and El Salvador with the Seattle Globalist and the UW Center for Human Rights.

Now based in Texas, Dacia continues to create work rooted in community. She recently directed and edited an award-winning short documentary on the Uvalde Love Project, a NEA-supported initiative using art therapy and murals to catalyze healing after tragedy.

Dacia currently works at Adobe, where she brings her passion for user experience, motion design, and creative video tools into product development. Outside of work, she explores experimental animation and synthesizers with playful obsession.

eventSpeakers.description:
Trying to marry his passion for cars and cameras, AJ began shooting automotive videos with his high school friends. His work caught the attention of local car dealerships, and at age 22 he left his job at Apple to pursue filmmaking full-time. He founded Advent Films, and quickly became a trusted shooter for many of the world’s most prestigious brands including Ferrari, McLaren F1, Aston Martin, Red Bull, Riot Games, Amazon, and more.

Despite rejection from every film school he applied to, AJ was accepted into the DGA as one of the Guild’s youngest directors at age 27. Known for dynamic angles and an unforgiving attention to detail, AJ specializes in action-packed commercials featuring vehicle stunts, pyrotechnics, skydiving, and low-flying helicopters. Pretty much anything that freaks his parents out.

When he’s not working on movies or driving cars, AJ has also established himself as a veteran industry keynote speaker at TEDx, NAB, and AdobeMAX.

tags.title: 3D

cards.description:
Join Michael Tanzillo, head of 3D technical artists at Adobe, for a look at how teams are transforming creative pipelines by blending 3D craft with AI scale. Digital twins are no longer futuristic concepts — they’re central to how many companies protect IP while scaling brand storytelling across global markets. 3D gives you control. Adobe Firefly gives you reach.

Learn how to:

  • Build digital twins that preserve design intent across marketing and manufacturing
  • Create mass variation for faster go-to-market timelines
  • Integrate your digital twins into Photoshop, After Effects, Adobe Experience Manager, and the other Adobe tools you know and love
  • Modernize pipelines without disrupting creative vision
  • Combine precision design with generative flexibility across industries

eventSpeakers.description:
Michael Tanzillo is currently the Head of 3D Technical Artists at Adobe. His team helps companies modernize their product pipelines with scalable, sustainable 3D workflows powered by the Substance 3D tools and other Adobe offerings.

Prior to joining Adobe, Michael worked for over a decade as a Senior Artist on animated films at Blue Sky Studios/Disney with credits including three Ice Age movies, two Rios, Peanuts, Ferdinand, Spies in Disguise, and Nimona.

In addition to his work as an artist, Michael is the Co-Author of the book Lighting for Animation: The Visual Art of Storytelling and creator of The 3D Artist Newsletter and The 3D Artist Online Community, an online space that helps artists transition from roles in entertainment to 3D opportunities in fashion, product visualization, and beyond.

cards.description:
Join Sho Dewan as he shares the real truth (learnings and big failures) from being a corporate professional to a full-time creator and CEO. Drawing from his own experience growing a global community, Sho breaks down how he quit his 9-5 after attending a Tony Robbins conference and turned his corporate experience into the foundation for a profitable brand. This session is designed for professionals ready to take actionable steps toward building a brand and business on their own terms.

You’ll Learn:

  • How to find your X-factor from your 9–5 and use it as content and credibility fuel
  • Strategies to grow your audience and biz from 0 to 250K to 1M+ and the challenges that come with it

I’m writing my debut book (dropping 2026!) and trying to level up our content game with new formats and creatives. But the mission stays the same… we want to see you work (and live) happier! :)

cards.title: Next-Level Editing in Lightroom

tags.title: Photography
tags.description: Spark your passion for photography with sessions that will help you build your photography skills and more easily achieve photo editing results you’re proud of using AI-powered tools and workflows, whether you’re taking photos with a smartphone or a mirrorless camera.

cards.description:
You know your way around Lightroom, but now it’s time to really dial things in. In this session, fine art landscape photographer Liam Man will show you how to take your edits further — shaping tone, color, and contrast in ways that make your photos pop while still feeling true to your vision. You’ll dig into Lightroom’s newest AI-powered features too, like masking for precise, targeted edits, denoise for clean and crisp detail, and the latest removal tools for fixing distractions fast. Think of this as the next step in your editing journey — less about the basics, more about refining your style, speeding up your workflow, and getting the kind of results that feel polished and intentional. If you’re ready to move past simple sliders and really unlock what Lightroom can do, this workshop is for you.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Adjust tone and color to create balanced, impactful images
  • Use AI masking for quick, targeted adjustments
  • Remove distractions seamlessly with the new remove tools
  • Apply AI-powered noise reduction to enhance image quality
cards.sessionTitle: Next-Level Editing in Lightroom

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Fine Art Landscape Photographer & Light Painter
eventSpeakers.description:
Liam Man is a British photographic artist whose work combines technology, art, and reality. His signature work with drone-mounted lighting transforms landscapes into otherworldly visions that border reality.

Self-taught, Liam has earned recognition as Sony and Epson Ambassadors and his images have won many prestigious awards including the Sony World Photography Award (Open Photographer of the Year), Muse, Fine Art and International photography awards. Exhibited worldwide, his work has been featured in the National Geographic, BBC, New York Times, CNN and Forbes.

Liam approaches landscapes with a perspective that goes beyond traditional photography, capturing more than just objective truths. He views the natural world as alive, with personality, character, and story. By using artificial light to illuminate his subjects, he breaks free from the limitations of ambient lighting conditions, allowing him to craft bold, atmospheric portraits of the planet that feel both intimate and monumental.

Fueled by an expeditionary spirit, Liam is no stranger to extreme environments. From braving negative 35 degrees Celsius nights in the arctic circle to perching atop 150m high sea-cliffs in Iceland, Liam often endures harsh conditions and remote terrains in pursuit of a single frame. His images are more than documentation, they are love letters to the Earth, crafted with relentless care and conviction.

In a social landscape that moves at lightning speed, how can brands stay relevant without losing their authenticity? Join a fireside chat with Katrina Torrijos, Adobe Express evangelist and digital creator, and Jared Carneson, head of social media at Adobe, as they explore how to tap into trends and cultural conversations with purpose and impact.

cards.description: Join Deloitte Digital for a behind the scenes look at how an early experiment with Adobe Firefly led to a global rebrand and a powerful new tool that is democratizing creativity and brand consistency for marketing, sales, and experience leaders across Deloitte. In this 45-minute session, Deloitte Digital's Head of Design Tracey Smith, joins Strategic Marketing Leader Trisha Pancio and Designer Megan Lee to share the lessons learned and innovations unlocked when Deloitte Digital became one of the first enterprise organizations to implement the Adobe Firefly API at scale with our Orb Foundry. From Cannes Lions to the FastCo Innovation by Design awards, we invite you on a journey that travels deep into creative tensions of the current moment: how do you accelerate creative outputs to meet increasing customer demands while maintaining quality, individuality, and consistency? And is it possible to evolve a global visual identity from a static suite of mandated design assets into an ever-evolving living system co-created with the customers and employees who are the heart and soul of your brand?

tags.title: Graphic Design and Illustration
tags.description: Bring your creative vision to life. Learn how you can leverage new generative AI tools to assist your content development, create in new ways, and gain more control over your workflows and outputs. Get inspired to revisit the way you approach design.

cards.description:
Get an in-depth look at how to flex your creative muscles and make amazing content on your iPhone or Android phone. Walk through creating a playlist cover, lookbook, and more with Ryan Dumlao from the Photoshop Mobile product management team, and get a crash course on powerful, core Photoshop tools that we've brought to your mobile devices. We've reimagined Photoshop to work perfectly on your phone so anyone can pick it up.

In this session, you'll:

  • Walk through creating a playlist cover, lookbook, and more using images from your phone, Lightroom, and the free collection from Adobe Stock
  • Learn to use AI-powered selections to precisely edit, refine, and harmonize your images with adjustments and new Firefly tools
  • Have fun reimagining any photo on your camera roll with all-powerful editing features only available in Photoshop
cards.sessionTitle: Photoshop in Your Pocket: Creating on iPhone and Android

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Photoshop in Your Pocket: Creating on iPhone and Android

eventSpeakers.description:
Ryan Dumlao is a Group Product Manager leading the Photoshop Mobile product team at Adobe. For more than 6 years he has been committed to bringing Photoshop to the next generation of creators, including Photoshop on the iPhone, iPad, Android, and the engine powering Photoshop on the Web. Ryan has an extensive background with Photoshop and Adobe products spanning three decades, having dabbled in everything from web design and computer game graphics to compositing and photography. While he is an avid Fujifilm fan, his current passion is being able to transform anything on his phone’s camera roll with the power and creativity that Photoshop brings to mobile.

Born and proudly raised in the Bay Area, his early claim to fame as a kid was building and running the 2nd-largest Pokémon website on the internet during the original dot-com boom. Prior to Adobe, Ryan lived a previous life as a optical and hardware engineer, and somewhere orbiting the Earth in space there’s an imaging satellite with his signature inside it. He currently resides in Los Angeles with his wife, kids and holland lop bunny.

tags.title: Education
tags.description: Get essential creative and generative AI skills that open doors to a brighter future. Whether you’re overseeing a creative curriculum or want to use creativity to enhance your teaching, you’ll learn from leading educators and experts who cultivate these skills.

cards.description:
In this energizing and heartfelt talk, designer and creative coach Meg Lewis offers graduating design students a refreshing roadmap for transitioning from college to career — by staying true to who they are. Known for their colorful aesthetic and empowering approach to personal branding, Meg shares how embracing your quirks, values, and unique voice can set you apart in the creative industry. Rather than blending in or chasing trends, Meg encourages students to lean into their individuality and build a career that aligns with their personality and purpose. Expect personal stories, practical tips, and a dash of humor.

Takeaways include:

  • Learning how to define your personal brand and communicate it confidently
  • Understanding how to find work that truly fits you — not just your résumé
  • Discovering how to build a fulfilling design career by showing up as your whole self — boldly, authentically, and joyfully

tags.description: While AI is reshaping the creative landscape, human imagination has never been more essential or more powerful. Discover how generative AI features in your favorite Adobe tools will help you speed workflows, expand your skillset, and gain greater creative control.

cards.description:
If you’re stuck in a cycle of churning out predictable brand content but dream of pitching bold, boundary-pushing ideas that rival those of global campaigns, then now is the time to join DGA Director AJ Bleyer for an inspiring session that will empower you to tap into your creative potential and transform your brand’s storytelling. Drawing from his journey directing high-impact campaigns for brands like Red Bull, McLaren, and Fast & Furious, AJ shares how to harness generative AI features in Premiere to elevate your concepts.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Use accessible AI tools to create stunning, high-quality visuals that compete with big-budget campaigns, no matter your resources
  • Craft compelling pitches that win over stakeholders and align ambitious creative visions with your brand’s goals
  • Reposition your existing work to showcase your potential and open doors to high-profile projects
cards.sessionTitle: Unleash Your Creativity: Break Free from Repetitive Content with Gen AI

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: First Takes: Faster, Streamlined Video Creation in Premiere with AJ Bleyer
Elevating In-House Brand Content with Generative AI
Unleash Your Creativity: Break Free from Repetitive Content with Gen AI

eventSpeakers.description:
Trying to marry his passion for cars and cameras, AJ began shooting automotive videos with his high school friends. His work caught the attention of local car dealerships, and at age 22 he left his job at Apple to pursue filmmaking full-time. He founded Advent Films, and quickly became a trusted shooter for many of the world’s most prestigious brands including Ferrari, McLaren F1, Aston Martin, Red Bull, Riot Games, Amazon, and more.

Despite rejection from every film school he applied to, AJ was accepted into the DGA as one of the Guild’s youngest directors at age 27. Known for dynamic angles and an unforgiving attention to detail, AJ specializes in action-packed commercials featuring vehicle stunts, pyrotechnics, skydiving, and low-flying helicopters. Pretty much anything that freaks his parents out.

When he’s not working on movies or driving cars, AJ has also established himself as a veteran industry keynote speaker at TEDx, NAB, and AdobeMAX.

sessionTrack.description: While AI is reshaping the creative landscape, human imagination has never been more essential or more powerful. Discover how generative AI features in your favorite Adobe tools will help you speed workflows, expand your skillset, and gain greater creative control.

cards.title: Advance Your Editing Skills in Adobe Premiere

tags.title: Video, Audio, and Motion
tags.description: Learn how to edit your first video, transform static graphics into motion, create an animated explainer video, and apply visual effects to a marketing video. Leverage generative AI in your video workflow and collaborate with Frame.io.

cards.description:
Designed for editors who want to elevate their skills and streamline their workflow, this session will help you unlock the potential of Adobe Premiere. Join Emmy Award-winning director and editor Christine Steele who will share expert-level techniques to help you simplify complex editing challenges, enhance speed and agility while editing, and achieve more professional results.

Christine will help you:

  • Optimize your use of Premiere for high-performance editing. Explore professional techniques for multi-camera editing, trimming and sound design
  • Take advantage of in-app motion tracking, compositing features and automated tools that help you quickly produce truly standout content
  • Leverage color automation and secondary color correction for achieving a more cinematic look
  • Explore intermediate editing tips and dynamic workflows for tackling intricate projects with ease and precision
cards.sessionTitle: Advance Your Editing Skills in Adobe Premiere

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Advance Your Editing Skills in Adobe Premiere

eventSpeakers.description:
Christine Steele is an Emmy and Telly award-winning filmmaker, speaker, and educator inspiring creatives to deliver impactful content across film, television, streaming and social media platforms. She has worked across genres on studio feature films and broadcast television series, directed and produced documentaries for PBS, edited in-game film and animation at Electronic Arts, and won a Promax award for her Disney Marketing promos. A collaborative leader, Christine is skilled at driving projects from concept through delivery while mentoring talent and creating stories that explore universal human truths, advance impact initiatives, and align with client values.

As an Adobe Certified Instructor (ACI) and Adobe Community Expert, Christine shares her knowledge by helping individuals and teams implement the creative and technical tools needed to design and craft captivating content. She brings 25 years of experience in media and communications to every collaboration, and has worked for Paramount, Warner, Fox, Disney, Pixar, Showtime, Electronic Arts, ABC, NBC, BBC and PBS. Through Steele Pictures Studios Inc., Christine offers training and support to ignite your creativity and productivity. Reach out at www.steelepictures.com

sessionTrack.title: Video, Audio, and Motion
sessionTrack.description: Learn how to edit your first video, transform static graphics into motion, create an animated explainer video, and apply visual effects to a marketing video. Leverage generative AI in your video workflow and collaborate with Frame.io.

cards.title: Design Powerhouse Super Session: Maximizing Your Creativity

tags.title: Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description:
Push your creative boundaries by combining your favorite design tools in smart and unexpected ways. You’ll discover how to streamline your workflows with the latest creative technologies, boost efficiency, and take your content creation process to the next level. Join Bart Van de Wiele, head of solutions consulting at Adobe; Rob de Winter, instructor, designer, and author; and artist and designer Gemma O'Brien as they share practical and inspiring techniques that will transform the way you design and create. And to spark your imagination, Gemma will showcase highlights from her latest projects.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Combine familiar tools in fresh ways to unlock unexpected results
  • Use Adobe Firefly to generate stunning visuals and video with full creative control
  • Explore multi-app workflows that blend 3D and design seamlessly
  • Integrate tools like Project Neo (beta) into your everyday process
cards.sessionTitle: Design Powerhouse Super Session: Maximizing Your Creativity

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Design Powerhouse Super Session: Maximizing Your Creativity

eventSpeakers.description: Bart is a trainer, worldwide public speaker, LinkedIn Learning author and author of the book “Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign Collaboration & Workflow.” He is based in Belgium and works for Adobe as Sr. Head of Solutions Consulting where his team of product experts help customers reach their business objectives using Adobe’s digital media solutions.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Author, Expert Trainer, and Adobe Community Expert

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Design Powerhouse Super Session: Maximizing Your Creativity

eventSpeakers.description: Rob de Winter is a designer, author, trainer, photographer and musician based in the Netherlands. Rob loves to share his passion for design and Adobe technology in energetic and passionate training sessions. He's a Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator and Animate specialist and has over 15 years of experience. In addition to training graphic designers at companies like Philips, McDonalds, the United Nations, Canon, governments and national broadcasters, he designs corporate identities, infographics, icons and more. Rob has a personal site at robdewinter.com, a YouTube channel and a corporate site for his training company DWM Trainingen at dwmtrainingen.nl.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Gemma O’Brien: Inspiration, Process, and Creative Growth
Design Powerhouse Super Session: Maximizing Your Creativity

eventSpeakers.description: Gemma O’Brien is an internationally renowned designer and artist known for her bold graphics, illustrative lettering and murals. Her work has been commissioned by Apple, Nike, Google, and is held in the permanent collection of the Cooper Hewitt Smithsonian Design Museum in New York City. Outside her commercial design work, she explores language, nature and the human experience through her art practice. In 2025, she is conducting research on flow states in visual artists in London.

sessionTrack.title: Mainstage Broadcast
sessionTrack.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.title: Project Motion Map
cards.description: Bring your illustrations to life. Project Motion Map uses AI to analyze static vector graphics and automatically animate them in ways that feel intentional and expressive—no keyframes or manual rigging required. The result is effortless motion design that still reflects the creator’s intent.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Motion Map

eventSpeakers.description: Mohit Goel is a Senior Computer Scientist II at Adobe, where he helps shape the future of Adobe Illustrator. With deep expertise in performance, reliability, and AI-powered creativity, Mohit works to make Illustrator faster, smarter, and more intuitive for millions of designers worldwide.

cards.title: Project Clean Take
cards.description: Editing dialogue just got smoother. Project Clean Take uses AI to correct mispronunciations, isolate voices, remove noise, and refine delivery—all in seconds. It’s a powerful assistant for podcasters, filmmakers, and anyone seeking studio-quality sound without the studio.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Clean Take

eventSpeakers.description: Lee Brimelow is an award-winning interactive designer and engineer, now in his 16th year at Adobe. He began as a technical evangelist for Adobe Flash, speaking at conferences worldwide including presenting twice at MAX Sneaks. Today, he works on the Adobe Design Prototyping team creating cutting-edge AI-powered experiences in collaboration with Adobe Research. Outside of work, Lee is an avid bass player, fitness enthusiast, and explorer of the Pacific Northwest wilderness.

cards.title: Project Surface Swap
cards.description: Instantly change the look of any surface or material—from a sofa’s fabric to a wooden floor—right from a photo. Project Surface Swap uses AI-powered texture recognition to select and swap materials seamlessly, keeping lighting and perspective intact. It’s perfect for interior designers, photographers and anyone who wants to visualize new possibilities before making real-world changes.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Surface Swap

eventSpeakers.description: Valentin is a Senior Research Scientist at Adobe Research in London, where he develops methods for appearance, image understanding, and editing at the intersection of computer vision and computer graphics, working with the Substance and Photoshop teams. His work is regularly published at top venues such as SIGGRAPH and CVPR. Valentin earned his PhD at Inria, France and has received multiple honors, most recently the 2025 Eurographics Young Researcher Award. He also contributes actively to the graphics community through program committees, mentoring, and leadership roles within Eurographics.

cards.title: Project New Depths
cards.description: Step into the world of 3D photography. Project New Depths brings intuitive editing tools to “radiance fields” (3D photos), allowing artists to tweak color, shape, and composition in three-dimensional space. It makes editing depth as easy as adjusting brightness—ushering in the next generation of visual storytelling.
cards.sessionTitle: Project New Depths

eventSpeakers.description: Élie Michel is a Research Scientist with a focus on Computer Graphics, exploring how techniques from 3D modeling and rendering can be used to create novel interactive authoring workflows that integrate new content types emerging from generative AI and modern imaging systems. He received his Ph.D. in Computer Science from Institut Polytechnique de Paris, advised by Prof. Tamy Boubekeur.

cards.title: Project Light Touch
cards.description: Lighting defines mood, but once a photo is shot, it’s traditionally fixed. Project Mood Light flips that idea. This generative AI tool lets you reshape light sources after capture—turning day to night, adding drama, or adjusting focus and emotion without reshoots. It’s like having total control over the sun and studio lights, all in post.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Light Touch

eventSpeakers.description: Zhixin is a Research Scientist at Adobe Research, where he has worked since 2020. He received his Ph.D. in Computer Science from Stony Brook University in 2019. His research explores the intersection of computer vision, computer graphics, and machine learning, with a particular focus on 3D modeling, reconstruction, relighting, controllable image generation, and image editing.

cards.title: Project Scene It
cards.description: Project Scene It blends precision and artistry by letting creators control both the structure and style of 3D scenes. Built on Image-to-3D and 3D-to-Image technologies, it allows tagging of individual objects with reference images, preserving each object’s unique look while freely moving it in 3D space. It’s a new frontier for designing vivid, lifelike worlds.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Scene It

eventSpeakers.description: Oindrila Saha is a Research Scientist Intern at Adobe and a Ph.D. candidate in Computer Science at the University of Massachusetts Amherst, where she is advised by Prof. Subhransu Maji. She earned her bachelor’s degree from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kharagpur. Her research explores methods for learning from limited and synthetic supervision for multimodal models, with applications to both discriminative and generative modeling. Her work has been published at premier venues in computer vision and machine learning, including CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ICML, and NeurIPS.

eventSpeakers.description: Lee Brimelow is an award-winning interactive designer and engineer, now in his 16th year at Adobe. He began as a technical evangelist for Adobe Flash, speaking at conferences worldwide including presenting twice at MAX Sneaks. Today, he works on the Adobe Design Prototyping team creating cutting-edge AI-powered experiences in collaboration with Adobe Research. Outside of work, Lee is an avid bass player, fitness enthusiast, and explorer of the Pacific Northwest wilderness.

eventSpeakers.companyName: Emmy and Critics Choice-Nominated Comedian, Writer, and Actress
eventSpeakers.description:
Jessica Williams is a powerhouse storyteller who blends comedy, insight, and charm to spark meaningful conversations. You may know her from Apple TV+'s hit series Shrinking, where she stars alongside Jason Segel and Harrison Ford as the irresistibly witty therapist Gaby. This role earned her both Emmy and Critics Choice nominations. She's also stood out in films like Booksmart , The Incredible Jessica James , and Amazon MGM's record- breaking Road House reboot. But before she graced the big screen, Williams made history as the youngest—and first Black woman—correspondent on The Daily Show , where she tackled race, politics, and culture with sharp humor and fearless candor.

On stage, Williams is equally thought-provoking and hilarious, drawing from her experiences as a woman of color navigating Hollywood, media, and comedy. Whether unpacking the power of storytelling in social change, the role of humor in addressing complex topics like politics, or the importance of representation in entertainment and leadership, she delivers sharp insights with warmth and authenticity. Her keynotes inspire audiences, offering fresh perspectives on resilience, self-advocacy, and the intersection of comedy and activism.

Williams recently lent her voice to the character 'Meadow' in Netflix’s visually stunning adult-animated series Entergalactic, created by Kid Cudi. She also starred in the critically acclaimed HBO Max anthology series Love Life and reprised her role as the charming and whip-smart 'Lally' in Fantastic Beasts: The Secrets of Dumbledore. Over the years, she’s showcased her comedic chops in Patrick Brice’s indie comedy Corporate Animals and brought fresh energy to CBS All Access’s reboot of The Twilight Zone. Beyond the screen, Williams made waves in the podcast world with 2 Dope Queens, which she co-created with fellow comedian Phoebe Robinson. Born from their beloved Brooklyn live show, the podcast became a cultural phenomenon, celebrating diverse voices in comedy while tackling everything from romance to race with humor and heart. Its success led to a four-episode HBO special in 2018, further cementing Williams as a force in entertainment.

Her rise to prominence began in 2012 when she joined The Daily Show , making history as the youngest and first Black woman correspondent. Over four years, she delivered sharp, thought- provoking segments on race, gender, and politics — fearlessly taking on issues like police brutality, transgender rights, and sexism in government. With her signature wit and candor, she reshaped satirical news, earning a reputation as a fresh and necessary voice in comedy.

Before The Daily Show, Williams honed her craft in improv and stand-up with the Upright Citizens Brigade in Los Angeles, eventually landing on Variety’s prestigious “Top 10 Comics to Watch” list in 2012. A proud California State University, Long Beach graduate, she remains deeply connected to her roots in Los Angeles, where she continues to create, perform, and inspire.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Idea to Output: Firefly and Premiere on iPhone
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description: Paul Trani is Principal Director Evangelist at Adobe, where he is committed to empowering designers to expand creative boundaries and embrace emerging technologies. With more than 30 years of experience as an award-winning visual designer, instructor, and public speaker, Paul has established a global reputation for inspiring and educating creative communities. Beyond his professional endeavors, he is an avid enthusiast of racquet sports—including, of course, pickleball.

Zhiqin is a research scientist at Adobe based in Seattle. He received his PhD and Master's degree from Simon Fraser University, supervised by Prof. Hao (Richard) Zhang, and obtained his Bachelor's degree from Shanghai Jiao Tong University. His research interest is in computer graphics with a specialty in geometric modeling, machine learning, 3D reconstruction, and shape synthesis. He has received numerous awards recognizing his research contribution, including the best student paper award at CVPR 2020, Google PhD Fellowship in 2021, best paper award candidate at CVPR 2023, Alain Fournier Dissertation Award in 2024, and Eurographics PhD Thesis Award in 2024. His webpage is at https://czq142857.github.io/.

Valentin is a Senior Research Scientist at Adobe Research in London, where he develops methods for appearance, image understanding, and editing at the intersection of computer vision and computer graphics, working with the Substance and Photoshop teams. His work is regularly published at top venues such as SIGGRAPH and CVPR. Valentin earned his PhD at Inria, France and has received multiple honors, most recently the 2025 Eurographics Young Researcher Award. He also contributes actively to the graphics community through program committees, mentoring, and leadership roles within Eurographics.

Mohit Goel is a Senior Computer Scientist II at Adobe, where he helps shape the future of Adobe Illustrator. With deep expertise in performance, reliability, and AI-powered creativity, Mohit works to make Illustrator faster, smarter, and more intuitive for millions of designers worldwide.

Élie Michel is a Research Scientist with a focus on Computer Graphics, exploring how techniques from 3D modeling and rendering can be used to create novel interactive authoring workflows that integrate new content types emerging from generative AI and modern imaging systems. He received his Ph.D. in Computer Science from Institut Polytechnique de Paris, advised by Prof. Tamy Boubekeur.

Oriol Nieto is a Senior Research Engineer II at Adobe Research, where he works at the intersection of human-centered AI and audio creativity, spanning sound design, music, video editing, and agentic audio interfaces. He is one of the lead researchers behind Generative Sound Effects (Firefly), Generative Extend (Premiere Pro), and Audio Category Tagging (Premiere Pro). Oriol’s research has been cited thousands of times, and he holds over 10 approved patents from his 4+ years at Adobe. He has also contributed to key open-source tools like librosa and PyTorch. Outside of work, Oriol plays guitar, violin, cajón, and signs (and occasionally screams) in several musical projects.

Oindrila Saha is a Research Scientist Intern at Adobe and a Ph.D. candidate in Computer Science at the University of Massachusetts Amherst, where she is advised by Prof. Subhransu Maji. She earned her bachelor’s degree from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kharagpur. Her research explores methods for learning from limited and synthetic supervision for multimodal models, with applications to both discriminative and generative modeling. Her work has been published at premier venues in computer vision and machine learning, including CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ICML, and NeurIPS.

Zhixin is a Research Scientist at Adobe Research, where he has worked since 2020. He received his Ph.D. in Computer Science from Stony Brook University in 2019. His research explores the intersection of computer vision, computer graphics, and machine learning, with a particular focus on 3D modeling, reconstruction, relighting, controllable image generation, and image editing.

Jui-Hsien Wang is a Senior Research Scientist at Adobe, specializing in video models for both generation and understanding. He joined Adobe in 2020 after earning his PhD in Computational Mathematics from Stanford University. Jui is passionate about building tools that empower artists with new and efficient creative workflows. His research has been published at top computer vision and graphics conferences, including CVPR and SIGGRAPH. He is a founding member of Adobe’s video generation team and one of the lead developers behind recent Adobe video GenAI technologies such as GenExtend and Media Intelligence in Premiere Pro.

Lingzhi Zhang is a Research Scientist at Adobe, specializing in computer vision and machine learning. He is the lead researcher behind the modeling of the generative “Remove” feature in Photoshop and Lightroom. Before joining Adobe, he earned his Ph.D. in Computer Science at the University of Pennsylvania, where he was advised by Prof. Jianbo Shi. His research has been published at top academic conferences, including CVPR, ICCV, and ECCV.

sessionTrack.title: Mainstage Broadcast
sessionTrack.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.title: Project Trace Erase
cards.description: Say goodbye to clunky object removal. Project Trace Erase doesn’t just erase—it understands. Powered by diffusion transformer models, it removes objects and their shadows, reflections, and environmental distortions, delivering perfectly natural, context-aware edits with almost no manual cleanup.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Trace Erase

eventSpeakers.description: Lingzhi Zhang is a Research Scientist at Adobe, specializing in computer vision and machine learning. He is the lead researcher behind the modeling of the generative “Remove” feature in Photoshop and Lightroom. Before joining Adobe, he earned his Ph.D. in Computer Science at the University of Pennsylvania, where he was advised by Prof. Jianbo Shi. His research has been published at top academic conferences, including CVPR, ICCV, and ECCV.

cards.title: Project Frame Forward
cards.description: Forget frame-by-frame video editing. Project Frame Forward applies changes across entire videos based on one annotated frame and a simple text prompt. It brings the precision of photo editing to video, dramatically speeding up production without sacrificing quality.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Frame Forward

eventSpeakers.description: Jui-Hsien Wang is a Senior Research Scientist at Adobe, specializing in video models for both generation and understanding. He joined Adobe in 2020 after earning his PhD in Computational Mathematics from Stanford University. Jui is passionate about building tools that empower artists with new and efficient creative workflows. His research has been published at top computer vision and graphics conferences, including CVPR and SIGGRAPH. He is a founding member of Adobe’s video generation team and one of the lead developers behind recent Adobe video GenAI technologies such as GenExtend and Media Intelligence in Premiere Pro.

cards.title: Project Sound Stager
cards.description: Sound is emotion, and Project Sound Stager helps creators design it like never before. By analyzing a video’s visuals, pacing, and emotional tone, it automatically generates layered soundscapes using expert sound design logic. You can even collaborate conversationally with an AI “sound designer” to tweak the final mix.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Sound Stager

He is one of the lead researchers behind Generative Sound Effects (Firefly), Generative Extend (Premiere Pro), and Audio Category Tagging (Premiere Pro). Oriol’s research has been cited thousands of times, and he holds over 10 approved patents from his 4+ years at Adobe. He has also contributed to key open-source tools like librosa and PyTorch. Outside of work, Oriol plays guitar, violin, cajón, and signs (and occasionally screams) in several musical projects.

cards.title: Project Turn Style
cards.description: Move beyond flat images with Project Turn Style, a breakthrough that lets you edit 2D objects as if they were 3D. Rotate, reangle, or reposition elements within an image while maintaining their natural texture, lighting, and detail. The result: limitless creative control and dynamic storytelling.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Turn Style

eventSpeakers.description: Zhiqin is a research scientist at Adobe based in Seattle. He received his PhD and Master's degree from Simon Fraser University, supervised by Prof. Hao (Richard) Zhang, and obtained his Bachelor's degree from Shanghai Jiao Tong University. His research interest is in computer graphics with a specialty in geometric modeling, machine learning, 3D reconstruction, and shape synthesis. He has received numerous awards recognizing his research contribution, including the best student paper award at CVPR 2020, Google PhD Fellowship in 2021, best paper award candidate at CVPR 2023, Alain Fournier Dissertation Award in 2024, and Eurographics PhD Thesis Award in 2024. His webpage is at https://czq142857.github.io/.

cards.sessionTitle: Asia Pacific Day Two Keynote

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Celebrating Creators and Community at Adobe MAX
Stacy Martinet on Digital Access and Creativity Awards
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day Two Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Stacy Martinet has spent her career at the intersection of marketing, media, and technology.

As Adobe’s Vice President of Marketing Strategy and Communications, she leads a global team responsible for internal and external communications, including corporate communications, public affairs, product and customer communications, events, corporate social responsibility, industry analyst relations, as well as worldwide social media and influencer marketing. She first joined Adobe as Sr. Director of Marketing Strategy and Chief of Staff to the Company’s EVP and Chief Marketing Officer.

Before joining Adobe, Stacy was Chief Marketing Officer of Mashable. She was part of the company’s executive team — taking Mashable from a tech blog to a global consumer internet site. As CMO, she guided the company through explosive growth in users and advertisers, three rounds of funding, and a restructuring while architecting the company's marketing and communications strategy and building an integrated marketing organization across brand and demand generation channels.

Prior to Mashable, she spent nearly a decade in corporate communications and digital marketing at The New York Times during the company’s transition to digital which included a transformation of its journalism approach and the introduction of a digital subscription model. She was part of the team that pioneered the company’s first social media strategy and was recognized with the Chairman’s Award for innovation.

She was named by Folio’s Top Women in Media as a Corporate Visionary, as well as named to PR Week’s 40 Under 40 list. Stacy continues to speak and write about digital trends; her work has appeared in Mashable, The New York Times, Ad Week, and Cosmopolitan Magazine.

Stacy holds a patent for viral media content and is a member of several boards, including the Adobe Foundation board, the Ad Council board, and her past service to the New York Women in Communications board. Stacy is a graduate of Towson University.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Chief Marketing Officer & EVP, Global Marketing

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day Two Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Executive Vice President, Global Marketing. She is responsible for Adobe's global marketing and communications, delivering profitable business growth and building Adobe's renowned brand in an era of AI.

Prior to joining Adobe, she served as Chief Marketing Officer and General Manager, Strategic Partner Group of Intuit, Inc., the leading AI-driven global financial technology platform. She was responsible for marketing and communications across Intuit's brands and building the company's reputation. Lara also served as general manager of Intuit's ProTax group.

Lara has a proven track record of building world-class businesses and brands at companies such as Amazon, Visa and Nike where she held marketing leadership positions before joining Intuit. At Amazon, she led Worldwide Prime and Amazon North America Consumer Marketing, driving growth of the Prime membership program globally as well as the North America consumer business. Before Amazon, she held a variety of executive roles at Visa including Senior Vice President, Visa North America Marketing where she was responsible for all aspects of marketing for Visa's largest revenue-driving region. At Visa, she helped lead the company into the era of digital payments, launching ecommerce and mobile-first payments including Visa Checkout and Apple Pay.

She has been recognized on Forbes' World's Most Influential CMOs list as well as Forbes' Entrepreneurial CMO 50 and received AdWeek's CMO Vanguard Award.

Lara holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Pre-Law from the University of Washington and a Master of Business Administration from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Brandon Baum: Reimagining Storytelling with Firefly and Community Creativity
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day Two Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
BrandonB is a content creator known for his creative flair and engaging videos. Based in the UK, he specialises in VFX content that blends fantasy visuals, humour, and educational content, drawing in a diverse audience. With a combined following exceeding 22 million followers, his videos have garnered over 15 billion views across various social media platforms.

Frequently collaborating with prominent figures like Tom Holland, Tyson Fury, and Jake Gyllenhaal, Brandon has also attracted partnerships with leading brands, including Disney, Netflix, and Google.

Brandon also leads StudioB, an award-winning digital production company catering to global brands. Known for their deep understanding of social media and unique approach to content creation, StudioB excels at crafting content that resonates with audiences, helping brands achieve millions of impressions

eventSpeakers.companyName: American Inventor, Engineer, Educator, and YouTuber

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Mark Rober on Science, Storytelling, and Viral Impact
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day Two Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Mark Rober has amassed over 8 billion views by creating incredible science-focused builds and pranks on his YouTube channel, with 70 million subscribers and counting. In the summer of 2022, Rober announced his secret project, called CrunchLabs, a massive Willy Wonka-style factory of creativity in the San Francisco Bay Area, where the team creates each original, buildable engineering toys and the super fun (and science-packed) videos from scratch with an express focus on getting as many brains as possible excited about science and engineering.

Since its founding, CrunchLabs has offered a monthly subscription for kids that delivers original STEM toys and exclusive videos that entertain and teach STEM principles. Kids can’t get enough - the first run of Build Box sold out in under a week. Build Box's success paved the way for Hack Pack, the second product from CrunchLabs that demystifies coding and robotics for teens and adults with robot-in-a-box builds. Today, there are hundreds of thousands of subscribers and millions of boxes shipped. Plus, there are a few lucky subscribers each month who win an expenses-paid trip to hang out with Mark at his secret lab and more.

Rober is also known for his YouTube videos, including glitter bombing porch pirates and phone scammers, making mazes for squirrels in his backyard, the world's largest and smallest Nerf gun, and more. In 2020, he hosted a Livestream with Jimmy Kimmel called Color the Spectrum, which raised over $3M to support Autistic Adults in their communities. In 2019 Rober co-founded #TeamTrees alongside fellow YouTube creator MrBeast, which raised $20 million to plant 20 million trees. In late 2021, they followed up with #TeamSeas, which raised $30 million to clean up 30 million pounds of trash and plastic from rivers, beaches, and oceans

eventSpeakers.companyName: Award-winning Filmmaker and Co-Chair and CEO of DC Studios

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Jason Levine & James Gunn: Creativity, Ambition, and Authentic Storytelling
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day Two Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
James Gunn is the acclaimed filmmaker behind some of today’s most influential pop culture content and currently serves as Co-Chairman and CEO of DC Studios, alongside Peter Safran.

Gunn most recently wrote and directed the feature film “Superman”, released on July 11, 2025. One of the most highly anticipated films of the summer, Superman has earned over $614 million globally and received critical acclaim for its heartfelt story centered on humanity and kindness in a modern world that often overlooks those values.

Next, Gunn will debut the second season of the Emmy-nominated HBO Max series “Peacemaker” on August 21, 2025, for which he wrote and directed several episodes. His recent credits also include the animated HBO Max hit “Creature Commandos”, which premiered on December 5, 2024.

In 2021, Gunn brought his signature style to the Warner Bros. film “The Suicide Squad”, which he wrote and directed. The movie featured returning DC characters played by Margot Robbie, Viola Davis, Jai Courtney, and Joel Kinnaman, and introduced a new ensemble including Idris Elba, John Cena, Peter Capaldi, and others.

From that film, Gunn developed the HBO Max series “Peacemaker”, centered around Cena’s character. Premiering on January 13, 2022, the series was met with rave reviews and earned an Emmy nomination. Gunn’s work on the soundtrack—especially the viral dance sequence in the opening credits—received widespread praise.

In the Marvel Cinematic Universe, Gunn is best known for creating and directing the entire “Guardians of the Galaxy” trilogy. The franchise has earned over $2.4 billion worldwide. The original film was the second highest-grossing movie of 2014 and made Marvel history by spending five weekends at No. 1. The final installment, “Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3,” opened to $289.3 million and surpassed $835 million globally prior to its digital release. The trilogy won the Critics’ Choice Award for Best Action Movie and earned nominations from the Oscars, Grammys, BAFTAs, MTV Movie Awards, and People’s Choice Awards. Gunn received a WGA nomination for Best Adapted Screenplay in 2014.

Music plays a central role in Gunn’s storytelling. He personally curated the soundtracks for the Guardians films, with “Awesome Mix Vol. 1” becoming the first soundtrack made entirely of previously released songs to hit No. 1 on the Billboard charts. It was later certified Platinum. Vol. 2 ended 2017 as the eighth highest-selling album in the U.S., with 600,000 copies sold, and earned Gold certification.

Gunn’s earlier work includes the cult classics “Slither” and “Super”, as well as his breakthrough at Troma Entertainment, where he wrote the screenplay for “Tromeo & Juliet” (1997), which became a cult hit with extended midnight runs in Los Angeles.

Born and raised in St. Louis, Missouri, Gunn began making films at age twelve with his brother Sean Gunn, using an 8mm camera. While attending Columbia University, he landed a part-time job at Troma, which jumpstarted his screenwriting career.

From indie horror to blockbuster franchises, James Gunn has become one of the most distinctive and influential voices in modern filmmaking.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Jason Levine & James Gunn: Creativity, Ambition, and Authentic Storytelling
Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day Two Keynote

eventSpeakers.description: Jason Levine has traveled the globe inspiring and educating users on Adobe Creative Cloud with a focus on video, audio and mobile workflows. Levine has conducted training sessions for top broadcast corporations around the world including BBC, RTL and SVT. Prior to Adobe, Jason worked in the music industry, engineering hundreds of recordings which prompted the formation of BoodahJooMusic Publishing. Combining years of public performance and songwriting, he began laying down the foundation for a children’s music project entitled Just Play Music™. Over the past 25 years, Jason has presented to more than one million people around the world. He’s a multi-year “Adobe MAX Master” recipient and has become a staple on the AdobeMAX keynote stage. Beginning in 2023, Jason began a role ‘behind the stage’ as producer of the MAX Keynote.
