cards.title: An Insider’s Guide to InDesign and What’s New
cards.description:
Are you looking for the inside scoop on InDesign? Join the InDesign product team as they reveal a wealth of best practices, pro techniques, and productivity boosters designed to streamline your workflow. Whether you're an intermediate user or an aspiring creative professional, you'll gain practical knowledge to work smarter and accomplish more in less time.

In this session, you will:

  • Discover expert best practices and techniques
  • Experience, "Wow, I didn't know InDesign could do that!"
  • Explore the latest features to enhance your projects
  • Learn efficient methods to collaborate and work in teams
  • Get an exclusive preview of future InDesign developments
cards.sessionTitle: An Insider’s Guide to InDesign and What’s New

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: An Insider’s Guide to InDesign and What’s New

eventSpeakers.description: Vinay Pahlajani is the Director of Product Management for the Graphic Design & Publishing domain at Adobe. He has over 20 years of experience as a designer, entrepreneur and product manager in diverse fields including Product design, Game design, Animations and Film making.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: An Insider’s Guide to InDesign and What’s New

eventSpeakers.description: Pranjal is the Director for Product Engineering for InDesign family of products. With more than 23 years of experience, he has a strong passion for technology and building products that customers love to use.

cards.title: From Design to Motion: Animate with Photoshop and Adobe Firefly
cards.description:
Turn your visuals into compelling motion content using the combined power of Photoshop and Adobe Firefly. Join Adobe education evangelist Claudio Zavala Jr. to learn how to design stunning images, bring them to life with AI-generated video, and polish everything using traditional animation tools in Photoshop. Perfect for designers, marketers, and creators looking to elevate their content for brand campaigns, social media, portfolios, or commercial use.

In this lab, you’ll learn how to:

  • Design layered visuals in Photoshop ready for animation and storytelling
  • Use Firefly’s text-to-image tools to ideate and create custom scene elements
  • Transform still images into motion assets using Firefly’s text-to-video features
  • Apply timeline tools in Photoshop to edit, enhance, and refine animations
  • Build animated content that captivates clients and audiences alike
cards.sessionTitle: From Design to Motion: Animate with Photoshop and Adobe Firefly

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Get Ready for Some Time-saving Magic in Adobe Mobile Apps!
From Design to Motion: Animate with Photoshop and Adobe Firefly

eventSpeakers.description:
Claudio Zavala Jr. is a creative powerhouse, digital storytelling advocate, seasoned educator, and Adobe Education Evangelist. With over 25 years in K–12 education as a teacher, mentor, and edtech trainer, Claudio’s mission is simple: to empower educators and students to share their stories with impact and purpose—using the power of creativity and digital tools.

Claudio is passionate about inspiring others to bring ideas to life through photography, videography, and content creation. On his YouTube channel, he shares hands-on Adobe Express tutorials, digital storytelling tips, and behind-the-scenes of his creative journey.

He’s also a dynamic keynote speaker who has inspired audiences at ISTE, SXSW EDU, FETC, CUE, TCEA, and more—energizing educators with a message of creativity, innovation, and purpose-driven learning.

Claudio regularly leads Adobe Express for Education sessions on Adobe Live, where he showcases classroom-ready tips, creative lesson ideas, and practical ways to amplify student voice through media. Whether it's leading workshops or speaking at major conferences, Claudio is committed to helping educators infuse creativity into their practice.

He partners with school districts nationwide to lead professional development, inspire innovation, and build a culture of visual storytelling across classrooms. Claudio holds a Master’s in Instructional Design with a focus on Educational Technology and a Bachelor’s in Spanish—both from San Diego State University.

Based in the Dallas–Fort Worth area, Claudio’s creativity lives at the intersection of education, design, and storytelling. Connect with him online at claudiozavalajr.com or on social media @ClaudioZavalaJr—he’s always up for a good creative convo.

cards.title: Accelerate Your Design Career: DKNG’s Tips to Thrive as a Freelancer
cards.description:
If you're a creative who is curious about embarking on your own path, or if you already have a freelance career and want to level up, this session is for you. Join DKNG, the design and illustration duo of Nathan Goldman and Dan Kuhlken, as they reveal key steps that helped them kick off their own creative careers nearly 20 years ago. You’ll get a peek behind the curtain to see how DKNG built their business. They'll share real-world examples from their company's portfolio and demonstrate how they've put these lessons to use.

In this session Dan and Nathan will explore how to:

  • Find your niche and refine your portfolio
  • Land new clients and nurture existing ones
  • Price your work and services
  • Diversify your income and make your own products
cards.sessionTitle: Accelerate Your Design Career: DKNG’s Tips to Thrive as a Freelancer

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Accelerate Your Design Career: DKNG’s Tips to Thrive as a Freelancer

eventSpeakers.description: Nathan Goldman was initially drawn to the world of graphic design as a child, learning from his aunt who worked as a brand and textile designer. He eventually went on to graduate from the University of Southern California’s School of Film & Television with an emphasis in art direction and went on to work in the art department at Warner Bros. Television. Prior to joining DKNG as a full-time Creative Director, Nathan served as Director of Design at the USC Design Studio. He originally met future business partner Dan Kuhlken in high school where the two bonded over their shared interest in design and music, which in turn led to their first professional collaboration, creating gig posters for the world-famous Troubadour in Los Angeles. This initial collaboration led to the launch of DKNG as a professional design and illustration partnership. Today Nathan heads up the graphic design wing of DKNG. Nathan also has a passion for typography that comes in handy for the team’s lettering and branding projects. As a member of a design duo where each partner wears many hats, Nathan leads the client-facing and business strategy arms of DKNG. Over the past 12+ years, DKNG has garnered recognition for their work in poster design, branding, packaging, and advertising for clients including the United Nations, Nike, Audi, Clif Bar, USA Today, USPS, The Today Show, StubHub, and Disney, and for some of their favorite musical artists including Leon Bridges, The Black Keys, The National, Tom Petty, Eric Clapton, Jack White, and Van Morrison. Outside of client-based projects, the partners at DKNG continue to expand their own line of products including playing cards, art prints, and enamel pins. Nathan lives in San Diego, and can be found perfecting his pizza recipe when he’s not busy designing.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Accelerate Your Design Career: DKNG’s Tips to Thrive as a Freelancer

eventSpeakers.description: Dan Kuhlken’s journey as a fine artist began in childhood with a passion for painting and drawing and continued through his college years at CSULB where he began to hone his particular fusion of design and illustration. He met future business partner Nathan Goldman in high school where the two bonded over their shared interest in design and music, which in turn led to their first professional collaboration, creating gig posters for the world-famous Troubadour in Los Angeles. This initial collaboration led to the launch of DKNG as a professional design and illustration partnership. Today Dan serves as the lead illustrator for DKNG. Dan prides himself on being an illustration chameleon, working in many styles but with an emphasis in vector illustration, and specializing in producing screen printed work. As a member of a design duo where each partner wears many hats, Dan also leads the marketing and retail arms of DKNG. Part of those marketing efforts include a passion for sharing the DKNG process through videos, classes, and workshops. Over the past 20 years, DKNG has garnered recognition for their work in poster design, branding, packaging, and advertising for clients including the United Nations, Nike, Audi, Clif Bar, USA Today, USPS, The Today Show, StubHub, and Disney, and for some of their favorite musical artists including Leon Bridges, The Black Keys, The National, Tom Petty, Eric Clapton, Jack White, and Van Morrison. When not working with clients, Dan is actively building DKNG’s own line of products including playing cards, art prints, and enamel pins. Dan lives in Los Angeles, California.

cards.title: Learn from the BBC: Brand Consistency with Motion Graphic Templates

tags.title: Video, Audio, and Motion
tags.description: Learn how to edit your first video, transform static graphics into motion, create an animated explainer video, and apply visual effects to a marketing video. Leverage generative AI in your video workflow and collaborate with Frame.io.

cards.description:
Creating consistent, professional-looking video graphics for your brand can be tricky, especially when you’re juggling file sizes, different text lengths, or specific colors required by your brand’s style guide. Join Chris Converse to explore how to create Motion Graphics templates (MOGRTs) in After Effects that your company can use — over and over again in both After Effects and Premiere — to maintain brand consistency. Chris will show you how he helps in-house teams at companies, such as the BBC, maintain a consistent look and feel when producing engaging titles, visuals, and videos.

You’ll learn how:

  • The Essential Graphics panel in After Effects helps build a custom template without compromising visual identity
  • To create color combination sets that mirror your brands guidelines
  • Keying tools can lower file size while maintaining the highest fidelity
  • Nesting comps can help you navigate design challenges
  • Expressions can save time, eliminate complexity, and make your text truly standout
cards.sessionTitle: Learn from the BBC: Brand Consistency with Motion Graphic Templates

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Learn from the BBC: Brand Consistency with Motion Graphic Templates

eventSpeakers.description: Chris has over 30 years experience in graphic, animation, and interactive design, with a unique focus on both design and development. He earned his BFA in Graphic Design at the Rochester Institute of Technology (R•I•T), and has continued to study the landscape of design and its crossroads with various technologies. In addition to design and development, Chris has authored a wide range of articles for various publications and websites, created and taught over 100 online courses, and has been a featured speaker in over 325 industry-related events, conferences and webinars, including NAB, Adobe MAX, Post Production World, How Design Live, AIGA, CreativePro Week, CreativeLive, PHOTOPLUS, and more. Find Chris’ upcoming events at codifydesign.com/events.

cards.title: Peak Performance: Where Creativity Meets Content Velocity

tags.title: Creativity and Marketing in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. They’ll cover everything from brand reinvention and strategy to supercharging creative workflows to new tools for scaling campaign assets.

cards.description:
Every brand has a high-stakes moment when marketing and creative teams are pushed to their limits. For Intuit, that’s Tax Season — four months of rapid-fire campaigns, shifting priorities, and pressure to perform at scale.

Join Audrey Timpe, Staff Communications Manager at Intuit, and Danielle de Granville, Senior Product Marketing Manager at Adobe, as they share how TurboTax reimagined its busiest season using Adobe GenStudio. You’ll hear behind-the-scenes stories of real-world GenAI use — from early missteps to transformative workflow breakthroughs — and how freeing up creative time unlocked more meaningful storytelling and smarter scaling.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Manage high-volume, high-velocity creative demand with less burnout and backlog
  • Structure GenAI experiments with rigor and clarity
  • Build frameworks to expand from pilot wins to enterprise-wide adoption
  • Bring Adobe GenStudio into your workflow for efficiency, performance, and culture wins
cards.sessionTitle: Peak Performance: Where Creativity Meets Content Velocity

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Peak Performance: Where Creativity Meets Content Velocity

eventSpeakers.description:
Danielle de Granville is a Senior Product Marketing Manager at Adobe, where she drives go-to-market for GenStudio for Performance Marketing—helping creative and marketing teams ship faster, test more, and stay on brand with a little help from generative AI.

Her background spans advertising, gaming, and productivity software—launching stop-motion ads for The New Yorker, shaping platform and performance marketing strategy for Minecraft, and driving viral product loops at Calendly.

Danielle believes everyone is creative and that everything is shaped by design—from campaigns to how we spend our time. She holds an MBA and MS in Design Innovation from Northwestern and brings a human-centered lens to building tools that make room for both speed and soul.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Peak Performance: Where Creativity Meets Content Velocity

eventSpeakers.description:
Audrey is a digital strategist, content creator, and community builder with a decade of experience growing audiences, launching trend-driven campaigns, and turning scrolls into stories that stick. From leading real-time activations during the Super Bowl to building TikTok communities from scratch, she specializes in helping brands show up where it matters most — authentically and impactfully.

She blends creative instincts and trend-savvy storytelling with data analysis to build communities that drive engagement, growth, and brand love. Her work is rooted in a belief that high-quality content prioritizes connection and emotional reaction over mere polish.

cards.description:
Join London-based illustrator Dan Mumford as he shares his journey from sketch to finished piece, working across Photoshop and Fresco. Gain insights into how personal experiences and artistic choices shape the creative process, and explore how the creator is reflected in the work itself. Along the way, Dan will demonstrate the key techniques and tools he uses to bring depth, emotion, and story to his illustrations.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Build compositions using Photoshop and Fresco
  • Apply color theory, light, and shadow to strengthen your visuals
  • Tell compelling stories through visual cues
  • Stay connected to your creative “happy place” while working
  • Reflect your personal voice and experiences in your art

tags.title: Generative AI
tags.description: While AI is reshaping the creative landscape, human imagination has never been more essential or more powerful. Discover how generative AI features in your favorite Adobe tools will help you speed workflows, expand your skillset, and gain greater creative control.

cards.description:
Elevate your brand’s visuals — no big budget or VFX team required. Join DGA Director and MAX veteran AJ Bleyer and discover how to harness Adobe’s cutting-edge generative AI tools to transform your creative process. In this session, tailored for in-house creatives, AJ will show you how to craft compelling brand content, from polished commercials to engaging social campaigns, using tools already at your fingertips. Whether you’re producing product promos, corporate narratives, or social media assets, this session will inspire you to rethink what’s possible for your in-house team.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Reimagine your pre-production workflow — empower your brand to stand out before the camera even rolls
  • Integrate generative AI into pre-production for client-ready treatments and concepts
  • Enhance and reimagine existing brand footage using generative AI
  • Craft stunning visual effects tailored for your brand’s aesthetic
cards.sessionTitle: Elevating In-House Brand Content with Generative AI

Elevating In-House Brand Content with Generative AI
Unleash Your Creativity: Break Free from Repetitive Content with Gen AI

eventSpeakers.description:
Trying to marry his passion for cars and cameras, AJ began shooting automotive videos with his high school friends. His work caught the attention of local car dealerships, and at age 22 he left his job at Apple to pursue filmmaking full-time. He founded Advent Films, and quickly became a trusted shooter for many of the world’s most prestigious brands including Ferrari, McLaren F1, Aston Martin, Red Bull, Riot Games, Amazon, and more.

Despite rejection from every film school he applied to, AJ was accepted into the DGA as one of the Guild’s youngest directors at age 27. Known for dynamic angles and an unforgiving attention to detail, AJ specializes in action-packed commercials featuring vehicle stunts, pyrotechnics, skydiving, and low-flying helicopters. Pretty much anything that freaks his parents out.

When he’s not working on movies or driving cars, AJ has also established himself as a veteran industry keynote speaker at TEDx, NAB, and AdobeMAX.

cards.title: AI Is Here. Now What? Insights from an Amazon Creative Studio

tags.title: Generative AI
tags.description: While AI is reshaping the creative landscape, human imagination has never been more essential or more powerful. Discover how generative AI features in your favorite Adobe tools will help you speed workflows, expand your skillset, and gain greater creative control.

cards.description:
AI is everywhere — but how do we use it without losing what makes creative work matter?

Join Jocelyn Chang, Creative Director of Generative AI at Amazon Devices Brand Studio, for an inside look at how one team is navigating the real-world challenges of AI adoption. Learn how they’re building practical frameworks to integrate tools like Adobe Firefly while upholding creative standards, legal requirements, and brand integrity. From early concepts to production-ready content, explore how creative teams can evolve with AI while staying grounded in what makes their work human.

Key takeaways:

  • How one Amazon team decides when — and when not — to use AI
  • Real-world use cases for Adobe Firefly in concepting and production
  • Approaches to creative, legal, and brand concerns
  • Tactics for upskilling talent and leading sustainable change
cards.sessionTitle: AI Is Here. Now What? Insights from an Amazon Creative Studio

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: AI Is Here. Now What? Insights from an Amazon Creative Studio

eventSpeakers.description: Jocelyn Chang is the creative director leading generative AI strategy and scale initiatives for Amazon’s Devices Brand Studio. Working at the intersection of design, strategy, and technology, she shapes how AI is transforming the way teams create – developing visual evaluation frameworks, collaborating with science and engineering partners, and guiding the integration of proprietary and third-party tools to meet the highest standards of brand expression. Prior to this role, Jocelyn led creative strategy, brand systems, and customer-facing storytelling across the full portfolio of Amazon devices for offline retail. Before joining Amazon, she was a designer and art director at a boutique San Francisco agency, creating identity systems and multi-channel experiences for brands like Nike, Google, and Hydro Flask. She began her career as a strategy consultant and CPG brand manager, giving her a hybrid foundation of business insight and hands-on creative expertise – a perspective that continues to shape how she contributes to systems, storytelling, and the future of creative work. Jocelyn holds an AB in Economics and an MBA from Stanford University, and a BFA in Graphic Design from California College of the Arts. Outside of work, she enjoys exploring trails and neighborhoods in and around San Francisco.

His creative journey started at 17 when he got caught doing street art, and landed his first gig designing a store window. From wallpaper designer in London to creative director at top agencies, he's done it all. Former creative director at The Wern and co-founder of Hypeyourself.com, he’s on a mission to help creatives stand out. Author of Brand Yourself, Hadrien brings big energy and creativity.

cards.title: Real-Time Camera-to-Cloud Workflow with Frame.io

tags.title: Video, Audio, and Motion
tags.description: Learn how to edit your first video, transform static graphics into motion, create an animated explainer video, and apply visual effects to a marketing video. Leverage generative AI in your video workflow and collaborate with Frame.io.

cards.description:
Move from capture to client-ready — without leaving set. In this hands-on Adobe MAX session, Fujifilm pros will show how native Camera to Cloud (C2C) integration streams photos and video straight from supported Fujifilm bodies into Frame.io and the Adobe apps you use every day. Watch a live team — photographer, DP, editor, and art director — shoot on location, auto-upload to the cloud, and collaborate in real time to build a deliverable you can actually ship. Whether you lead a brand studio, produce fast-turn social, or manage agency campaigns, you’ll see precisely how to shorten review cycles, keep stakeholders aligned, and protect files and metadata from capture through approval.

You’ll leave knowing how to:

  • Go from camera to complete in less time and with less friction — learn the Camera-to-Cloud workflow and witness its practical applications firsthand
  • Engage in hands-on activities involving live content uploading and editing directly from the cloud — hand off instantly to Lightroom, Photoshop, Premiere, or After Effects — no card pulls
  • Utilize tools to create galleries and facilitate reviews with stakeholders and clients, streamlining the feedback and approval process
cards.sessionTitle: Real-Time Camera-to-Cloud Workflow with Frame.io

eventSpeakers.description: Driven by a passion for impactful storytelling, Jackie founded Pairadox Studios, a boutique production company that creates high-quality video content for brands, platforms, and digital campaigns. In her current role, she also leads content marketing at Fujifilm North America, where she combines her production expertise with strategic brand messaging to elevate visual storytelling.

Rich Harrington has had a lifelong relationship with media. At seven, he was grounded for using magnets to warp the family’s 13-inch color TV (it works—don’t try it). Since then he’s chased far better experiments. Rich helps creative pros make sharper, cleaner, on-brand content—without getting lost in menus. An Adobe Certified Master Trainer and early voice in digital photography and nonlinear editing, he turns complex tools into simple, repeatable techniques you can use right away in Photoshop, Premiere Pro, and After Effects. His passion is creating assistive AI that enhances—not invents—pixels: smart exposure and white-balance fixes, noise reduction, tone mapping, and dependable auto-color. He also designs intuitive workflow systems that organize content the way the brain works. He’s held product design and product management roles with Radiant Imaging Labs, Mylio, Skylum, and EyeQ. Beyond the stage, Rich consults for technology companies and nonprofits—clarifying product vision, empowering customers with credible education, and building authentic community events. A former broadcast journalist, he brings a storyteller’s eye and an editor’s pragmatism to every session. He’s authored 30+ books and 200+ video courses, spoken at major conferences worldwide since 2003, chaired programs for the National Association of Broadcasters, and mentors the community at RichardHarrington.com. If you’re after real-world techniques, smart workflow, and a few “wait—how did I not know that?” moments, come hang out with Rich. Off the clock, he’s with his wife, Meghan, traveling, making photos, and introducing his kids to science fiction and comic books. If it involves pop culture, Rich is plugged in. Gadgets and gizmos? He’s your guy. He believes our world is cluttered with confusing messages. His philosophy: communicate, motivate, create. Media has real power—and he’s eager to help on your next project.

eventSpeakers.description:
Lisa Carney is a high-end retoucher, photographer, and educator with over two decades of experience in the entertainment industry. Known for her bold, cinematic aesthetic and fast, professional workflows, Lisa has worked with top-tier clients including Apple, Netflix, CBS, Showtime, Disney, and Paramount. Her work spans movie posters, streaming campaigns, editorial, and high-end commercial photography.

A graduate of Art Center College of Design, Lisa brings a photographer’s eye to every pixel she touches. She is a featured speaker at Adobe MAX, CreativePro, and Photoshop World, and is an Adobe Community Expert. Passionate about mobile creativity, she specializes in teaching Lightroom Mobile and Photoshop for fast, artistic edits on the go. When she’s not retouching or shooting, Lisa shares her expertise through online courses, tutorials, and global events—always with a down-to-earth, energetic style that demystifies pro-level techniques.

cards.title: Creating the Impossible: Smarter Workflows and Boundless Storytelling
cards.description:
Discover how A+E Global Media (home to iconic brands A&E, HISTORY and LifetimeTV) continues to evolve their content in the multiplatform ecosystem, with such recent projects as Holy Marvels using the power of Adobe Firefly to create stunning scenes never captured by a camera. Collaborative workflows powered by LucidLink and Frame.io fuel their creativity, enabling the team to work seamlessly across locations. Paired with Premiere, their workflow frees A+E Global Media to focus less on logistics and more on storytelling. In this session A+E Global Media will walk you through how you can:

  • Build a streamlined, cloud-first workflow using LucidLink -Speed up review and approval cycles with Frame.io
  • Edit and polish with Adobe Premiere
  • Unlock new creative possibilities with Adobe Firefly to generate scenes, imagery, and concepts that extend beyond what’s possible to capture
  • Apply these tools to any creative pursuit, from client work to personal passion projects

Whether you’re a freelancer, content creator, or part of a growing creative team, you’ll walk away with practical tools and fresh inspiration to create without disrupting existing processes.

cards.title: From Prompt to Activation: Supercharge the Full Marketing Value Chain
cards.description:
Let’s be real: the content grind is relentless. Creatives are expected to deliver more, faster, and flawlessly — all in service of media activations. So, why should you care about media when your list is already long? Think of this as your critical guide to why creative and media need to be linked more than ever before. We’re talking about using AI not as a shortcut, but as a creative amplifier — one that helps you scale your vision without watering it down. From concept to campaign, we’ll show you how to collapse timelines, boost precision, and plug your ideas into the full marketing value chain. Dentsu Creative’s Jovan Dupor, Head of Performance & Innovation Strategy, and Octavio Maron, EVP, Head of Content & Creative, will break down how to:

  • Transform a single idea into a scalable campaign
  • Fluidly sync creative and media for real impact
  • Use AI to amplify, not replace, your originality
cards.sessionTitle: From Prompt to Activation: Supercharge the Full Marketing Value Chain

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Anime, Manga and Beyond: Take Your Sketches to Screen and scale
From Prompt to Activation: Supercharge the Full Marketing Value Chain

eventSpeakers.description: Octavio Maron is the Global Creative Lead for Adobe at Dentsu Creative, where he leads the creative strategy and execution across Adobe’s global marketing ecosystem. His work centers on building scalable, insight-driven creative systems that power the modern content supply chain—connecting storytelling, production, and delivery with precision and agility. In addition to his Adobe role, Octavio serves as Performance Creative Co-Lead at Dentsu Creative, helping shape the network’s approach to data-informed creativity and consumer experience. With over 20 years of experience in advertising, he’s known for solving complex business challenges through creativity, technology, and operational design. Prior to Dentsu, Octavio was Executive Creative Director at Publicis, where he led digital innovation for global brands including Chevrolet, Samsung, and P&G. A featured speaker at Cannes Lions on “Mobile First World,” he brings a global mindset and a passion for building creative ecosystems that drive both brand impact and business growth.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Head of Innovation and Performance, Dentsu Creative

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Anime, Manga and Beyond: Take Your Sketches to Screen and scale
From Prompt to Activation: Supercharge the Full Marketing Value Chain

eventSpeakers.description: Jovan Dupor is Head of Innovation and Performance Strategy at Dentsu Creative with over 15 years of experience in data-driven performance creative. Known for being a first mover on new digital platforms and technologies, he has helped organizations develop impactful, outcomes-based creative strategies, rich audience insights that fuel hyper-personalized content at scale, and innovative creative solutions that help clients deliver and rapidly optimize omni-channel customer experiences. He has successfully guided cross-functional teams in translating business objectives into compelling strategies across a diverse set of clients and verticals. He’s helped drive measurable and meaningful business results for major clients like Visa, SoFi, Cisco, Samsung, Intel, Albertson’s, Adobe, Sony, Burger King and Lowe’s.

cards.title: Turbocharge Your Illustrator Game: Speed, Shortcuts, & Optimization
cards.description:
Logo designer James Barnard reveals his secrets for working lightning fast in Illustrator to test and refine his logo designs. You’ll discover how to set up your hardware, customize your workspaces and keyboard shortcuts, plus additional tricks that’ll have you flying around Illustrator and cranking out design iterations faster than ever. This session starts with the fundamental tools you need to work up logo designs, followed by workflow techniques designed to optimize your output and increase your efficiency — which means more clients through the door.

In this session, James will share:

  • A glimpse into his logo design process
  • Desktop setup and workspace guidelines
  • Custom Illustrator shortcuts, actions, and templates
  • Advice on custom hardware
cards.sessionTitle: Turbocharge Your Illustrator Game: Speed, Shortcuts, & Optimization

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Turbocharge Your Illustrator Game: Speed, Shortcuts, & Optimization
Turning Likes into Leads: Navigating Social Media as a Designer

eventSpeakers.description:
James is an award-winning logo and visual identity designer, educator, international speaker and owner of logo design studio Barnard Co.

As a former designer for the magazine and newspaper industry in the UK, James has more than 15 years of experience. These days he runs his operation from the Gold Coast, Australia.

James splits his time between client work and design education. His content, which he shares with his 1M+ followers, focuses on how to be a better designer, navigating your software, plus the common pitfalls of the logo design industry.

cards.title: Designing a Killer Brand: Behind the Story and Process

tags.title: Branding
tags.description: Stand out in a competitive landscape and leave a lasting impression by creating a powerhouse brand strategy. From crafting a brand vision to implementing it across all marketing and social channels, you’ll gain the tools to elevate your brand to new heights.

cards.description:
Creating a brand that continuously captures attention is critical — and more challenging than ever. Which brands are getting it right, and which are falling short? See how Lincoln Design Co. built its agency brand — what worked and what fell flat. Plus, you’ll get an inside view of a client’s brand missteps and the secrets to turning those mishaps around. Your brand is more than a logo — it’s a cultural force that matters to you, your client, and (when done effectively) the world. Discover the branding blueprint for infusing culture, authenticity, and lasting impact.

On this journey, you’ll discover:

  • What it takes to build a killer brand in today’s overcrowded market
  • The story of a brand like Lincoln Design Co.
  • A brand case study on what doesn’t work
  • Why culture and authenticity matter
cards.sessionTitle: Designing a Killer Brand: Behind the Story and Process

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Designing a Killer Brand: Behind the Story and Process

eventSpeakers.description: Dan Janssen is the Chief Creative Officer at Lincoln Design Co., a branding studio known for bold work, sharp design, and a strong creative culture. He kicked off his career at DC Shoes in San Diego, designing in the heart of the skate and action sports scene. In 2005, he launched his first agency, which grew into what’s now Lincoln Design Co. With over two decades in the game, Dan has led creative for brands like Nike, Netflix, Hasbro, Hot Wheels, Monster Energy, and Liquid Death.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Designing a Killer Brand: Behind the Story and Process

eventSpeakers.description: Dustin Noden is a Creative Director at Lincoln Design Co., where he helps lead bold creative rooted in modern culture and design. With a deep love for visual storytelling and a sharp sense of what’s next, Dustin brings a fresh perspective to every project. He’s also the co-founder of Kern Club, a creative font foundry that celebrates unique typefaces. At Lincoln, he’s helped guide work for top brands across the sports, lifestyle, and entertainment industries.

cards.title: After Effects for Designers: From Static to Motion
cards.description:
If you’re a designer familiar with Photoshop, Illustrator, or other Adobe tools, this session will feel like a natural next step. Industry expert Luisa Winters will help you understand how to bring your static designs to life using the animation tools in Adobe After Effects. We’ll focus on the similarities between After Effects and the design programs you already know — making it easier to dive into keyframing, working with layers, shape animation, and text effects. Along the way, you’ll also explore AI-powered tools like Content-Aware Fill and Roto Brush 2, which simplify time-consuming tasks like subject isolation and object removal.

Key Takeaways:

  • Animate layered artwork from Photoshop and Illustrator
  • Understand the After Effects interface through the lens of design
  • Use keyframes, motion paths, and animation presets with confidence
  • Incorporate AI-assisted tools like Content-Aware Fill and Roto Brush 2
  • Export your animations for web, social media, and motion graphics projects

No prior animation experience required—just a designer’s eye and a curiosity for motion.
cards.sessionTitle: After Effects for Designers: From Static to Motion

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: After Effects for Designers: From Static to Motion

eventSpeakers.description:
Luisa Winters is an esteemed subject matter expert, instructor, and consultant specializing in Adobe products. Her consultancy services extend to various sectors, including broadcast, advertising, and governmental organizations. Luisa is actively engaged in delivering expert training and workshops across a multitude of prestigious training centers both within the United States and internationally.

Renowned in the creative community, Luisa frequently contributes as a speaker at various industry conferences, where she shares her insights on multiple subjects, such as video editing, compositing, drone technology, and web development. Her expertise is rooted in more than 30 years of dedicated experience in video production and cinematography, making her a pivotal figure in the field. Luisa continues to inspire and educate, driving innovation and excellence in the digital media landscape.

For professional inquiries or to engage with Luisa Winters’ wealth of knowledge, connect on her social channels or email her at luisa@videotrainers.com.

cards.title: Photoshop & Lightroom: the Brand Builder's Workflow

tags.title: Graphic Design and Illustration
tags.description: Bring your creative vision to life. Learn how you can leverage new generative AI tools to assist your content development, create in new ways, and gain more control over your workflows and outputs. Get inspired to revisit the way you approach design.

cards.description:
Learn how to harness the power of Photoshop and Lightroom to create a streamlined cross-app workflow that empowers designers to build and maintain a cohesive brand identity in this session. Join Rocky Montez-Carr, a professional retoucher and software quality engineer on the Photoshop team, to see how this powerful pair of cloud-connected tools help you work more efficiently while creating content with a distinctive look and feel that represents your brand consistently.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Apply consistent visual styles, using Lightroom presets and batch editing, to build a unified brand presence
  • Use Lightroom to quickly import, organize, and prep product or campaign images for further enhancement
  • Move fluidly between Lightroom and Photoshop to refine, retouch, and customize your assets with full creative control
  • Develop reusable Photoshop templates and Smart Objects to speed up design work while keeping everything on-brand
  • Deliver polished, professional assets fast — whether for web, print, or social
cards.sessionTitle: Photoshop & Lightroom: the Brand Builder's Workflow

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Photoshop & Lightroom: the Brand Builder's Workflow

eventSpeakers.description: Rocky Montez-Carr is a Product Marketing Manager for Photoshop at Adobe, blending technical expertise with his passion for photography, digital imaging and design. As a freelance retoucher, he has worked with many photographers and celebrities, helping bring their creative visions to life. Deeply connected to the photography community, Rocky is dedicated to improving digital imaging tools and empowering artists to create their best work.

cards.title: Brands of the Future: Where Creativity Meets Intelligence
cards.description:
As content, culture, and technology evolve at lightning speed, the brands that thrive are those that anticipate and act ahead of trends. Join Adobe’s director Viggy Madhav, senior director Ann Rich, and head of product marketing Aaron Finegold to explore how brand expression now lives across dynamic content, co-created experiences, and personalized interactions — far beyond static guidelines.

In a world where every moment can shape brand perception, AI offers new creative power — along with the risk of losing a brand’s essence. How do you stay consistent, inspired, and ready?

In this session, you’ll discover:

  • The next wave of brand intelligence rooted in creativity
  • AI-ready brand use cases across marketing and design
  • How to empower teams through intelligent creative systems
cards.sessionTitle: Brands of the Future: Where Creativity Meets Intelligence

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Sr. Director Firefly Enterprise, GenStudio & Platform

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Brands of the Future: Where Creativity Meets Intelligence

eventSpeakers.description: Ann Rich is a Sr Director of Design leading Firefly Enterprise, GenStudio, plus Monetization and Platform Design at Adobe. A strategic, system and business-oriented designer, she pushes the boundaries of how we unify and amplify the power of Adobe to create exceptional, effortless experiences for our customers. As a multidisciplinary leader, Ann brings a holistic approach to product and design strategy. This is reflected in her tenure at Adobe, where she’s had the opportunity to work across the company in diverse roles spanning strategic facilitation, UX architecture, customer experience and insights strategy, growth product management, CX AI agents, platform experience, and physical space strategy through Adobe’s Lab82.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Head of Product Marketing, Firefly Enterprise

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Brands of the Future: Where Creativity Meets Intelligence

eventSpeakers.description: Aaron joined Adobe earlier this year, after leadership roles at LinkedIn, McKinsey, and Ogilvy. He looks after product marketing for Firefly Services, Firefly Custom Models, and Firefly Creative Production. He has been published in McKinsey Quarterly, HBR, and Thrive Global; and has appeared in the New York Times, Fortune Magazine, and on NPR.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Brands of the Future: Where Creativity Meets Intelligence

eventSpeakers.description: Viggy has been a designer at Adobe for over 16 years, contributing to flagship products including Acrobat, Adobe XD, and Adobe Express. He is currently focused on Firefly Enterprise and GenStudio, building AI-powered tools that enable teams and organizations to create on-brand content at scale and with unprecedented speed. Outside of work, Viggy enjoys woodworking, bringing the same creativity and craftsmanship to the workshop that he applies to his design work.

cards.title: Ditch the Dull: Build a Brand Identity with Bite
cards.description:
In today’s saturated market, a standout brand is everything. Join Kristy Campbell, brand identity expert, Pink Pony Creative founder, and "Creative Cowgirl," as she shares how to build brands with bite through bold visuals, rich storytelling, and unmistakable personality.

In this energetic session, Kristy will share:

  • Behind-the-scenes of the "Pink Pony Process"
  • How to tell stories through visual identity
  • Tips for creating in-depth brand guideline docs
  • How to layer design elements to ooze personality
cards.sessionTitle: Ditch the Dull: Build a Brand Identity with Bite

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Kristy Campbell: Building Bold Brands & Creative Confidence
Ditch the Dull: Build a Brand Identity with Bite

eventSpeakers.description: Kristy Campbell, founder of Pink Pony Creative, is a New Zealand-based Brand Identity and Graphic Designer renowned for her daring, vibrant, and boundary-pushing approach to branding. With clients all over the world, Kristy believes in the power of cultivating a distinct visual identity to propel businesses to success. She embraces an ‘anything but boring’ aesthetic in design and business, and with a name like “Pink Pony”, you know she works a little differently. Beyond business, Kristy thrives on building communities within the industry, empowering individuals to showcase their unique personalities and skills, paving the way for their own success.
